story:
I am Temo Tskrialashvili artist from Tbilisi, Georgia. I began my professional career as a waiter and now I have a little room in my flat for woodworking, painting and teaching children. You can find my artworks on my website and official page on Facebook.

In the video me and my daughter Mari are making a necklace with Aquarius Sign on it. Mari is Aquarius, so we decided to show you the process of creating it. 

In previous month me and Mari visited Svetitskhoveli Cathedral and she liked the Fresco with Zodiac Signs below and there we decided decided to start a new project to create zodiac signs necklaces using ancient Fresco of Svetitskoveli Cathedral - Georgian Orthodox Cathedral located in the historical town of Mtskheta, Georgia. 


I desire to modernize these unique zodiac signs and suggest it anyone who wants to wear necklace with these signs on them.  If you like this idea, support us!
Our mission is to give the new life to ancient Georgian relics. I want to introduce the new vision of unique cultural heritage that is almost forgotten. I believe that history never stays silent, it gives us inspiration and wonderful possibilities to create modern art.

I need some specific materials to create the necklaces: 

1. Proxxon 28510 12-Volt Rotary Tool Micromot 50/E - $ 50;

2. Delta Power Tools 40-694 20 In. Variable Speed Scroll Saw - $ 400;

3. Wood - $ 70;

4. Faux leather and ropes - $ 25;

5. Agate - $ 55; 

6. Silver - $ 35;

7. Enamel - $ 75.

Here is final version of Aquarius Necklace


Yesterday my daughter said to me: Let´s do it, daddy. And now I hope you will support us to do it and give chance to anyone to wear these unique signs on their necks. 

Thank you!

The Chvrch of John eat+drink

We are opening the Chvrch of John in December of 2015, in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. The space is going to be a restaurant, bar, social space and venue, celebrating art, artists and music on a daily basis. We couldn’t be more excited!!!

While we will be opening as soon as possible, we have had to make some budget concessions, forcing us to put much of the wanted art on the back shelf for the time being.

We have started, and will continue contracting many artists to produce items for the space, but treating art as a business, we wondered, “What can we do to get them money faster?”

This is where we need your help.  While we will be able to open and begin doing business, we are still looking to help fund these artists to get their art made faster. The faster we can help get them money, the sooner they can turn a profit, and in turn, go on to create more art!

While the campaign goal is only a fraction of what we need to raise to pay for the items, it is a base for us to help get them started.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the overview:

•  100% of the funds raised go directly to Artists, based out of Edmonton. Whether we fall short of our goal, or blow it out of the water, this is our commitment.

•  We have created some fun & exciting experiences with our perks! We hope you like them as much as we do!

Artist that are committed to this first wave of installations:

•  Tomnuk Designs [http://www.tomnuk.com]

•  Art by Pekoe [http://artbypekoe.com]

•  Dominika Koziak [http://www.dominikakoziak.com]

•  Eckz Studioz [http://www.eckz.ca]

•  Jack Lumber Co [http://cargocollective.com/jacklumberco]

•  Suka Clothing [http://sukaclothing.tumblr.com]

•  Design by Komputer [http://www.travisnesbitt.com]

•  Cory Johnn Photography [http://coryjohnn.com]

The Impact

Within our first year, we will be able to host dozens of artists within our space to showcase their products and talents. Fine art and industrial art however are huge costs, and we want to help them build their businesses. Not only are they some of the most exciting talents that #YEG has to offer, they are people who live and work here, spending their money in back into our economy.  Edmonton has some of the best people in the world, and we want to help support them in whatever ways we can.

•  Local investment in people and business helps build our economy in a well rounded manner

•  Art breeds Art. Most of the money spent towards art, is an investment in opportunity for creation of more products.

To be Clear…

This is NOT an ask for ‘You’ to invest in making this space ‘Nicer’ or ‘More Profitable’. This is an ask for help get these artist working, and creating products with profits going directly to them.

•  100% of the funds go to the artists listed.

•  If we fall short of our goal, or do not raise money, we will still be investing in these artists, but unfortunately not for months after our opening

•  If we raise More money than our goal, we will be able to invest in these artists, and give them an opportunity to make a better market value for their products.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow and Share!!! We want you to know more about us, hope to see you in our space!

•  Website: www.thechvrchofjohn.com

•  Instagram: @thechvrchofjohn

•  Twitter: @thechvrchofjohn

•  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thechvrch/

•  Contact: thechvrch@gmail.com & kristoffer@thechvrchofjohn.com
story_txt:
The Chvrch of John
eat+drink
We are opening the
Chvrch of John in December of 2015, in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. The space is
going to be a restaurant, bar, social space and venue, celebrating art, artists
and music on a daily basis. We couldn’t be more excited!!!
While we will be
opening as soon as possible, we have had to make some budget concessions,
forcing us to put much of the wanted art on the back shelf for the time being. 
We have started, and
will continue contracting many artists to produce items for the space, but
treating art as a business, we wondered, “What can we do to get them money
faster?”
This is where we need
your help.  While we will be able to open
and begin doing business, we are still looking to help fund these artists to
get their art made faster. The faster we can help get them money, the sooner
they can turn a profit, and in turn, go on to create more art! 
While the campaign
goal is only a fraction of what we need to raise to pay for the items, it is a
base for us to help get them started.
What We Need &
What You Get
Here is the overview:
•  100% of the funds raised go directly to
Artists, based out of Edmonton. Whether we fall short of our goal, or blow it
out of the water, this is our commitment.
•  We have created some fun & exciting
experiences with our perks! We hope you like them as much as we do!
Artist that are committed
to this first wave of installations:
•  Tomnuk Designs [http://www.tomnuk.com]
•  Art by Pekoe [http://artbypekoe.com]
•  Dominika Koziak [http://www.dominikakoziak.com]
•  Eckz Studioz [http://www.eckz.ca]
•  Jack Lumber Co [http://cargocollective.com/jacklumberco]
•  Suka Clothing [http://sukaclothing.tumblr.com]
•  Design by Komputer [http://www.travisnesbitt.com]
•  Cory Johnn Photography [http://coryjohnn.com]
The Impact
Within our first year,
we will be able to host dozens of artists within our space to showcase their
products and talents. Fine art and industrial art however are huge costs, and
we want to help them build their businesses. Not only are they some of the most
exciting talents that #YEG has to offer, they are people who live and work
here, spending their money in back into our economy.  Edmonton has some of the best people in the
world, and we want to help support them in whatever ways we can. 
•  Local investment in people and business
helps build our economy in a well rounded manner
•  Art breeds Art. Most of the money spent
towards art, is an investment in opportunity for creation of more products. 
To be Clear…
This is NOT an ask for
‘You’ to invest in making this space ‘Nicer’ or ‘More Profitable’. This is an
ask for help get these artist working, and creating products with profits going
directly to them.
•  100% of the funds go to the artists listed.
•  If we fall short of our goal, or do not
raise money, we will still be investing in these artists, but unfortunately not
for months after our opening
•  If we raise More money than our goal, we
will be able to invest in these artists, and give them an opportunity to make a
better market value for their products.
Other Ways You Can Help
Follow and Share!!! We
want you to know more about us, hope to see you in our space!
•  Website: www.thechvrchofjohn.com
•  Instagram: @thechvrchofjohn
•  Twitter: @thechvrchofjohn
•  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thechvrch/
•  Contact: thechvrch@gmail.com & kristoffer@thechvrchofjohn.com

story:
Thank you to all of our Donors!

This campaign has ended but Annual Fund donations may be made through the end of year! Click here to donate online directly through DiverseWorks' website and MAKE BRAVE ART HAPPEN!

MEET US AT THE MATCH


DiverseWorks: Houston's most innovative arts organization, shaping the arc of contemporary art since 1982.


In December, DiverseWorks is moving to the MATCH (Midtown Arts and Theater Center Houston. Our brand new home allows us to provide artists with unique opportunities to experiment in multiple gallery and theater spaces. At this exceptionally exciting moment in DiverseWorks' 33-year history, we will increase our programming, expand our public outreach, and build new and diverse audiences for multidisciplinary contemporary art. 


This campaign is DiverseWorks most ambitious fundraising endeavor to date and is essential for us to continue our mission and expand opportunities to share arts experiences with you, our artistically curious, ravenous, and adventurous audiences.

Join our Annual Fund Campaign and Meet DiverseWorks at the MATCH


Donors of $75+ are invited to celebrate with DiverseWorks at the 
MEET US AT THE MATCH PARTY on Thursday, December 10, 2015, 7 - 9 pm at the Midtown Arts and Theater Center Houston, 3400 Main Street, Houston, TX 77002.

Groove to music by DJ Peter Lucas, enjoy global soul food by Etta's Kitchen, and imbibe DiverseWorks Spark - a cocktail created especially for DiverseWorks featuring Jameson's Irish Whisky.

All campaign funds directly support DiverseWorks' mission to commission, produce, and present new and daring art in all its forms through innovative collaborations that honor each artist's vision without constraint. DiverseWorks is a 501c3 organization and all contributions are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

Canvas tote bags printed in Houston by Ashely Hinson at Becoming Prints / Alabama Song. Yours with a $50 donation!

Limited Edition Sketchbook and Pencil Set by Trenton Doyle Hancock and JooYoung Choi, available at the $250+ giving levels.

story:
(You can read this project in English or Spanish)

FOR THIRD CONSECUTIVE YEAR, A READING FESTIVAL FOR THE MIAMI COMMUNITY

The Reading Festival  / Fiesta de la Lectura is an annual event organized by Cuatrogatos Foundation with the goal of promoting reading in Spanish among kids, teens, and adults in the Miami community. These activities are not aimed at just the Hispanic community, but also the numerous people around the city that speak and study Spanish as a second language. This festival was held with great success in 2013 and 2014 and will be held again from October 2015. 

This is a free event and is open to the public. The program includes visits from writers and illustrators to different public schools in Miami to converse with students and also includes reading workshops and creative writing, book readings for adults, book presentations, plastic art expositions, storytelling, and theater.  

Each year we publish a poster and also a set of four book cards with stories and short poems with illustrations. These materials are created especially for The Reading Festival / Fiesta de la Lectura  by wellknown artists and are handed out for free between students, teachers, librarians, and parents in Miami. 

The Reading Festival lasts for six days: it begins on Monday with events in public schools and ends on Saturday afternoon is a great surprise activity outside for the whole family, staged on the gardens of the Koubek Center (Miami Dade College). In 2013, we held a Carnival of Fantastic Animals and in 2014 we held a Picnic of Books. In 2015, we will have an Afternoon of Stories from Around the World. 
Cuatrogatros Foundation is a non-profit organization that develops educational and cultural products in various areas around Miami and also through its website and social networks. Its management board includes writers, illustrators, teachers, librarians, and actors. 

We are confident that through art, literature, and reading, the multicultural community of Miami can reach a higher level of communication, knowledge, respect, and harmony. That is why we are developing various events throughout the year that emphasize artistic education for kids and teens. 

In 2015, we want The Reading Festival to be a larger and more massive event that reaches more public schools. For that, we need greater financial resources. Your contribution to this project will be very invaluable.


POR TERCER AÑO CONSECUTIVO, UNA FIESTA DE LA LECTURA PARA LA COMUNIDAD DE MIAMI

Fiesta de la Lectura / The Reading Festival es un evento anual organizado por la Fundación Cuatrogatos con el propósito de fomentar la lectura en español entre los niños, jóvenes y adultos de la comunidad de Miami. Estas actividades no están destinadas solamente al público hispano, sino también a las numerosas personas de la ciudad que hablan y estudian el idioma español como segunda lengua. Este festival se realizó con gran éxito en 2013 y 2014, y volverá a presentarse en octubre del 2015. 

Es un evento gratuito y abierto al público. El programa incluye visitas de escritores e ilustradores a distintas escuelas públicas de Miami para dialogar con sus estudiantes, talleres de lectura y escritura creativa, recitales literarios para adultos, presentaciones de libros, exposiciones de artes plásticas, cuentacuentos y teatro. 

Cada año publicamos un afiche y también un set de cuatro tarjetas literarias con cuentos y poemas cortos y con ilustraciones. Estos materiales son creados especialmente para la Fiesta de la Lectura por artistas de reconocida calidad y se reparten de forma gratuita entre estudiantes, maestros, bibliotecarios, padres y público general de Miami.  

Fiesta de la Lectura / The Reading Festival  se prolonga durante seis días: comienza un lunes, con eventos en escuelas públicas, y termina la tarde del sábado con una gran actividad-sorpresa al aire libre, para toda la familia, que tiene como escenario los jardines del Koubek Center del Miami Dade College. En 2013 se hizo un Carnaval de los animales fantásticos y en 2014 el Picnic de libros. En 2015 tendremos una Tarde de cuentos del mundo.

Fundación Cuatrogatos es una organización non profit que desarrolla proyectos educativos y culturales en distintos espacios de Miami y también a través de su sitio web y de sus redes sociales. Su junta directiva la integran escritores, ilustradores, maestros, bibliotecarios y actores.

Estamos convencidos de que a través del arte, la literatura y la lectura, la comunidad multicultural de Miami puede llegar a alcanzar un mayor nivel de comunicación, conocimiento, respeto y armonía. Por eso desarrollamos, a lo largo del año, distintos eventos que hacen énfasis en la educación artística de niños y jóvenes.

En 2015 queremos que la Fiesta de la Lectura de la Fundación Cuatrogatos sea un evento más grande y masivo, que llegue a más escuelas públicas. Para ello, necesitamos mayores recursos financieros. Tu ayuda a este proyecto será muy valiosa.

story:
Re-sketching Bogota is a cultural event that seeks to give a new face to the city, through artistic and educational experiences. We have created different types of events during these 12 days to achieve the most possible people.

We decided to create a format that would serve three important objectives that are required for Bogota growth, its culture and all the young people who are the driving force of change.
The first one, is the need to bring art to some parts of society whom are not in regular contact with it. The second one is to complement the academic training of local artists, with unique and enriching experiences. The third one is to promote cultural exchange, to show the world the talent we have and a more positive and fresh face of our country.

We invite an artist from another country, which is highly regarded for his successful career and whose work is highlighted internationally. Then we choose an emerging local artist, known for his high work level, to give him the opportunity to work closely with the international guest. Together they will guide all activities during the program. We will offer free activities open to the public, a series of talks, lectures, live painting demonstrations, exhibitions, tutorials and a mural painting for the city. In addition guests will give a master class for registered people. Participants will have a moleskine and a canvas to continue painting about Bogota, and prepare a piece for the final exhibitions al together.

In the first version of Re-sketching Bogota, we carried out the Moleskine project with the Cambodian-North American Andrew Hem and the local artist Kligraphic. For this version (2015) we invite Sterling Hundley. Teacher at the University of Virginia, who has repeatedly received the most prestigious awards in the illustration. He has been for three consecutive years the most awarded illustrator of the United States. He also leads experimental projects of education and arts, as Legendeer. Beside him, Pedro Covo. A visual artist, painter and illustrator of Cartagena city, who at his young age, stands out among many for its talent and his images, line and color. He has published in El Malpensante, Avianca, El Espectador, Semana, and worked with large companies such as Eurodisney and Colagene.

We are convinced that we can build a culture of peace, inclusive and global. We want our country becomes known throughout the talent of those who live and work on it. We have much to show, much to give and much to learn. Therefore, we invite you to support us, to enable more people, can learn and spread art. We can contribute to greater circulation of culture. Getting stronger art proposals, may create real change, and to achieve this we must be better and learn from the best. Only missing you!

story:
Short Summary

I am an International Love Artist - I travel around the world spreading Love and raising consciousness through my Art and my being :) Art is my passion - I love it! Creating awesome pieces of Art fulfils my being, it bring me such joy and happiness to express my visions and imagination.

The campaign is all about spreading more Love Art around the world - giving everyone those beautiful high vibes! I get so much incredible feed back from my Love Art I just know the world needs to see more of it :) so I am asking for your help to spread the Love Art as much as possible..

Heres a testimonials about Love Art..

"Incredible Art that has transformed my home. I love Francesca and her Art, I own her 'Freedom to Mankind' Lion piece and it brings me strength and pride in my own creativity." ~ Vera Black

So my Love Art is truly helping so many people around the world and now is the time - I am ready to expand my reach.. 

How this is going to happen? Well by printing my Love Art onto clothes, big and small stickers, yoga mats and even a set of oracle cards I think it will spread the Love like wild fire!

To dive deeper into the Sacred Geometry topic check out this video I made..  https://youtu.be/aSU-ExkiLVU 

By contributing to this great project you will help the world advance into higher state of loving consciousness..

All these designs are hand drawn by me with so much Love imbued into them so they will radiate positive vibes everywhere :) 

What I Need & What You Get

£5,000 is the goal to get started with this amazing project! This will cover the manufacturing and production costs so you will receive your lovely perks straight to your door step :) (even if I don't reach the entire goal you will still receive the perks you contributed for)

I am super excited to offer you all my special perks as they are such unique one of a kind products.. I am sure you will find something that interests you!

As I am also giving £1 to TreeAid for every A3 or A5 Love Art Print that is sold

I have never done a fundraiser project like this before as I have always self funded my projects like the Transformational Sacred Geometry Colouring Book and Sacred Geometry Love Calendar 2017 (that you can get as one of the perks)

The Impact

This great project is super exciting because it will not only create a beautiful change in your self and your life by supporting it and consciously choosing experience more Love and awareness.. But also for the whole world and the people closest to you..

Seeing these powerful pieces of Art everyday impresses your subconscious mind with the universal patterns of creation and so much Love!!The amount of Love and positive feedback you will receive from contributing, by selecting the perk/s that most call to you - is magic! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute to this magical project thats ok but please can you help by spreading the word and sharing it with the people you know will love it.. So the Love keeps flowing!!!

Additional Info 

Just to let you know if you are supporting this project by buying the perks, that are part of the new Love Art merchandise their might be a little risk of late delivery as every production company has a different delivery system.. BUT you never know it might be even earlier then expected!!

Thank you so much for your help!!

Biggest Love <3

story:
Short Summary

My name is David and I am the author and illustrator for this project. When I was 17 I was diagnosed with degenerative disc disease and it has made it very challenging to find work to pay for school and the subsequent surgeries delayed my progress in life for a few years.

Fast forward to today I have found a job working at a local daycare center part time. Working here and with the kids has really inspired me and after just a short time there I was already working a plan to combine my love of art and writing to make a children's book.

Expenses are tough and finding time to work on this project has been even tougher. My hopes are that this campaign can help me create and share my vision and values with children and even adults.

What We Need & What You Get

500$ is the goal set on this project. All of this money will be going to buying materials for the art work, contacting publishing agents/selfpublishing and helping myself afford spending time on the project. That being said even if this project does not reach its goal I will continue this project because it is a personal project of mine.

For perks I will have three different reward tiers. First tier will be a digital copy of the book, second will be a signed physical copy of the book third and highest tier will be a signed piece of original artwork used in the book. I hope that these tiers will be enough incentive to get this project moving.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Sharing on social media this project will help spread the word and hopefully help realize the funding goal
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is David and I am the author and illustrator for this project. When I was 17 I was diagnosed with degenerative disc disease and it has made it very challenging to find work to pay for school and the subsequent surgeries delayed my progress in life for a few years.
Fast forward to today I have found a job working at a local daycare center part time. Working here and with the kids has really inspired me and after just a short time there I was already working a plan to combine my love of art and writing to make a children's book.
Expenses are tough and finding time to work on this project has been even tougher. My hopes are that this campaign can help me create and share my vision and values with children and even adults.

What We Need & What You Get
500$ is the goal set on this project. All of this money will be going to buying materials for the art work, contacting publishing agents/selfpublishing and helping myself afford spending time on the project. That being said even if this project does not reach its goal I will continue this project because it is a personal project of mine.
For perks I will have three different reward tiers. First tier will be a digital copy of the book, second will be a signed physical copy of the book third and highest tier will be a signed piece of original artwork used in the book. I hope that these tiers will be enough incentive to get this project moving.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Sharing on social media this project will help spread the word and hopefully help realize the funding goal

story:
Sorry, this campaign is already closed! If you'd still like to support us visit: https://lavictrola.org/donate/ We'd really appreciate it!

 

Why Are We Building A Giant Gramophone?

In a world dominated by digital technology, La Victrola is intended as a large-scale organic counterpoint that celebrates the music and culture of a bygone era. Originally planned as mobile art, the 35 ft height and five-ton weight determined that La Victrola was better suited as a stationary sculpture and performance stage. La Victrola aims to educate, celebrate, and maybe even titillate by opening a door to creative expression from the past.

What Does La Victrola Do?

More then just a sculpture, La Victrola inspires interaction. During the day La Victrola provides shade and plays crackly old 78 records for all who pass by. The music creates a gathering point, sparking spontaneous flights of song and dance on its inviting stage.

At night La Victrola hosts live cabaret performances beneath the organic curves of its massive Art Nouveau gramophone horn. These have included jazz, bluegrass, big band, burlesque, a full classical orchestra, belly dancing, flamenco, and much more.

What's New and Different in 2017?

In 2017 we plan to complete La Victrola by lifting the horn up off the ground, raising it up nine feet, and placing it on top of the actual gramophone box. This will complete the literal form of La Victrola as it has been imagined from the start.

Details on the gramophone box

Period details on the box will include railings, staircases, lanterns, and a few other surprise enhancements to the cabaret. This full version of La Victrola will serve as a sunrise and sunset viewing platform in Deep Playa at Burning Man, where its unique musical program can flourish.

With the horn 35 feet in the air, La Victrola's signature silhouette will be unmistakable.

Remember That One Time at Burning Man Last Year?

In 2016 we debuted a limited version of just La Victrola's horn supported on the performance stage. The 2016 installation verified that the piece is safe and that the core engineering and structural design is spot on.

This year, in 2017, we are building on last year's success and bringing the best possible piece that we can to share with the Burning Man community.

Who Are the Builders of La Victrola?

More than 30 artists and performers from across Northern California came together to volunteer their time, energy, skills, and resources to build La Victrola at American Steel Studios in Oakland.

Together, we are building much more than a giant gramophone, we are building a creative community.  

What Makes Big Art So Expensive?

Building art the size of La Victrola requires a daunting amount of money. The overall two-year cost to produce La Victrola is $200,000, and does not include the thousands of hours of volunteer crew labor, event camp costs, personal crew donations, or food for build week. The graph below shows the breakdown of our 2017 budget needs.

We are grateful to have received an honorarium grant from Burning Man this year which will cover 25% of our 2017 costs, but we must still raise the remaining 75% on our own. This Indiegogo campaign must raise a minimum of $40,000 for us to complete La Victrola and bring it back to Burning Man this year.

Your generous support will go directly toward the purchase of tools and materials, build space rental, transportation, logistical needs, and other equipment. We are deeply grateful to the community of friends, family, burners, and art lovers who have already supported this project.

What Comes After Burning Man?

The idea for La Victrola was conceived at Burning Man but La Victrola was always intended for an audience far beyond the Playa. We envision La Victrola making appearances at other music festivals, in urban destinations, and at locations with relevant music history significance.

How Else Can I Help?

As artists we know contributing money can sometimes be challenging. Community funded art can also succeed with in-kind donations to help bring the budget down. Metal, wood, sound equipment, lighting, tools, generators, furniture, powder coating, canvas, and paint are all donations we’d gladly accept. Let us know at info@lavictrola.com if you are interested in making an in-kind donation.

Your help sharing this campaign with your coolest friends in all your InstaFaceTwitterGram channels is greatly appreciated! 

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for your support.

And Now for the Perks!

Be part of our 78 Club and get a small custom LEGO(TM) model of La Victrola.

(not the final design! Final design is subject to the availability of all the parts)

(the design of the belt buckle is not final and might change a little bit!)

Video Credits - We are deeply grateful to the following:

Photography — George Post, Brian McGloin, SN Jacobson, Ralf Engels, Brian Sullivan, Chris Dowling
Video Footage — copteroptics.com, Shing Kong, Mark Day, Terry Pratt and Profiles in Dust Team
Video Editing — Dan Jenkins
Videography — Cliff Traiman
Sound — Matt Davis
Images — George Post, Shing Kong, Tim Bremner, Niki Butera, Stan Clawson, Bill Witter, Dan Baker, Hannes Häfele
Performers (in order of appearance) — Hassan El-Tayyab, Larissa Archer, Meghan Rutigliano, Jeff Hobbs
Voice Over — Andrea Davis
Sound Mixing — Scott Theakston
Directed by Dremlin and Snarky

story:
The exhibition - I AM COSMOS – is intended to be an artisitic and spiritual event.

It will consist of almost 60 printed artworks divided in three different galleries (Stars of Life, Multidimensional Tunnels, Diamond Souls) which will representing the three different steps of my journey through the cosmos to an higher consciousness.

I use I AM COSMOS as the title because I consider that the cosmos is within me, every cell and chemical substance of my body act as a true reflection of the matter of the universe.

Since the beginning of human race on Earth, men were always fascinated by the night sky, every civilization has studied the movement and the position of the stars, the sun and the moon, realizing their connection with the changing seasons.

These civilizations have built artifacts and monuments related to the cosmos and its’ stars, they named the constellations and they created myths and legends to explain the origins of life.

This exhibition will be an event with talks and lectures regarding the scientific and spiritual aspects of the universe, an opportunity of sharing knowledge, an event to celebrate the beauty of the infinite space above and within us.


CONCEPT OF THE PROJECT

Since I was a child I have always been fascinated by the wonderful night sky; full of millions sparkling stars, always wondering about their origins and the beginning of the life on Earth.

Growing up I started to believe (both scientifically and spiritually), that all forms of life on this planet represent the perfect expression of the cosmos, an interconnected vibration of energy echoing through the infinity of the space, the consequence of something greater than our wildest collective imagination.

With this idea in my mind I started this new project, a series of digital artworks that tells the story of my journey with and within the soul through the vastness of the universe.

This project aims to be a source of inspiration for enyone who wants to start a personal, philosophical and spiritual journey of discovery related to the cosmic origins of life

MORE INFO ABOUT THE PROJECT 

on my website

www.digitalcampana.co.uk 


IN ORDER TO RAISE THE MONEY FOR THIS PROJECT, I'M OFFERING DIFFERENTS AND ORIGINALS PERKS. 

THE MONEY I RAISE IN THIS CAMPAIGN GOES DIRECTLY TO PAY THE COSTS FOR MY FIRST DIGITAL ART EXHIBITION IN LONDON AND THEY WILL INCLUDE:

  • THE HIRE OF THE GALLERY OR THE SPACE THAT WILL HOST THE EXHIBITION (at the moment I'm looking for the right place, any suggestion will be helpful),
  • THE PRODUCTION OF (almost) 60 PRINTS FOR THE EXHIBITION,
  • FRAMING OF THE PRINTED ARTWORKS,
  • THE PROMOTIONAL MATERIAL ( website, posters, flyers, banner, business cards, ecc..),
  • and OTHER COSTS RELATED TO THE CREATION OF THE EXHIBITION.
YOUR DONATION (LARGE OR SMALL) WILL HELP ME TO REALIZE THIS PROJECT.

 PLEASE, SPREAD THE WORD WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY!!!

www.digitalcampana.co.uk


I WILL SHARE  THE PROGRESS OF THE PROJECT THROUGHT PHOTOS, NEWS, AND THOUGHTS ALSO ON MY SOCIAL MEDIA PAGES ON FACEBOOK, TWITTER AND INSTAGRAM... FOLLOW ME!

I THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH FOR EVEN VIEWING THIS PAGE AND SHOWING AN INTEREST.

story:
A little about me 

Hi, I'm Sara Brown and I'm an artist.  I suffer from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), Social Anxiety Disorder, and Agoraphobia.  This is very debilitating, and often leaves me unable to leave my apartment on my own.  I am in treatment, but until I'm able to function outside I need to earn a living so I can keep my apartment, eat, and continue therapy.

Fortunately I'm an artist :)  Through faith and hardwork I'm determined to paint my way to a better life and to be able to be thrive despite my obstacles. Contributing to my campaign by purchasing my custom or pre-made artwork will have a huge and direct impact on my immediate and long term future as I recover.

Money raised in my campaign will give me the tools to be self-sufficient and sustainable, helping to cover - art supplies, rent, food, and therapy.  I love to paint, and every piece of artwork that I get to create and put out into your hands will work to improve my skill and confidence, and help me get back out into the world.  

If you aren't able to contribute, your prayers and good thoughts are very much appreciated, as well as sharing my campaign.


Perks

Choose from custom drawings or paintings (including portraits), or from a selection of already completed artworks!

LIFE DRAWINGS:

For a $25 donation I will make and send you a life drawing sketch, done on cartidge paper.  Examples of my life drawing style can be seen in these images here:

   

  


PAINTINGS:

For $35 I will make you a custom 5 x 7" ABSTRACT acrylic painting on canvas board

For $45 I wil make you a custom 7 x 9" ABSTRACT acrylic painting on canvas board

For $150 I will make you a custom 11 x 14" acrylic painting on stretched canvas (no portraits at this size)

For $250 I will make you a custom 16 x 20" acrylic painting on stretched canvas 

For $500 I will make you a custom 30 x 40" acrylic painting on stretched gallery profile canvas

For $350 you can purchase one of my 30 x 40" paintings that are already completed (deeply discounted).  The selection is limited, and the titles are underneath the individual below.  Choose the individual painting on the right, once it's gone it's gone.


"Ches" - 20 x 16" (not available for purchase)


 

"Breathe" 40 x 30"


"Nearly Whole" - 40 x 30"


"submission" - 30 x 40"


"still" - 30 x 40"


"The Impermanence of Moments" - 30 x 40"


"The Invitation" - 40 x 30"


"Figures Ascending on the Remnants of Affection" - 40 x 30"


"The Metamorphosis of a Mountain Goat in Springtime" - 11 x 14" (not available for purchase)


"Lucid" - 20 x 16"  (not available for purchase)

story:
Hi! My name is Guy Gilchrist and I'm a Cartoonist. I'm having an incredible career....for the last twenty years,writing and drawing the NANCY comic strip that is in newspapers all over the world, and teaching cartooning to kids of all ages for over 30 years! Now I have the chance to bring my love for teaching Cartoons to TV!

When I was just 24, Jim Henson chose me to write and draw The Muppets comic strip, and from there, my career really took off! Of course it did! I was drawing the MUPPETS! Jim also asked me to help create The Muppet Babies! I worked on Fraggle Rock with Jim, too!

 Because of Jim Henson, immediately, I was in the spotlight, all over TV and the rest of the media, and being asked to make appearances all over the USA and the world! I was even Guest of Honor at the White House in 1984 and had my work enshrined in The Smithsonian. My love for teaching cartooning and motivating people to achieve all their dreams began right then! My dreams had ALL come true! I wanted YOURS to come true, too! That's why this TV show is so important!

 I guess I'm a naturally born teacher and entertainer.
Since I had little formal art training, coming from a childhood where we were poor and couldn't afford college, I learned everything on the job.  I began my cartooning career at age 14, and had all my wildest dreams coming true, I always felt compelled to help others reach their goals! I feel very strongly that whatever your lot in life is, no matter where you are in your life's journey...it is never too late or too early to make your dreams your goals and then....your reality! From nothing, I achieved success. I wanted to help others....with the gifts I had. And I did! Immediately, giving back by teaching cartooning everywhere I went!

 As my career kept getting more and more successful, with me taking on the character licensing of other amazing cartoons like Loony Tunes, Tom and Jerry, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Tiny Toons, Pink Panther, and Minnie Mouse, along the way writing 59 children's books, and winning a couple of Reuben Catagory Awards from the National Cartoonists Society for Best Illustrator, and several Awards from the United Nations Children's Council. Oh, yeah... then I took over the iconic Nancy and Sluggo comic strip!

WOW. It's been a wild, fantastic ride! And through it all, my passion for helping people, entertaining and educating through stories and cartoons has been a major driving force! Now I want to bring all these passions to the TV screen, and I need your help to do it!

THE TV SHOW

Think "Bob Ross"..... but on steroids and all about Cartooning! That's the show I want to make. And my partners? I've got some real heavy hitters from Hollywood who believe in this show very much and want to make a pilot, and that's going to run $25,000 in production fees. These folks have launched many TV shows, with several running today! They strongly believe that if we make this pilot, it will get on the air! Will you help? I've come up with all kinds of perks to give you in support of this project to thank you for your generosity.


In gratitude for your financial support, I have perks available ranging from signed prints of my characters, signed books, original art from my Muppets and Nancy comic strips, custom drawings, personal phone consultations, portfolio reviews, career mentoring sessions....and I'll even go so far as to show up at your house and draw pictures at your party!! Really! Everyone who contributes will also recieve a link to the finished pilot! With folks contributing 20 dollars or more  receiving an autographed DVD of the show! I want this show to be YOURS as well as mine! And I want you to see where the money is going! I KNOW we can make this happen....with YOUR  help, and my connections and history!


If we can raise this $25,000 for the production fees, by the way...the producers and director are putting their time in at NO CHARGE! They are ALL IN on this because they believe in this show so strongly! Isn't it time to bring Cartooning Education and Entertainment BACK to the TV screen?? When I was growing up, we had all kinds of cartooning on TV! Walt Disney and Walter lantz taught us how to draw their most famous characters and told us stories! Every little town had a Cartooning and Drawing Entertainer on the air! Now?? NOTHING! The kids and adults need this! I see it everytime I do a talk, do a tv appearance, a comic con, or invite folks into my studio! People are fascinated with drawing! Let's do this!

On this show, I will teach you everything you want to know about how to draw my characters, and how to create your own! I've created an entire curriculum that is fun and focused! I ran a Cartooning Academy in Connecticut for 7 years teaching! I also have had dozens of apprentices and interns who went onto amazing careers! Former students of mine have gone onto careers where they have won their own Reuben Awards, and have massive success. One is illustrating magazines and books for the biggest publishers! Another is animating shows on tv right now! More have huge careers in Commercial Art, Illustration, and Fine Arts.I want to do the same thing for the next generations. This show won't only be for art students, though! IT'S FOR EVERYBODY! Whether you want to draw along or not! You will be entertained! But think of it....art lessons if you want it, stories and entertainment whether you draw or not...and the chance to reach out to everyone! What about folks who could use some Art Therapy?! From children to seniors to the recovering, Art Therapy is a wonderful pastime.... and I want to be your guide  to the wonderful world of your imagination! And, man, will we have fun!! I've been speaking professionally for over 35 years and have entertained and educated literally at least 100,000 people in person, as well as millions through my guest spots on tv! It is my joy and my passion and I want to bring it to our very own TV SHOW!
YOU will see the fruits of all our labors! You will receive links to the production, and DVDs autographed by me as soon as we are done with the production....which will start IMMEDIATELY after we reach our goal!!! We want to pitch this THIS SUMMER! Get on the air THIS YEAR! This is ready to go NOW! EVERYONE has cleared their calendars to jump all over this! This will be so cool!!! And YOU will know...YOU MADE IT HAPPEN!

OK....but What do we do if we don't reach our entire goal? Where will your money go then?  While I don't want to think we won't reach $25,000 dollars....if we fall short, I will use the money to put the curriculum I have already created up ONLINE  at our website, www.nancyandsluggo.com , so that folks around the world will still have access to LEARNING! to my teaching! My passion for sharing my years of cartooning! This is a great passion of mine....teaching. I will spend the rest of my life eliminating the barriers between education and the folks that seek it. So, no matter WHAT the outcome...your dollars enrich the lives of others! Isn't that why we all do what we do?

I will be sharing news and updates each and every week at our website, and on all my social media! Check my links to this campaign. I'm on Instagram too, they didn't have a spot for that on IndieGoGo's links.. but just search GUYFGILCHRIST on IG! We will be completely transparent, and completely connected and all in!

Please share this dream with me. Any amount of money will help. 5, 10, 20 dollars. Whatever you can afford! It all adds up! Of course....the more generous a contribution you can make....the more fun the perks! If you can't make a monetary contribution, but still want to be a part of this amazing project, then please share this link with everyone you know on all your social media! This dream only comes true with your help! I KNOW WE CAN DO THIS!
story_txt:
Hi! My name is Guy Gilchrist and I'm a Cartoonist. I'm having an incredible career....for the last twenty years,writing and drawing the NANCY comic strip that is in newspapers all over the world, and teaching cartooning to kids of all ages for over 30 years! Now I have the chance to bring my love for teaching Cartoons to TV!When I was just 24, Jim Henson chose me to write and draw The Muppets comic strip, and from there, my career really took off! Of course it did! I was drawing the MUPPETS! Jim also asked me to help create The Muppet Babies! I worked on Fraggle Rock with Jim, too!  Because of Jim Henson, immediately, I was in the spotlight, all over TV and the rest of the media, and being asked to make appearances all over the USA and the world! I was even Guest of Honor at the White House in 1984 and had my work enshrined in The Smithsonian. My love for teaching cartooning and motivating people to achieve all their dreams began right then! My dreams had ALL come true! I wanted YOURS to come true, too! That's why this TV show is so important! I guess I'm a naturally born teacher and entertainer. Since I had little formal art training, coming from a childhood where we were poor and couldn't afford college, I learned everything on the job.  I began my cartooning career at age 14, and had all my wildest dreams coming true, I always felt compelled to help others reach their goals! I feel very strongly that whatever your lot in life is, no matter where you are in your life's journey...it is never too late or too early to make your dreams your goals and then....your reality! From nothing, I achieved success. I wanted to help others....with the gifts I had. And I did! Immediately, giving back by teaching cartooning everywhere I went! As my career kept getting more and more successful, with me taking on the character licensing of other amazing cartoons like Loony Tunes, Tom and Jerry, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Tiny Toons, Pink Panther, and Minnie Mouse, along the way writing 59 children's books, and winning a couple of Reuben Catagory Awards from the National Cartoonists Society for Best Illustrator, and several Awards from the United Nations Children's Council. Oh, yeah... then I took over the iconic Nancy and Sluggo comic strip! WOW. It's been a wild, fantastic ride! And through it all, my passion for helping people, entertaining and educating through stories and cartoons has been a major driving force! Now I want to bring all these passions to the TV screen, and I need your help to do it! THE TV SHOWThink "Bob Ross"..... but on steroids and all about Cartooning! That's the show I want to make. And my partners? I've got some real heavy hitters from Hollywood who believe in this show very much and want to make a pilot, and that's going to run $25,000 in production fees. These folks have launched many TV shows, with several running today! They strongly believe that if we make this pilot, it will get on the air! Will you help? I've come up with all kinds of perks to give you in support of this project to thank you for your generosity.In gratitude for your financial support, I have perks available ranging 
from signed prints of my characters, signed books, original art from my 
Muppets and Nancy comic strips, custom drawings, personal phone 
consultations, portfolio reviews, career mentoring sessions....and I'll 
even go so far as to show up at your house and draw pictures at your 
party!! Really! Everyone who contributes will also recieve a link to the finished pilot! With folks contributing 20 dollars or more  receiving an autographed DVD of the show! I want this show to be YOURS as well as mine! And I want you to see where the money is going! I KNOW we can make this happen....with YOUR  help, and my connections and history!If we can raise this $25,000 for the production fees, by the way...the producers and director are putting their time in at NO CHARGE! They are ALL IN on this because they believe in this show so strongly! Isn't it time to bring Cartooning Education and Entertainment BACK to the TV screen?? When I was growing up, we had all kinds of cartooning on TV! Walt Disney and Walter lantz taught us how to draw their most famous characters and told us stories! Every little town had a Cartooning and Drawing Entertainer on the air! Now?? NOTHING! The kids and adults need this! I see it everytime I do a talk, do a tv appearance, a comic con, or invite folks into my studio! People are fascinated with drawing! Let's do this!On this show, I will teach you everything you want to know about how to draw my characters, and how to create your own! I've created an entire curriculum that is fun and focused! I ran a Cartooning Academy in Connecticut for 7 years teaching! I also have had dozens of apprentices and interns who went onto amazing careers! Former students of mine have gone onto careers where they have won their own Reuben Awards, and have massive success. One is illustrating magazines and books for the biggest publishers! Another is animating shows on tv right now! More have huge careers in Commercial Art, Illustration, and Fine Arts.I want to do the same thing for the next generations. This show won't only be for art students, though! IT'S FOR EVERYBODY! Whether you want to draw along or not! You will be entertained! But think of it....art lessons if you want it, stories and entertainment whether you draw or not...and the chance to reach out to everyone! What about folks who could use some Art Therapy?! From children to seniors to the recovering, Art Therapy is a wonderful pastime.... and I want to be your guide  to the wonderful world of your imagination! And, man, will we have fun!! I've been speaking professionally for over 35 years and have entertained and educated literally at least 100,000 people in person, as well as millions through my guest spots on tv! It is my joy and my passion and I want to bring it to our very own TV SHOW! YOU will see the fruits of all our labors! You will receive links to the production, and DVDs autographed by me as soon as we are done with the production....which will start IMMEDIATELY after we reach our goal!!! We want to pitch this THIS SUMMER! Get on the air THIS YEAR! This is ready to go NOW! EVERYONE has cleared their calendars to jump all over this! This will be so cool!!! And YOU will know...YOU MADE IT HAPPEN!OK....but What do we do if we don't reach our entire goal? Where will your money go then?  While I don't want to think we won't reach $25,000 dollars....if we fall short, I will use the money to put the curriculum I have already created up ONLINE  at our website, www.nancyandsluggo.com , so that folks around the world will still have access to LEARNING! to my teaching! My passion for sharing my years of cartooning! This is a great passion of mine....teaching. I will spend the rest of my life eliminating the barriers between education and the folks that seek it. So, no matter WHAT the outcome...your dollars enrich the lives of others! Isn't that why we all do what we do? I will be sharing news and updates each and every week at our website, and on all my social media! Check my links to this campaign. I'm on Instagram too, they didn't have a spot for that on IndieGoGo's links.. but just search GUYFGILCHRIST on IG! We will be completely transparent, and completely connected and all in! Please share this dream with me. Any amount of money will help. 5, 10, 20 dollars. Whatever you can afford! It all adds up! Of course....the more generous a contribution you can make....the more fun the perks! If you can't make a monetary contribution, but still want to be a part of this amazing project, then please share this link with everyone you know on all your social media! This dream only comes true with your help! I KNOW WE CAN DO THIS!

story:
Rebuilding the Legacy of American Made

Hello fellow lovers of local, handcrafted, authenticity, and the genuine spirit of American entrepreneurship. 

Who are We?

A bit about us...Makers Market is a retail marketplace launched in San Francisco, born of Southern roots. We’re committed to supporting our 100+ (and growing every week!) independent artists and designers from the Bay Area and US, by curating the best of American Handcrafted all in one central marketplace!  

You can find talents like Kirsten Muenster, a 4th generation metalsmith and George Rocha, skateboard upcycler.  Every one of our makers has extreme talent and an intriguing story to tell.

  

We are a small business with a big vision to bring Makers Market to each major city in the U.S. that has a strong Maker base and a community and tourists eager to support these makers.


Why Support the Makers Movement?

The Makers Movement reflects the love of authentic one-of-a-kind goods made by independent artists and designers, instead of supporting huge fast fashion retail chains. Not only will you feel good knowing you are Rebuilding the Legacy of American Made and helping a maker live their dream, but you get cool stuff too! We've handpicked our best sellers and exclusive items at a discounted price as perks for investors!

Our Perks:


Our Next Store - San Francisco

We are raising money to build our flagship store in San Francisco.  In order to have the space we want in our hometown city, we are finding ourselves competing against technology companies that are very well-funded, many of them from overseas investors.  We want to keep this an all-American San Francisco based business to allow locals and visitors alike the opportunity to appreciate and support the amazing, locally produced goods from this region.  Our temporary store in Union Square was displaced last year by this competition - sad as we were the only locally produced store in the area!  

Our Mission

Makers Market is on a mission to Rebuild the Legacy of American Made; and we need your support to make our dream (and the dreams of the independent small businesses we champion) a reality.  We curate the best of American handcrafted by searching the 50 states for well-designed, durable and unique handcrafted goods. Quite a feat – but one we are extremely passionate about. 

Our brand is inspired by nature’s perfect beauty, the spirit of American ingenuity and entrepreneurship, and authentic craft that honors and respects those things.

It was not long  ago that our communities were more connected...when skilled craftsmen, working with their hands and guided by their hearts and souls, made goods that lasted a lifetime.  It was before shopping in superstores with imported, mass produced product - with no story, no face, no meaning. 

That's where we come in....

Our Products:  Modern + Heritage Inspired

We scour the USA to find products that honor the ideals of American craftsmanship and have a modern + heritage-inspired aesthetic.   In our quest to bring you the best in handcrafted, we have vetted each product to ensure it is well-designed, long-lasting and either organic, sustainable or ethically produced.

The Prosperity Leather Tote is a great example of what we search for and is even more stunning in person. Durable hand-cut and hand-sewn construction with an eye-catching undyed vegetable tan leather body and straps.  Ferdinand's designs and makes heirloom quality goods using the finest natural and domestic materials available.  "I'm inspired by the irregularity in handcrafted goods. The beautiful imperfection."


We Strive for 100% US Content

With the loss of 650 American textile mills between 1997 and 2009, it is difficult for our makers to find American-made textiles to use in their products. At Makers Market, we try extra hard to find products made of textiles woven in USA mills, and products that source all US Raw Materials. 

Why? Not only will you be supporting the end maker, but also the rancher who raised the sheep, the farmer who grew the cotton, and the mill workers that weave the cloth.  You'll notice many of our products incorporate Pendleton Wool.  This mill has been family-owned and operated for more than six generations! 



Our Makers

Handcrafted items have a way of making us stop to appreciate and think about the story behind the product.  Everyone remembers the story of the maker…it’s what makes that everyday item special for years to come. We search for new makers with stories that are just as intriguing as their products.  

One thing we love about the current Maker Movement is the number of folks who have learned their trade from their parents or grandparents and are forging their own path.  It’s a bold move for a growing number of young adults.  Some people believe it’s like a return to the good ol’ days where Americans were more self-sufficient.  We love to find artists and makers who are carrying on a family trade in their own way … these folks hold a special place in our hearts. 

One of our makers, Christina Nicole, has a studio in the North Carolina hills, and creates jewelry and home goods using tools given to her by her grandfather.

We believe in celebrating and memorializing our makers, you can check out the videos we've produced here.  


Our Unique Brick and Mortar Shopping Experience

We've been selling online for a few years. However, it was at our first pop-up shop in San Francisco where we saw first-hand the awe-inspired look of shoppers who LOVED their in-store experience. Smelling and touching the leather and seeing the quality of the product; they appreciate the heart and soul that went into making the goods.  Our stores are different, in that we have makers deliver product to the store (sometimes by bike); we have meet the maker events; makers customize product in the stores; we hold classes.  Ours stores are reinventing the current stale shopping experience.  

To be truly inspired, people need the physical connection. We want the maker movement to realize its full potential and support makers in doing what they love, by connecting shoppers with the products first-hand.


Why do we need your help?

We were invited to open a new shop in prestigious Santana Row, San Jose, where we will be one of the only local brands among National chains.
Opening a store is NOT cheap! We are looking for funding to help us build out the store - lighting, signage, handcrafted fixtures, point-of-sale capabilities, literature on the makers, etc. We want the store to be worthy of the amazing products we carry, and tell the story of the makers. 
We also want to open our flagship store in San Francisco.  We want to give everyone the opportunity to shop small, support makers and have a positive impact on our community and our economy.

  

The Impact

Did you know that if we all spent just $64 a year on US made goods, it would support 220,000 jobs? Imagine the number of makers who would love the ability to do this full-time. You can make that possible. Shop local. Buy quality American-made goods, make sure products you buy are ethically made and you can change lives.  By spending your hard earned $s on American made, you can make a significant impact on our economy and the lives of local makers.


What if we exceed our goal?

Well, that's even better! We have plans for expansion, but more importantly to create a space for makers to make and have a support staff behind them to do all the 'other' things needed to make a business thrive. We want to be an entrepreneurial support center for makers. That's our passion. That's where we can truly make a difference and make sure the makers movement is much more than a fad.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, you can still help. Help spread the word. Bring friends to our store. Share the news on your social media by clicking the links on this page. Everything helps!

Our Roots

    

  


The idea for Makers Market has been brewing a while… growing up in the Deep South, I spent hours with my dad in his workshop handing him tools, sweeping up the sawdust, handing him more tools, and receiving all of life’s lessons.  We’d ride through the countryside discovering potters, blacksmiths, textile weavers, and furniture makers. Watching and chatting with these craftsmen instilled a deep appreciation for those who design and handcraft one-of-a-kind product. Many times, these trades had been passed down through generations, and grandparents’ tools were still being used. We met the most talented, authentic, and down-to-earth people.  There was a deep sense of home and belonging. 

Makersmarket.us strives to look, sound, and feel like you are 1 on 1 with a master craftsman in their workshop…watching them work and listening to their engaging storytelling.  


"Top 4 Retail for American Made Design" - Dwell

"In the sea of designer brands and luxury retailers in San Francisco's Union Square, Makers Market stands out. The store, which snagged a lease in the Westfield San Francisco Centre mall after doing a successful pop-up there last year, is full of handmade goods — all made by local artists and "makers. The so-called "maker movement" — a resurgence of interest in handmade, local goods, driven by shop-local campaigns... is strong in San Francisco. "  - San Francisco Business Times.

 "At maker's market you get a glimpse into the lives of these makers, learn about their backgrounds, processes, and passions — each one with a story unique and inspiring." -sf girl by bay

"Each item is hip, modern, and carefully selected. And I could buy one of just about everything." -DIY network

"Ours is a city divided.  On one side: tech companies and their pixel products. On the other: dudes who make actual stuff with their hands. Merging the two: the freshly launched Maker's Market, a high-tech bazaar of American-made goods." -Inside Hook

"You'll notice that founder, Suzy Ekman, has an incredible eye for beautifully designed items and clearly loves working with small businesses." -Creative Business League

"There’s absolutely no pulling the wool over your eyes here because everything down to the sheep that produce it come from American producers." -SF Gate

story:
Short Summary

Do you like History but you do not have time to read those big books?

Do you want to participate in recreation of interesting stories from the paste?

Then this project is for you!

Hello, everyone, my name is Slava, I am a historian and script writer also I am a director of this project.

We are the international team of professionals that are passionate to create beautiful illustrations of the meaningful episodes of history.

  • Slava Mezhdoyan is the script writer and director from the Georgia
  • Alexandr Bronzov is the painter from Ukraine
  • Sergey Kolbincev is the narrator from Moscow
  • Igor Jeved is the colorist from Ukraine
Also special thanks to the Edgar Gevorgyan who helped us in making this short film for IndieGoGo. Here is his youtube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLC3ZHA5msljJu6S0auMXtw
About the show:
This will be the comic style animation, based on the true stories. And by the time and success of the project, we are planning to create full 2D animation contents. The whole story will be divided into the 5-6 parts in average, each part will be 4-5 minute long and will be released once per week on our youtube channel.

By the way, it will be at least in two languages English and Russian.

We believe that this project will become popular and attractive for millions of people in the world. The stories will be analyzed in depth and explained the reasons of the events in geopolitical and psychological scales.

We are not going to tell only what happened but also why it happened?

Here what we are going for - with this campaign we will do our first series (it is 7 episodes entirely) about the incredible story of David bek, an Armenian military commander and one of the most prominent military figures of the Armenian liberation movement of the 18th century directed against the forces of Ottoman Empire and Safavid Iran. In his age, this guy made impossible and brought salvation to his nation.

I know that you have not heard much about him and that is why we are trying to bring this great story to life!

Once we do this one, we are going to continue our campaign and will do new stories one after another.

So making this Davit Bek series is really essential for the future of the project.


What We Need & What You Get

 All we need is 7000 dollars to finish the story (series) about David Bek. This amount is required to force the project and finish it in September. 

What will be in case we did not get the entire money?? Well, first of all, we are not going to give up!

The money we receive will be invested in the project and we will try to move on!  In case we receive part of the amount we will do part of the work. (By the way, we have already done almost 2 episodes)

Here how our budget is distributed:

  1.  5%  -  IndieGoGo 
  2.  5%  -  the commissions for the PayPal and banks
  3. 10%  - editor/director
  4. 10%  - narration
  5. 30%  - colorist
  6. 30%  - painter
  7. 10%  - perks

Perks – all our supporter/backers will get the right of the vote! This is important! After David bek, you will decide which story we will do next. We are going to open a group in facebook and our backers will go to the poll and choose the story. The story that gets more votes will be our next one!

Also for each amount of donation you will get special rewards like - postcards, t-short, thanks and others. Please look at the gallery for the full information.


The Impact

History has great episodes that have to be revealed and discovered. There are many exciting untold stories that deserve to be famous or told in a proper way. We are going to tell the events full of tragedy, bravery and unbelievable love stories that have changed the wheel of the history.

History is a strong tool to teach the new generation not to make the same mistakes and find out examples of the best achievements and successes that happened in the past. With this project, we hope to popularize history subject within the young generation around the world and make it easier and understandable for everyone.

The heroic character of David bek will be popularized and known all over the world!

We will continue our work and will provide new videos every week on youtube and it will be absolutely free for everyone!


Risks & Challenges

To be honest, we are afraid only one thing, it is the risk of not spread the campaign among the enough people within the time limit.

So we hope that you will be involved in sharing the process as well. So please share the info, links via facebook twitter and other social networks.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign everyone and tell everyone about it!

Subscribe to our youtube channel, like our facebook page and follow us on twitter and Vkontakte.

https://www.facebook.com/History-Time-1531073740556009/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzFbMrOj6A3gka1s7vWEw-g 

https://twitter.com/HiztoryTime

story_txt:
Short Summary Do you like History but you do not have time to read those big books?
Do you want to participate in recreation of interesting stories from the paste?
Then this project is for you!
Hello, everyone, my name is Slava, I am a historian and script writer also I am a director of this project.
We are the international team of professionals that are passionate to create beautiful illustrations of the meaningful episodes of history.



Slava Mezhdoyan is the script writer and director from the Georgia


Alexandr Bronzov is the painter from Ukraine


Sergey Kolbincev is the narrator from Moscow


Igor Jeved is the colorist from Ukraine


Also special thanks to the Edgar Gevorgyan who helped us in making this short film for IndieGoGo. Here is his youtube channel:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLC3ZHA5msljJu6S0auMXtw


About the show:


This will be the comic style animation, based on the true stories. And by the time and success of the project, we are planning to create full 2D animation contents. The whole story will be divided into the 5-6 parts in average, each part will be 4-5 minute long and will be released once per week on our youtube channel.

By the way, it will be at least in two languages English and Russian.
We believe that this project will become popular and attractive for millions of people in the world. The stories will be analyzed in depth and explained the reasons of the events in geopolitical and psychological scales.
We are not going to tell only what happened but also why it happened?
Here what we are going for - with this campaign we will do our first series (it is 7 episodes entirely) about the incredible story of David bek, an Armenian military commander and one of the most prominent military figures of the Armenian liberation movement of the 18th century directed against the forces of Ottoman Empire and Safavid Iran. In his age, this guy made impossible and brought salvation to his nation.
I know that you have not heard much about him and that is why we are trying to bring this great story to life!
Once we do this one, we are going to continue our campaign and will do new stories one after another.
So making this Davit Bek series is really essential for the future of the project.


   What We Need & What You Get  All we need is 7000 dollars to finish the story (series) about David Bek. This amount is required to force the project and finish it in September. 
What will be in case we did not get the entire money?? Well, first of all, we are not going to give up!
The money we receive will be invested in the project and we will try to move on!  In case we receive part of the amount we will do part of the work. (By the way, we have already done almost 2 episodes)
Here how our budget is distributed:



 5%  -  IndieGoGo 


 5%  -  the commissions for the PayPal and banks


10%  - editor/director


10%  - narration


30%  - colorist


30%  - painter


10%  - perks



Perks – all our supporter/backers will get the right of the vote! This is important! After David bek, you will decide which story we will do next. We are going to open a group in facebook and our backers will go to the poll and choose the story. The story that gets more votes will be our next one!
Also for each amount of donation you will get special rewards like - postcards, t-short, thanks and others. Please look at the gallery for the full information.



    The Impact 
History has great episodes that have to be revealed and discovered. There are many exciting untold stories that deserve to be famous or told in a proper way. We are going to tell the events full of tragedy, bravery and unbelievable love stories that have changed the wheel of the history.
History is a strong tool to teach the new generation not to make the same mistakes and find out examples of the best achievements and successes that happened in the past. With this project, we hope to popularize history subject within the young generation around the world and make it easier and understandable for everyone.
The heroic character of David bek will be popularized and known all over the world!
We will continue our work and will provide new videos every week on youtube and it will be absolutely free for everyone!


   Risks & Challenges 
To be honest, we are afraid only one thing, it is the risk of not spread the campaign among the enough people within the time limit.
So we hope that you will be involved in sharing the process as well. So please share the info, links via facebook twitter and other social networks.


   Other Ways You Can Help Share our campaign everyone and tell everyone about it!
Subscribe to our youtube channel, like our facebook page and follow us on twitter and Vkontakte.
https://www.facebook.com/History-Time-1531073740556009/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzFbMrOj6A3gka1s7vWEw-g 
https://twitter.com/HiztoryTime

story:
Short Summary

Located in the Boulder Creative Collectives' new 47th street studios, the Writer's Warehouse will activate the versatility of a studio to challenge the assumption that creation is best done in isolation. By bringing writers into spaces generally dedicated to visual arts, this project expands the creative landscape to nurture new ideas and unexpected works that push the boundaries of artistic disciplines.

The goal of this project is to create an infrastructure which empowers a diverse group of Boulder writers to explore the the full potential of the written word in community with painters, sculptors, designers, photographers, architects, and more working in the BCC's surrounding studios. It also invites the Boulder community as a whole to participate in creative practice. 

We have garnered an inspiring amount of interest in this project from organizations like BMoCA, BLDG 61, CU Art Museum, Jaipur Literature Festival, local small presses and more, but what we need now are the funds to launch!

No contribution is too small: each dollar raised is a crucial step towards opening our doors, accepting applications for resident writers, and setting about the business of fostering collaboration and community engagement.


What We Need 

With $6,000, BWW will be able to provide our writers with:

  • 6 months of 200 square-foot shared studio space 
  • a printer stocked with paper and ink for printing manuscripts
  • bookbinding tools (bone folders, awls, paper cutter, waxed thread, book binding needles, etc) for self publishing projects
  • Google Apps account with BWW email, calendar, docs, and more
  • publication and featured writer profile on the BWW website
  • access to Boulder Creative Collective exhibition space as a venue for performances and workshops
  • connection to outreach opportunities with BMoCA, Boulder Fringe, Boulder Public Library and the BLDG 61 Maker Space, Jaipur Literature Festival, CU Art Museum, and other community partners
  • managerial and logistical support for proposed projects and initiatives
We will also be able to provide multiple workshops and performances that will be cost-free and open to the community.


The Impact

Boulder Writers Warehouse is a true experiment — we don’t have a product we are trying to create; we aim to test the theory put forth in the City of Boulder's newly adopted Community Cultural Plan. We aren't claiming that our single space will touch the whole of our city; we are, however, confident that this project can serve as an important control-group to test and explore the tools outlined in the Cultural Plan, specifically those surrounding innovation, professional development, diversity, accessibility, collaboration, and community involvement.

BWW's projects and programming will provide important insight into who applies for this kind of experience and space, what types of events are successful, and which audiences we are attracting or not attracting with workshops and performances. We will have reliable data on who is involved in the creative conversation in Boulder as well as a firm grasp on how to improve this engagement.

We won't only be empowering the writers and artists creating work in the studio space; we will be constantly learning and developing new ways to foster further creative engagement in the community as a whole.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is securing steady funding to ensure we can launch and sustain this kind of innovative space. It is the financial resources that will make or break this project; this entire program is centered on getting writers into the studio space, and to do that we need to start with step one -- we need rent. 

Once we acquire base funding, the challenges become a bit more fun. We will have applications to read, schedules to coordinate, and the general maintenance of the self-publishing supplies. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have a few dollars to spare, you can still help spread the word about BWW! As the new kid on Boulder's creative block, we need as much word-of-mouth support as possible. Like our Facebook Page, share our Wordpress link, send this IndieGoGo campaign to everyone you know. And, as always, please contact us to let us know how you think we can better serve the creative community.
