story:
The Richmond Hood Advanced Slam Team, Staten Island, NY, is the first-ever team from NYC's Borough No. 5 to compete in a National Poetry Slam competition.

The $3500 we hope to raise will cover transportation, lodging, food, and other expenses related to the National Poetry Slam, Decatur, Georgia, August 1st-August 6th.   Your support will allow the poets to focus more on honing their performance poetry and hopefully, making it to the semi-finals. 

About the Poets

Eric Alter is a poet who wrestles with identity and truth; tries to make them submit themselves to a laugh or a gasp from the audience. He is backed by the full credit and standing of Long Island University and holds a M.F.A. in Creative Writing.  He is also a 77.4 ton Sherman tank, editor of NYSAI press and a bass player in the band Giga Herbs.

Julie Bentsen is an ongoing student of dreams and the Unconscious, as well as the prose editor for NYSAI magazine. She regularly reads at Staten Island's Advanced Slam, and has featured at The Parkside Lounge and Hell Phone for Great Weather for Media. Her work focuses on the horrors of our psychopathic corporate nightmare, our collective disconnect from ourSelves, and the limitations of our perception of reality. She is also a visual artist enjoys creating live art to live poetry, and has done so for 3Po3try NYC: Raining Words at the Pomegranate Gallery,  Art for Poetry's Sake at Deep Tanks Studios, and the LUMEN Art Festival.

Thomas Fucaloro is an NYC poet. He has 2 books out by Three Rooms Press.  His latest one, “It Starts from the Belly and Blooms” has received rave reviews. He has graduated with an MFA at the New School for Creative Writing. He is a co-founding editor of Great Weather for Media and NYSAI press.  He is a writing coordinator at the Harlem Children’s Zone.  He just recently won a performance grant from the Staten Island Council of the Arts and the NYC Dept. of Cultural Affairs. His new chapbook "Mistakes Disguised as Stars" by Tired Hearts Press was released in March and his latest chapbook "Depression Cupcakes" was released in June through "Yes, Poetry." 

Jessica “Morningstar” Kratz is a literary artist who grew up among the historic treasures and natural wonders of Staten Island, NY.  Equally at home hiking through the forest or jotting down her thoughts inside the pages of a marble notebook, Jessica has compiled two chapbooks, Sky Voyages (2003) and Slices of the Big Apple:  New York as I Know It (2007), along with two children’s books Sleigh Bells in Springtime: Frogs Calling (AuthorHouse, 2010) and The Lucky Lighthouse (Boulevard Books, late 2016).  When not writing or exploring nature, she can be found donning a fitness tracker and finding out the metrics to her cardio, weights, and plyometrics. 

Nick Yuk writes about depression and the struggles of his life. When not writing his heart on paper, napkins, or empty beer boxes, he spends his time cooking and creating new euphoric sensations via taste. He is an organizer for Rock Slam in Nyack, NY.


Our perks packages leverage the talent of the Advanced Slam poets as well as the generosity and the Shaolin swagger of the Richmond Hood Company and its stylish and talented owner, Tariq Zaid.  Support your local slam team in style, with an Advanced lapel pin, a must-read chapbook, discounts to the Richmond Hood Company store- and more. 

If we do not reach our entire goal, some of us may be sleeping on the floor, but we'll still be competing in Atlanta, and any funds raised will support the Advanced Slam Team and the Advanced series of poetry readings and competitions. 

The Impact

Slam is the fastest-growing literary movement in the United States, and your support promotes a movement, promotes performance poetry, and supports an emerging arts scene and civic pride for Staten Island.

Members of the Advanced Slam Team are well-educated, established musical, visual, performing, and literary artists, with a diverse array of successful endeavors, such as children's books, rock band performances, collaborative visual art and poetry performances, chapbooks, and spoken word performances in a variety of venues. 
Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sabrina, I'm 28 years old and live in London where I work as a waitress ..

"Lobster's frustrations" is my first book .. I made in the little free time I have left from work, and while traveling by tube.

It told a story-no-story where nothing happens, everything is still as in the picture .. the real story is not told from the text but from images that show you the friends (maybe) imaginary of a small lobster that lives in a large house..

I do not know exactly what I tell in the book, I know that is born only as an escape from my real life where I am a waitress ..when I drew the various rooms I entered into the house, I was the lobster I took the tea in the living room with walruses, I was the lobster in the tub taking a bath with swans ..listening for music by Ezio Bosso (Italian composer) I spent months on a small ikea desk in my room  to draw my story.


Mi chiamo Sabrina, ho 28 anni e vivo a Londra dove lavoro come cameriera..

"Frustrazioni d'aragosta" è il mio primo libro.. l'ho realizzato nel poco tempo libero che mi rimane dal lavoro, e durante i viaggi in tube.

Racconto una storia-non-storia dove non accade nulla, tutto è immobile come in delle foto.. la vera storia non è raccontata dal testo ma dalle immagini che vi mostrano gli amici (forse) immaginari di una piccola aragosta che vive in una grande casa.. 

Non so di preciso cosa voglio raccontare con libro, sò che è nato da solo come fuga dalla mia vita reale dove sono una cameriera ..quando disegnavo le varie stanze io entravo dentro la casa, io ero l'aragosta che prendeva il thè nel soggiorno coi i trichechi, io ero l'aragosta nella vasca che fa il bagno con i cigni.. scoltando la musica di Ezio Bosso(compositore italiano) ho passato mesi su una piccola scrivania ikea nella mia stanza a disegnare la mia casa, a disegnare la mia storia.

                                           



               What We Need & What You Get

I ask this amount because it is what I'd need to be able to publish the first thousand copies of the book and to participate the Bologna Fair illustration next April and   the London illustration Fair in December 2016..

We calculated that serve:

2000 pw for printing the first thousand copies (A3)

200 pw for Illustratio Fair of Bologna,

100 pw for Illustratio Fair of London,

200 pw materials

                                                  IL LIBRO ,THE BOOK.


Chiedo questa cifra perchè è quanto mi servirebbe per poter pubblicare le prime mille copie del libro e per poter partecipare alla Fiera dell'illustrazione di Bologna il prossimo Aprile e per partecipare alla London illustration Fair a Dicembre..

Abbiamo calcolato che serviranno:

200 pw per la Illustratio Fair of Bologna,

100 pw per la Illustratio Fair of London,

2000 pw per la stampa delle prime mille copie (A3)

200 pw materiali

                                                         A3 POSTERS.

                                                SPILLETTE ,LAPEL PINS.

                            


                                The Impact

I decided to create this campaign to try to make real this book.

It 'hard to find a editor who publishes your work .. especially if you have to work 45 hours a week to pay rent etc ..

With the goal of this campaign I hope to introduce my book in illustration Fair in Italy and England ..

Ho pensato di creare questa campagna per cercare di rendere reale questo libro.

E' difficile riuscire a trovare un editore che pubblichi il tuo lavoro .. sopratutto se si deve lavorare 45 ore a settimana per poter pagare l'affitto ecc..

Con il gol di questa campagna spero di poter far conoscere il mio libro nella Fiera dell'illustrazione in Italia e Londra..

                                      


                    Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can not make a donation would be super helpful if you shared my progette on your facesbook pages !!!
Anche se non potete fare un donazione sarebbe di super aiuto se condivideste il mio progette sulle vostre pagine facesbook !!!

(io) 
(me)
Superthanks!!!

story:
Hello,

Leaving in nowadays makes it nearly impossible to concentrate on your Art.  Most of us -musicians, actors, painters - have to fight through daily social problems.

Yet...... we all have dreams !

The entire amount of the campaign will be used strictly for trip expences, such as  plane tickets, accomodation, food and any other accidental situation that can happen during such big trip.

For this campaign I have some really interesting Perks : 

- My new Marimba Tutorial "Fluent Movements for Marimba."  This tutorial is a continuation of  "Transparent Fluidity," but this time is more about music than just exercises.  I realized that not everyone has my background, or even want to play classical music on marimba. So I asked Ruud Wiener to compose  pieces for my style. The result was AMAZING. !!! The tutorial will be recorded this August and will come out in September

- Skype Sessions: is something I started a couple of years ago. From my experience with students around the world, I can say that this is an effective way of teaching. You can choose from a few sessions, to an entire season (Sept 2016 - June 2017 four sessions a month!!)

  If you are not in a position to contribute, but you like my project and still would like to help somehow, please feel free to spread the word among your friends....

 I thank you all
story_txt:
Hello,
Leaving in nowadays makes it nearly impossible to concentrate on your Art.  Most of us -musicians, actors, painters - have to fight through daily social problems.
Yet...... we all have dreams !

The entire amount of the campaign will be used strictly for trip expences, such as  plane tickets, accomodation, food and any other accidental situation that can happen during such big trip.
For this campaign I have some really interesting Perks : 
- My new Marimba Tutorial "Fluent Movements for Marimba."  This tutorial is a continuation of  "Transparent Fluidity," but this time is more about music than just exercises.  I realized that not everyone has my background, or even want to play classical music on marimba. story:
Contro Corrente

ENG version see below

un progetto fotografico  di Mohamed Keita


Mohamed Keita è un fotografo della Costa D’avorio, ha 23 anni e vive in Italia da quasi sei.

Questa estate è stato uno dei resident artist della quinta edizione di Meno31,  festival di fotografia internazionale dedicato ai fotografi under 31.
Per l'occasione ha realizzato una campagna fotografica in Sardegna dal titolo "Vel Mari", un racconto per immagini che, senza concedere niente agli stereotipi, descrive la comunità di migranti del centro di accoglienza di Alghero.  

Alla fine di questa avventura  Mohamed si è rimesso in viaggio alla volta del Mali per iniziare un nuovo progetto fotografico.
L'idea è quella di ripercorrere i paesi che l'hanno visto migrante e raccontare la strada percorsa attraverso il cambio di prospettiva donatogli dall'esperienza vissuta in Italia.

Chiediamo a tutti gli amanti della fotografia un piccolo sostegno per aiutare Mohamed in questa nuova avventura.

In cambio ci regalerà uno sguardo inedito su di un mondo che troppo spesso vediamo solo dall'esterno.

PER SAPERE QUALI FOTO SONO GIA STATE ACQUISTATE CONTROLLA NELLA SEZIONE "BAKERS"

--------------------------

Mohamed Keita is a photographer from Ivory Cost, he is 23 years old and lived in Italy for 6 years.

This summer was selected to be a resident artist in the 5th edition of Meno31 international photography festival, a festival devoted to help young  photographers under 31 years old.
In this occasion Mohamed made a photographic project in Sardinia (Italy) titled “Vel Marì”, a photographic tale that describes a community of migrants in the shelter for refugees in Alghero.

At the end of this adventure Mohamed  set off on a trip to Mali, to begin a new photographic project. 
The aim is to retrace his own path when he was himself a migrant and document the road covered, this time looking at it through the change of perspective given by his experience in Italy.

We ask to all photography lovers a little help to support Mohamed in this new adventure.

In exchange he will give us a glance into a world that too often we see from the outside. 

the only perk available for INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING is the number 2 :
€50EUR + Shipping
3 catalogues of Meno31
this years edition + 2 catalogues of the past editions

story:
Your generous contribution will assist me in shipping supplies from Oakland, California to Okojobi, Iowa.  Since the piece is site-specific, I will be traveling to Iowa to create and deinstall the work, as well as ship it back to Oakland.  The donation will also alleviate the travel costs which include flight, car rental, and lodging. Finally the piece is time consuming and delicate to build, and you will be helping me pay for the many hours of making the piece.

I am most interested in how objects accumulate in our everyday spaces. My work is motivated by the drama of landscapes and waterways, urban and rural.
I experiment by collecting and transforming everyday materials, especially throwaways. Through photography, drawing, and sculptural installation my notions play upon the unpredictable juxtaposition of natural and synthetic matter.

The water in the piece will be collected  in  the Okojobi region, whereas the plastic bits and shards that color the work have been gathered in waterways in the Pacific, the Atlantic, and the Mediterranean. My work is a small reminder that plastic is toxic to our waters, and my collections of washed debris are an ongoing prevention.  This will be the 6th waterfall installation that I have created.  Others were exhibited in Oakland, San Francisco, Santa Cruz, Maine, and Oregon.

Finally the piece is time consuming and delicate to build, and you will be helping me pay for the many hours of making the piece.I am most interested in how objects accumulate in our everyday spaces. story:
Hello!

My name is Alessandra Chiericato, and I am Italian designer and curator working between Venice and Milan. I am currently working on my latest project, ATV_0.2//RESO, to take place in Venice this November. This exhibition will become a vehicle to understand sound and sculpture and their immediate relation to space. Together, these three distinct elements will form a dialogue of sorts that establishes a new spatiality within our chosen site, the Caos Art Gallery, in the heart of Venice. Within my practice, I like to collaborate with fresh and international artists and use their unique perspectives to collaborate on a strong intervention, and for ATV_0.2//RESO, I will be working with Spatialist Daniel Tollady and Sound Artist & Musician Jon Law.

Exploring notions of becoming and assemblage, Daniel's practice is one that is in a constant state of flux, operating within the ambiguities between Fine Art and Architecture. It is concerned with the creation of a fictional spatiality that uses generative drawing processes and intuitive structural compositions to describe a new spatial experience. A new spatiality that manifests itself through both analogue drawings and physical 1:1 structures. A drawing language and a series of spatial objects that reconfigure themselves each time they are used, never forming a final outcome, or, never achieving a state of being.

Making extensive use of site-specific locational recordings and room tones, Jon's practice is concerned with the creation of immersive sound installations. His installation works are often realised in unconventional sites because of his practice of recording, manipulating and re-introducing locational recordings into their space of origin. This practice is framed as a series of spectral interventions; temporal reconfigurations of the sonic and spatial experience of a space. Sound matter treated as a sculptural form that in its extended use formulates a set of fictions and possibilities for the listener that ghost / trace over the actuality of a space.

Daniel and Jon have previously collaborated on a project together, All Things Vibrations, as part of the Folkestone Triennial's Fringe event in Septemer 2014. Using a series of sound-generating tools and spatial devices, together they established a sound machine that explored a site-dependent aural spatiality. Using the critical skills of the curator, Observance will become a spiritual successor to this previous work.

Whereas ATV was formed through fixed components, ATV_0.2//RESO will be comprised of two fluid systems of architectural sculptural objects and sound-generating protocols. The physical space will become destabilised through the manipulation of the modular design of the installation, nodes and modules that will operate within a state of flux. An installation that establishes a symbiotic relationship of tensions and harmonies between sound, space and structure, alluding to the construction of a spatial machine that explores the physical qualities of sound and the intangible qualities of sculpture.

WE NEED YOU!

As newly-emerging practitioners, we have already built strong CVs of artistic accomplishments achieved through a powerful desire to do as much as we can in the artistic sphere, often self-organised and self-funded. However, this time we need you to help finance our next endeavour. By choosing to support us, you will allow us to do the following:

+ cover the gallery hire costs
+ print high quality marketing material
+ produce a full catalogue of the exhibition, containing written essays by the curator and artists
+ cover material costs for construction of the installation
+ pay for suitable shipping of artwork

And of course, in return for your support, you can receive the following:

$10         Credit in the catalogue
$20         A limited edition CD created by Jon Law
$20         A limited edition print from Daniel Tollady
$20         A previous catalogue from Alessandra Chiericato: The Engine Room / INCIPIT: The Memory Theatre                
$35         A copy of both catalogues
$35         A limited edition print + CD
$55         A limited edition print + CD + catalogue

If you have any questions about us or our project, please feel free to get in touch.
Any support you are willing to offer will be greatly received and will help us to realise this project. Eternal gratitude in advance :)

 

Important Details

Alessandra Chiericato

(w)           http://cargocollective.com/alessandrachiericato
(e)            alessandra.chiericato@gmail.com

Daniel Tollady

(w)           http://danieltollady.co.uk
(e)            daniel.tollady@hotmail.co.uk

Jon Law

(w)           http://jon-law.co.uk
(e)            contact@jonlaw.co.uk

story:
My name is Nina and I am a textile artist, environmentalist, ethnobotanist, horticulturalist, revegetator, activist and lover of plants.  I have been creating natural fibre wearable art dyed with plant dyes and have exhibited in a number of exhibitions and events.  I have just been selected from artists worldwide to participate in the Artist in residence program at Arquetopia in Mexico to study with traditional natural dyers. 

The program includes hands-on instruction with cochineal, añil, and pericon, as well as a few tree barks and fruit skins to complete the color spectrum. This residency is comprehensive program to learn the natural dyes tradition of Oaxaca including resources for a better understanding of the complex culture of Mexico and the history of its colors.

This is an real honour to be selected to study with natural dyers who have ancient traditional cultural knowledge of extracting colour from plants.  This opportunity will allow me to expand my current dyeing practices to create new colours and designs using different plants and techniques.  The use of plant dyes is ancient knowledge which is being lost in many places due to the introduction of synthetic dyes which tend to be brighter but much more toxic to people and the environment.  I am keen to help to preserve this knowlege by practicing and reviving natural plant dye practices.    This is my dream and will allow me to push my dyed artworks to a new level of professionalism.  The money raised goes towards tuition, accommodation, materials and airfares to Mexico.  I really appreciate any donation you can make to help me undertake this artist residency and to learn new skills and techniques to create new wearable artworks!!!  Thank you!! :)

story:
Quest Talent Group 

Hi, so a little bit about myself and my campaign.  I started out in the entertainment industry as a teenager in pageants and local commercials in Florida.  I then decided to pursue modeling and acting full time and have done over 30 commercials, 10 covers, and some notable acting roles on Mad Tv, Auto Focus and Las Vegas.  While I thoroughly enjoyed acting I had always envisioned myself working behind the camera.    I started working as a commercial agent 8 years ago and found that I loved it.  After a year of working as a commercial agent I was running the department and then worked my way into being a theatrical agent.  I absolutely love what I do and love all my clients.  I get to help other people realize there dreams at the same time I am living mine. Please check out the links I have attached so you get an idea of who I am and what I do.

story:
Did you know that...
....there are 7 evident relationships between the Bible and the Tarot!

Until today, a Tarot deck that related to the Bible, had not been made. Yet, there are many indications that confirm the link between the Arcana of the Tarot and the Holy Book of Jews and Christians:

  1. The sculptures and the stained-glass windows of Roman and Gothic churches, and the moralizing medieval texts, depict numerous imagesidentical to the Major Arcana of the Tarot; for example, cardinal and theological Virtues, Death, Angels, Devils, the Last Judgment. Not surprisingly, all the major iconologists of the twentieth century, including eminent esoterics, such as Arthur Edward Waite and Gerard Van Rijnberk, argue that the origin of Tarot is in the Christian iconography of the Middle-Ages.
  2. There are 22 Major Arcana in the Tarot, like the chapters of Revelation of St. John. Many Arcana are, in fact, directly inspired to Revelation.
  3. At the end of the fifteenth century, a Dominican preacher claimed that the inventor of the Tarot had used the images of the Pope, the Angels and even God to drag men into the game.
  4. 4. The Italian jurist Francesco Piscina in his Discussion on the order of the Tarot figures (Mondovì, 1565) described the unknown inventor of the Tarot as a "good and faithful follower of the Catholic and Christian faith". Moreover, Piscina stated that the order of 22 Triumphs shows "many moral teachings ... to bite the bad and pestiferous habits, customary of the populace of today."
  5. The French jurist Guillaume D'Oncieu, in Numeralium locorum Decas (Lyon, 1584) directly linked the subdivision of the Tarot deck to Christian numerology
  6. In the sixteenth and seventeenth reworking of Tarot decks, many Major Arcana still reflected the Christian traditional iconography. It was only at the end of the eighteenth century that the false belief, regarding the Egyptian or Jewish origin of the Tarot, took hold.
  7. In 2008, The Diocesan Museum of Sarsina set up a Tarot exhibition by contemporary artists, entitled The Devil and the Holy water, curated by Prof. Antonio Paolucci, superintendent of the Vatican Museums; the catalogue also listed articles by Alejandro Jodorowski.

 

This Deck is particular and unique!

 

The Author: Giordano Berti

For over 40 years I have studied Tarot... and the passion for this magical game still has not left me.
The vibrations of these symbolic images continue to fluctuate within me.
I studied the Tarot from the historical, artistic, philosophical and divination point of view.
I wrote numerous books, published worldwide, about the Tarot: nonfiction works, encyclopedias and even experiments in narrative where Tarot was the source of inspiration.
On behalf of leading companies, producers of playing cards, I edited a reprint of old Tarots and I wrote the project for new Tarot decks, who were then illustrated by great contemporary artists.

A summary of my studies on the Tarot is in Tarotpedia website: Berti Giordano

The current project I am involved in, is a production of Rinascimento Italian Style Art. The title is "Prophetic Tarot of the Bible".

 

How the Prophetic Tarot of The Bible were conceived

I began working on this deck in 2012, and immediately thought that the most suitable artist to illustrate it should have been Severino Baraldi.

Baraldi is a great Milanese artist, born in that City in 1930, and an expert both in the illustrations of ancient history, and in representing recent events. In addition, he has created various Tarot decks for an important publishing house. We also worked together to create the Tarot of Ramses (2003) and the Oracle of the Celts (2006).
Baraldi was eager to collaborate with me once more, and after four years of deep reflections on historical, ethical and aesthetic topics, we can finally show this stunning deck.

The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is really innovative, primarily because on each card are represented events that occurred thousands of years, but these images are set in modern times.
In many cases, the card illustrations portray characters drawn from contemporary history, for example Pope Karol Wojtyla, the rapper Tupac Shakur, the Swiss doctor Albert Schweitzer, Martin Luther King, John Lennon, Sigmund Freud and others.
It will be up to you to discover other more or less famous people.

 

Contents of the Deck

Because you can not summarize in 78 images a gigantic book as the Bible, I have chosen just 78 topics related to contemporary history that Baraldi has depicted with modern and dynamic scenes: for example, the tragic events such as the migrations, famines and wars, but also episodes joyful and uplifting as the return to peace, the help to the poor and oppressed, the dialogue between representatives of different religions to make the Earth a common home of all peoples.
In conclusion, this deck contains a variety of teaching inspired by the Bible, but in harmony with any religion.
The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is a source of inspiration for anyone, man or woman of any nation and religion, to encounter social, work, family and affective problems.
From these 78 cards, the Consultant will receive daily tips to clarify the present and to act in the best way.

 

HERE ARE THE FOUR ACES

 

How to use these cards

This deck follows the great tradition of "educational Tarot decks" but it goes beyond the purely learning functions. In fact, the 78 cards should be used as a source of inspiration for the people of our time in dealing with everyday problems. 
A handbook (112 pages) explains in detail the meanings of the 78 cards, shows the references to the biblical text, and teaches how to use the deck for consultations. 
The 22 Trump cards expresses fundamental aspects of human experiences in the material world, intellectual, and spiritual.
Cups represent moments of peace and joy, either material or spiritual.
Pentacles symbolize material successes or failures of the Consultant.
Wands relate to consultant’s trade or job and to political or professional relationships.
Swords relate to conflicts in the environment where one lives or where one works, or even one’s health problems. 
In practice, all figures have a “prophetical meaning” in a biblical sense. More precisely, they describe an existential condition that each person is able to improve by interpreting the cards, drawn by following a divination ritual.

 

THESE ARE THE TRUMPS

 

Versions of the Deck

The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is available in two versions, both share the same instruction booklet.
The Deluxe version is produced in a limited edition: 700 copies, numbered and signed by the illustrator, Maestro Severino Baraldi.
The paper weight is 320 grams and the size of the cards is 80x152 mm (= 3” 5/32 x 5” 63/64). 
All cards are printed in full colour, both front and back.
The 78 cards are contained in an elegant box designed by art designer Letizia Rivetti.
The Standard version is not a limited edition.
The paper weight is 320 grams and the size of the cards is 60x114 mm (= 2” 23/64 x 4” 31/64).
All cards are printed in full colour, both on front and back.
The 78 cards are contained in an Art box, also designed by art designer Letizia Rivetti.

NEWS

We are launching this new Perk!

 

Stage 

Our Card are ready for use...We are still in the construction phase of our "treasure chests", we are developing the exceptional finishings for boxes that contain these magnificent and unique Tarot!

 

What i need and what you get

The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is finally ready for the printers.
Now I need your help to raise the € 18.000 which will cover the printing and shipping costs. Obviously, your help will be rewarded with a work of your choice, depending on the level of participation.
You will be rewarded even if I don’t reach the goal.
The item of your choice will be sent to you from April 2017.
You can read below the list of available products. Of course, you can order more than one product, and this will increase your level of participation.
The shipping can be anywhere in the world, however, costs will vary, depending on the destination.

 

Other Ways You Can Help to Realize this Edition

Even if you do not decide to pre-order your deck at this time, but you like the project, please help us spread this promotion to your Tarot friends by simply make them aware of it or, even better, by sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, etc.

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR HELP!

 

PERK

ALL THE PERKS HAVE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING - sorry for the confusing title of the Perks, we are trying to solve the problem - Thankyou

Prophetic Arcana - 22€
limited DELUXE sale - 67€
1 Print - 27€
1 STANDARD Box - 34€
1 STANDARD Box + 1 Print - 59€
2 STANDARD Box - 64€

story_txt:
Did you know that.......there are 7 evident relationships between the Bible and the Tarot!
Until today, a Tarot deck that related to the Bible, had not been made. Yet, there are many indications that confirm the link between the Arcana of the Tarot and the Holy Book of Jews and Christians:

The sculptures and the stained-glass windows of Roman and Gothic churches, and the moralizing medieval texts, depict numerous imagesidentical to the Major Arcana of the Tarot; for example, cardinal and theological Virtues, Death, Angels, Devils, the Last Judgment. Not surprisingly, all the major iconologists of the twentieth century, including eminent esoterics, such as Arthur Edward Waite and Gerard Van Rijnberk, argue that the origin of Tarot is in the Christian iconography of the Middle-Ages.
There are 22 Major Arcana in the Tarot, like the chapters of Revelation of St. John. Many Arcana are, in fact, directly inspired to Revelation.
At the end of the fifteenth century, a Dominican preacher claimed that the inventor of the Tarot had used the images of the Pope, the Angels and even God to drag men into the game.
4. The Italian jurist Francesco Piscina in his Discussion on the order of the Tarot figures (Mondovì, 1565) described the unknown inventor of the Tarot as a "good and faithful follower of the Catholic and Christian faith". Moreover, Piscina stated that the order of 22 Triumphs shows "many moral teachings ... to bite the bad and pestiferous habits, customary of the populace of today."
The French jurist Guillaume D'Oncieu, in Numeralium locorum Decas (Lyon, 1584) directly linked the subdivision of the Tarot deck to Christian numerology
In the sixteenth and seventeenth reworking of Tarot decks, many Major Arcana still reflected the Christian traditional iconography. It was only at the end of the eighteenth century that the false belief, regarding the Egyptian or Jewish origin of the Tarot, took hold.
In 2008, The Diocesan Museum of Sarsina set up a Tarot exhibition by contemporary artists, entitled The Devil and the Holy water, curated by Prof. Antonio Paolucci, superintendent of the Vatican Museums; the catalogue also listed articles by Alejandro Jodorowski.

 
This Deck is particular and unique!
 
The Author: Giordano Berti
For over 40 years I have studied Tarot... and the passion for this magical game still has not left me.The vibrations of these symbolic images continue to fluctuate within me.I studied the Tarot from the historical, artistic, philosophical and divination point of view.I wrote numerous books, published worldwide, about the Tarot: nonfiction works, encyclopedias and even experiments in narrative where Tarot was the source of inspiration.On behalf of leading companies, producers of playing cards, I edited a reprint of old Tarots and I wrote the project for new Tarot decks, who were then illustrated by great contemporary artists.
A summary of my studies on the Tarot is in Tarotpedia website: Berti Giordano
The current project I am involved in, is a production of Rinascimento Italian Style Art. The title is "Prophetic Tarot of the Bible".
 

How the Prophetic Tarot of The Bible were conceived
I began working on this deck in 2012, and immediately thought that the most suitable artist to illustrate it should have been Severino Baraldi.
Baraldi is a great Milanese artist, born in that City in 1930, and an expert both in the illustrations of ancient history, and in representing recent events. In addition, he has created various Tarot decks for an important publishing house. We also worked together to create the Tarot of Ramses (2003) and the Oracle of the Celts (2006).Baraldi was eager to collaborate with me once more, and after four years of deep reflections on historical, ethical and aesthetic topics, we can finally show this stunning deck.
The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is really innovative, primarily because on each card are represented events that occurred thousands of years, but these images are set in modern times.In many cases, the card illustrations portray characters drawn from contemporary history, for example Pope Karol Wojtyla, the rapper Tupac Shakur, the Swiss doctor Albert Schweitzer, Martin Luther King, John Lennon, Sigmund Freud and others.It will be up to you to discover other more or less famous people.

 

Contents of the Deck
Because you can not summarize in 78 images a gigantic book as the Bible, I have chosen just 78 topics related to contemporary history that Baraldi has depicted with modern and dynamic scenes: for example, the tragic events such as the migrations, famines and wars, but also episodes joyful and uplifting as the return to peace, the help to the poor and oppressed, the dialogue between representatives of different religions to make the Earth a common home of all peoples.In conclusion, this deck contains a variety of teaching inspired by the Bible, but in harmony with any religion.The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is a source of inspiration for anyone, man or woman of any nation and religion, to encounter social, work, family and affective problems.From these 78 cards, the Consultant will receive daily tips to clarify the present and to act in the best way.
 
HERE ARE THE FOUR ACES

 

How to use these cards
This deck follows the great tradition of "educational Tarot decks" but it goes beyond the purely learning functions. In fact, the 78 cards should be used as a source of inspiration for the people of our time in dealing with everyday problems. A handbook (112 pages) explains in detail the meanings of the 78 cards, shows the references to the biblical text, and teaches how to use the deck for consultations. The 22 Trump cards expresses fundamental aspects of human experiences in the material world, intellectual, and spiritual.Cups represent moments of peace and joy, either material or spiritual.Pentacles symbolize material successes or failures of the Consultant.Wands relate to consultant’s trade or job and to political or professional relationships.Swords relate to conflicts in the environment where one lives or where one works, or even one’s health problems. In practice, all figures have a “prophetical meaning” in a biblical sense. More precisely, they describe an existential condition that each person is able to improve by interpreting the cards, drawn by following a divination ritual.
 
THESE ARE THE TRUMPS




 
Versions of the Deck
The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is available in two versions, both share the same instruction booklet.The Deluxe version is produced in a limited edition: 700 copies, numbered and signed by the illustrator, Maestro Severino Baraldi.The paper weight is 320 grams and the size of the cards is 80x152 mm (= 3” 5/32 x 5” 63/64). All cards are printed in full colour, both front and back.The 78 cards are contained in an elegant box designed by art designer Letizia Rivetti.The Standard version is not a limited edition.The paper weight is 320 grams and the size of the cards is 60x114 mm (= 2” 23/64 x 4” 31/64).All cards are printed in full colour, both on front and back.The 78 cards are contained in an Art box, also designed by art designer Letizia Rivetti.

NEWS
We are launching this new Perk!

 
Stage 
Our Card are ready for use...We are still in the construction phase of our "treasure chests", we are developing the exceptional finishings for boxes that contain these magnificent and unique Tarot!

 
What i need and what you get
The Prophetic Tarot of the Bible is finally ready for the printers.Now I need your help to raise the € 18.000 which will cover the printing and shipping costs. Obviously, your help will be rewarded with a work of your choice, depending on the level of participation.You will be rewarded even if I don’t reach the goal.The item of your choice will be sent to you from April 2017.You can read below the list of available products. Of course, you can order more than one product, and this will increase your level of participation.The shipping can be anywhere in the world, however, costs will vary, depending on the destination.
 

Other Ways You Can Help to Realize this Edition
Even if you do not decide to pre-order your deck at this time, but you like the project, please help us spread this promotion to your Tarot friends by simply make them aware of it or, even better, by sharing this page on Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, etc.
THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR HELP!
 
PERK
ALL THE PERKS HAVE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING - sorry for the confusing title of the Perks, we are trying to solve the problem - Thankyou

story:
My name is Micheal Stark. I was born in Chicago Jan 21, 1948. I Co- produced the weekly Group Image rock show in NYC, reviewed in Glamour magazine "the place to go in N.Y.C."; Have extensive construction skills learned purchasing business at the Big Apple Circus in New York; Founded the "Stark Reality" theater company in Woodstock N.Y.; performed in New York, Cape Cod Mass, and Paris France at the historic Shakespeare & company bookstore and Received the dancing poetry award for the Poem "Fear and Paranoia" at the Florence Gould theater in the Legion of Honor, San Francisco's premier fine arts Museum. I also studied native american art history at Mendocino community collage.

Art is healing. There is a lot of healing needed by the indigenous of the earth, and especially, of north america. They have suffered spoken and unspoken horrors over the last five centuries. Let us pour a drop of honey into this ocean of despair and pain.

The gallery will feature rotating exhibits including the work of indigenous people from the surrounding area and beyond, as well as a shared work space for use by the artists and local community. This space will also be used for classes and workshops in traditional Pomo basket weaving and more.

What you get for your donation

Every donor will receive a formal invitation to our grand opening in Ukiah, CA. A donation of 50 dollars or more qualifies the donor to receive a piece of handcrafted bead-work by one of our contributing artists.

What we do with your donation

All money raised by this campaign will go towards renting a space for the gallery, compensating artists for the perk items used in this campaign, application fees to acquire non-profit status (about 1,200$), and paying wages for maintenance of the the physical gallery as well as the creation and maintenance of an online gallery.

story:
Hi.

I'm a generative artist. I act/write/photograph/ create spectacles. 

These postcards are from my installation Necessary Exposure: The Female Playwright Project which is on view at Dixon Place through March 7th. (It's about bringing awareness to women playwrights and what it is to be writing at this time in history.)

I want you to send them to your representatives or someone you love who needs a bit of a pick me up. In fact, I'm going to throw a party so we can all get together and make that happen date and time TBA, most likely April 2017 (location sent with purchase of cards).

The cost of 6 cards covers printing, a small donation to the playwright or their charity of choice, Necessary Exposure and processing fees.

There are 6 different cards in each pack of postcards. They represent a few things people have been writing their representatives about. Check out the photos above to view the cards in the pack.

story:
Although Kunio Sato has had numerous exhibitions in Japan since the 1980s, this will be the first exhibition for the artist abroad.  Renowned for his woodblock prints of Kenji Miyazawa’s stories and poems, such as “Night on the Milky Way Train” and “Strong in the Rain,” Kunio Sato’s works powerfully express the traditional spirit of Japan, emphasizing harmony with all nature.

Japan has a long tradition of woodblock printing or Ukiyo-e ranging from Katsushika Hokusai to Shiko Munakata.  Kunio Sato’s original style of woodblock prints are forthright and simple, combining rural Japan with the imaginary realms and beings of Kenji Miyazawa. Through Kunio Sato’s work, Miyazawa’s childlike passion and spirit leaps to life, turning the observer into the dreamer.

 

ご挨拶：

”宮沢賢治の世界ー佐藤国男木版画展”プロジェクトのニューヨーク担当島京子です。

 昨年の１１月に、長年のニューヨーク滞在から日本へ帰国した友達が久しぶりにNYにやってきました。その彼女と再会した時、彼女の友人である佐藤国男氏の作品を見せてくれました。その時、その作品の素朴さや力強さにとても魅かれたと同時に、懐かしさや温かさの思いが溢れ、自分が忘れかけていたとても大切なものに出会えて感動したのです。

 この作品をぜひニューヨークの人々に観せたい、観てもらいたいと思い、この個展開催のプロジェトをその友人を含め数人で立ち上げました。

日本人である私たちはきっとどこかで佐藤氏の作品に触れたことがあると思います。それは学校の教科書だったり、宮沢賢治の童話の本だったりします。私たちは知らないうちに、宮沢賢治のお話の世界を、佐藤国男氏の版画を通してビジュアル化しています。それほど彼の作品は宮沢賢治の世界観を表現しているともいえるのです。

その宮沢賢治の精神性とは“自然とともにある”もっといえば、宇宙との調和です。人がその人らしく生きる、自然や動物、いや生きとしいけるものすべてと共存する愛の世界です。その世界をぜひ佐藤国男の版画展で観て、感じて体感してください。

この個展開催のプロジェクトにご支援いただけますようどうぞよろしくお願いいたします。

また、ぜひギャラリーに足をお運びくださいませ。お待ちしております。

About the Artist

Born 1952 in Hokkaido, Japan, Kunio Sato wanted to be a painter and an archaeologist in his childhood.  He studied Buddhism at college while working as a carpenter. He began woodcutting with pieces of wood he found at construction sites where he was working. Since 1987 Sato’s woodcut prints have appeared in many editions of Miyazawa’s stories.

Besides illustrating Miyazawa’s books, Kunio Sato has published books about the Jomon period. He also writes essays and regularly submits humorous articles to the Hokkaido Newspaper which have been anticipated and enjoyed by the people of Hokkaido for many years.

TENRI GALLARY

43-A W 13 Street, New York, NY 10011  TEL: 212-645-2800

 

What we need

・Gallery cost                                                          $2400

・Reading Recitals                                                   $700

・Reception Party                                                    $300

・Mailing cost for the works from Japan         $800

・Promotion fee                                                        $700

・Products for Return, Shipping                         $600

 

What you can get as a return

・No need perk?  Thank you!   You can contribute imply by clicking the pink button"back it"at   the very top of my campaign page.

・Perk #1    Postcards: A set of 4 postcards with illustrations each from Kenji's stories.

・Perk #2   Tote Bag: Cotton Sheeting Natural Economy Tote with Kunio's illustration.

・Perk #3    T-Shirts: Custom T-Shirts with Kunio's illustration. This is special for the show.

・Perk #4   Japanese Kimono Bag: Made of Japanese beautiful Kimono fabric, it is foldable.

・Perk #5   Kunio's Woodbock Print : Original  print with Mat frame.(size: 9 x 13 inch)

story:
Hello!

My name is Elyse Saunders and I'm a fine art illustrator. I'm creating the first in what will hopefully become a collectible series of hand-painted figurines celebrating many forms of feminine strength and beauty with a healthy dose of sass. 

This piece is called You Have No Talent because, at the time, I felt like I wasn’t taken seriously. Not as an artist, not as a person with dreams and ideas, and not as a woman. I felt like I constantly had to prove myself and that, no matter how hard I tried, I was granted or denied various privileges based solely on my gender. This gave me constant doubt; did someone want to collaborate with me on an artistic endeavor because of my talent or because they wanted to sleep with me? I felt like I was proving myself to judges who had already made their verdict; one that wasn't based on the skills I was showcasing.

I am passionate about feminine strength, which I encourage throughout my work. This first edition of figurines is reminiscent of the classic Barbie Doll form, which we all know to be unrealistic and even alienating and yet seems to set the standard for female beauty. In a cheeky rebellion, I'm attempting to make it more relatable and inclusive by painting the series in diverse skin tones and physical attributes (eg. transgendered bodies and differently-abled bodies) and decorations such as tattoos and freckles etc. In future editions, I look forward to creating different sculptures for many more body types.

To create the figurines, I need the help of GreatBeard Sculptures; my talented Canadian collaborators! Sculpting, molding and casting (with resin) requires talent, time and expensive materials. With your contributions, you'll help this project come to life. I won't be able to do this without your help!

The Plan

I'm raising $10,000 to make one hundred 15" resin-cast sculptures of my piece "You Have No Talent." Each figurine will be hand painted and embellished by yours truly. For $350 you'll get  one of these hand-painted figurines in the skin-tone of your choosing. I'm also offering a premium edition for $750, which will offer more elaborate details such as piercings or tattoos, body hair, different nipple shapes, etc!

If you're looking for other goodies, check out the PERKS section :)

If I don't reach my total goal (I know it's a lot), I'll just be chipping away at this project a lot more slowly, and it'll take longer to get to those other bodies I want to represent. ALL of this money is intended to go to my collaborators, Elaine & Paolo of GreatBeard, for the sculpting and casting costs. 

Challenges

It took a while to find such talented sculpting/casting team, but they're up to the challenge. Their portfolio is as killer as their vibe and I know we're going to make beautiful things together. I can't imagine working with anyone else! Elaine and Paolo are pros and are worth every penny... but I need a lot more pennies :)

Thanks for Reading this Far!

If you want to help but can't contribute, I love you anyway so please spread the word about my project! 

XOXO

Elyse

story:
"Do you still believe that photography is better than a portrait? You are very mistaken! " Being an interior designer, and by education as an architect, I loved drawing all my life. A few years ago I got carried away with hyperrealism - a detailed transfer of the depicted subject, from which the pictures become like a photograph.

 

I'm from Nizhny Novgorod.

 

I was fascinated by writing unique pencil pictures that are difficult to distinguish from photographs. I paint every detail so carefully that the picture becomes literally a "live" photograph.

 

Each of my paintings are in pencil, unique. I graduated from an architectural university, worked as an interior designer. I did not study specially drawing, I achieve this amazing realism and emotionality of portraits with the help of the usual automatic pencil and eraser. He paints from childhood. He paints portraits from the age of 12.

My style in art refers, rather, to "hyperrealism." I drew many celebrities: Rihanna, Christina Aguilera, Robert Downey, Jr., but now I'm drawing action-packed and emotional pictures-photos. I paint for myself. The pencil work is time-consuming, for some "photos" it takes me 3 to 5 days and even more. Sometimes it takes months for a lot of work.

 

I dream of my own studio, where I can create new pictures.

 

On the walls of my studio, I want to write a portrait of each supporter to keep the memory of him forever.

 

Please support me and my work.
story_txt:
"Do you still believe that photography is better than a portrait? You are very mistaken! " Being an interior designer, and by education as an architect, I loved drawing all my life. A few years ago I got carried away with hyperrealism - a detailed transfer of the depicted subject, from which the pictures become like a photograph.

 
I'm from Nizhny Novgorod.
 
I was fascinated by writing unique pencil pictures that are difficult to distinguish from photographs. I paint every detail so carefully that the picture becomes literally a "live" photograph.
 
Each of my paintings are in pencil, unique. I graduated from an architectural university, worked as an interior designer. I did not study specially drawing, I achieve this amazing realism and emotionality of portraits with the help of the usual automatic pencil and eraser. He paints from childhood. He paints portraits from the age of 12.

My style in art refers, rather, to "hyperrealism." I drew many celebrities: Rihanna, Christina Aguilera, Robert Downey, Jr., but now I'm drawing action-packed and emotional pictures-photos. I paint for myself. The pencil work is time-consuming, for some "photos" it takes me 3 to 5 days and even more. Sometimes it takes months for a lot of work.
 
I dream of my own studio, where I can create new pictures.
 
On the walls of my studio, I want to write a portrait of each supporter to keep the memory of him forever.
 
Please support me and my work.

story:
Short Summary

The South Bay Art Collective is a group of Burning Man enthusiasts in the Silicon Valley area who are dedicated to a year-round experience of building art for the Burning Man event.  Prior burned art pieces include:

2017 - Deus Ex Machina

2015 - Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow

2014 - Occidental Oasis (Souk marketplace around the Man)

2013 - Mission Umbrae (CORE)

2012 - Valley of Heart's Delight (CORE)

2011 - Laptop Man (CORE)

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise over $15,000 this year, and if we raise that we can add Burning pyrotechnic special effects!  This Worm is being designed with the burn in mind, and we promise to make it the most spectacular burn we've ever put on!  Although we have about half of our funding secured, we are really going to need help for the pyrotechnics, kinetics, and interactivity that we envision to become a reality.  Since we're kicking up the expenses a notch, the perks this year are getting kicked up a notch, too!  

With everything from exclusive custom-stitched hoodies to a participatory experience on Burn Night, we want to make sure that you feel a part of this amazing project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, email and your social networks.

Tax deductible donation link:  https://southbayburners.org/get-involved/southb...

Point people to our new web page, www.southbay-artcollective.org 

Watch for updates on www.southbayburners.org 

Please keep checking back on this Indigogo page as we add more perks and donation levels that might be of interest to you!

story:
Personal background

Marcus and I were very close friends for many years and in 2016 the idea came up that it was time that we also did an artistic collaboration together. When the demons appeared to me, I showed them to him and it immediately clicked, THIS is the project we would want to do together. We began to work, write the text, him composing, me printing the demons, worked out the details, found the perfect venue which we visited together and we were both very excited. We called ourselves Demon warriors. Then he got the amazing opportunity to compose the scores for The Terror, and he had to move to London for half a year for that. We realised it was a full time job for him so we decided to postpone our show for a year. He was meant to come back to Berlin and finish this project together and eventually show it in 2018 autumn. Then he tragically passed away... A wonderful soul, way too sudden, way too soon… A few months later, as part of my mourning, I looked at the project again and decided I won’t let it get lost. With his dear family’s approval and support, I decided to finish this collaboration and bring it to life. Now with an extra layer, I look at these demons again, how they are gazing at us, we also gaze into a different, otherworldly dimension, and his yet unheard music playing, which is the language of the connection between the two worlds - and feel, instead of standing with us, gazing into there, he has switched to the other side, and I would like to believe that he will be there, looking at us, and talking to us through his music, so realising this installation would be a way to meet him once again…

Some wonderful people who either knew him personally or were touched by the story are helping me to realise this exhibition in memory of Marcus, for which I am tremendously thankful for.

That being said, sadly the original plan for funding fell through, so even though we tailored the budget to the minimum, we are still lacking the funds to make it happen. Therefore I am asking you, if you are able to, please help me realise this exhibition with a donation.

Demonography

The titular demons of this photo series appeared when I was working on my previous series, Symmetry. While arranging and rearranging the photos, mirroring, inversing, and pasting them together in order to find geometrical or figurative symmetries, these apparitions materialized. According to the historical vedic of tradition, demons can be observed by those whose third eye has been activated. This prompted the question: does the lens of the camera function as that third eye?

Historically, demons have not always been considered malevolent. To the shamanistic tribes of North America and Central Asia, they were not subject to the conventional western idea of dividing the world into good or bad. Not guided by human sensibilities, these presumed demons were seen as being oblivious to our laws, rules and ethics, just as nature itself. When deciding to make themselves known to us humans, they are said to put on a face in order for us to recognise them. We need eyes to look into, a mouth that can talk to us, ears that can listen to us. When wearing these human elements, for a moment they allow a connection between these two completely separate but equally complex worlds that exist parallel to each other.

Every step of my work is carried out within the analog domain. I develop the negatives, then enlarge, flatten and retouch the final prints. The photographs are large in scale; the excessive enlargement, as well as being pleasing to the eye, also helps in building a substantial sculpture, a totem to these demons, and the prints of these images are printed upon becomes the window between the two worlds, through which – from both sides – we can gaze into each other's realities.

This photo series is conceived as a celebration of this special moment of connection.

To further shape the personalities and emotional qualities of the demons, composer Marcus Fjellström gives the demons their own voice through specifically constructed compositions and soundscapes. With the added dimension of a carefully considered musical interpretation for the various demons, their identities are being clarified and made all the more relatable to our human senses.

In an installation setup, the demons will be mounted on the walls of the exhibition space, while sound pieces are played consecutively in a loop over loudspeakers installed behind each photograph.

Venue

Small Water Reservoir in Prenzlauerberg, Berlin.

The former Wasserspeicher in Prenzlauer Berg is an extraordinary structure, dazzling audiences with its underground arcades and aging red brick textures. Over the years, this unique place has been hosting various performances and installations of sound, light and video.

 

The excellent acoustics of the space, coupled with its unique underground scenery of a circular structure, makes it a perfect venue for this particular show. As the spectator stands at the centre of the space, surrounded by the imagery and the multi-directional sound, a fully immersive atmosphere is created which in turn helps to bring the demons to life.

Csilla Szabo

Csilla Szabó is a fine art photographer and analogue B&W printer, born in Budapest, lives and works in Berlin. She has printed exhibitions for international artists, conducts printing, photogram and portfolio workshops in her darkroom in Berlin, and she is for hire to do B&W analog portraiture.

Parallel to her commissioned work, she’s been diligently creating her own photographic works of art. Recently, she has participated in several exhibitions, and her works can be found in different art collections such as that of the Ritz Carlton Hotel Budapest and in private collections in New York, Paris, Hong-Kong, Berlin, and Budapest.

www.csillaszabo.com

Marcus Fjellström

Marcus’ work ranges from the purely orchestral through electronic music and audiovisual work. He had worked with the Swedish Royal Ballet, the Scottish Chamber Orchestra and Sinfonietta Cracovia, as well as numerous other orchestras, ensembles and soloists, independent record labels, artists and filmmakers.

Fjellström studied composition and orchestration at the School of Music in Piteå, Sweden, graduating with honors in 2005. One month after graduation his debut full-length album "Exercises in Estrangement" was released by Lampse Audiovisual Recordings to enthusiastic reviews. The following year his second album "Gebrauchsmusik" was released by the same label, and in 2010 the album "Schattenspieler" was released by Miasmah Recordings.

Recent projects include the audiovisual chamber opera ​“Boris Christ”​, in collaboration with Norrbotten NEO, the symphonic dance piece "AGAIN", in collaboration with choreographer Ina Christel Johannessen and NorrlandsOperan, "Epilogue -M-", EP release including visual art by artist/designer Bas Mantel, "Skelektikon", a new EP release, and scoring the music for the AMC series "The Terror".

https://www.youtube.com/user/Kafkagarden

What We Need

The amount of money that is needed to realise this project consists the following:

Rental of the venue, utilities, deposit: 1700 Euros

Photographic materials: 1300 Euros

Sound material (individual speakers/ audio players mounted behind each photograph): 600 Euros

Light material (spot lights on each picture): 600 Euros

Posters, flyers, teaser video: 600 Euros

Token for the friends who are helping (production, sound, light, translation, documentation, etc): 7 x 300 Euros

Other (transportation, cost of vernissage, taxes, Indiegogo fees, pr, etc): 988 Euros

What You Get

The different perks you can choose from consist the following:

Postcards designed specifically for this project (design to be announced later)

Posters designed specifically for this project (design to be announced later)

Original signed, editioned analog fiber prints, which are discounted for the time of this campaign. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In case you are not in the position to help us financially, then please do not hesitate to spread the word. Please get in contact with us, we are grateful for every feedback and every share. Thank you!

Website: https://www.csillaszabo.com/demonography/

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/881351675392761/

Credits:

Teaser video is made by: Johan Planefeldt

Holding the production (and sometimes me) together : Royati Ami

Magician of sound and speakers : Dave Senan

Further Demons:

story:
About us

yoyo tinz, Accra based start up, has over the years been committed to documenting, promoting and archiving the African hip hop culture. In 2018 we are celebrating our fifth year. On that occasion we wish to organise our very first festival.

The Festival

The yoyo tinz festival, planned for November 2018, will be two-day-physical enactments of all the work we do in highlighting hip hop culture in it's fullness - representing all the elements - rap, graffiti, beatboxing, breakdancing, DJing, movies, photography, fashion... we have, numerous exciting and informative activities planned.

With a very blatant anti-bigotry, anti-racism and anti-misogyny policy - both on our digital and physical platforms - we have intended - and succeeded to a large extent - to have all our spaces be all-inclusive, and safe for marginalised, oppressed members of our society - women, queers, and other minorities. We hope for our festival to become the very first minorities friendly hip hop festival in Ghana.

In the past, we have helped outfits like Alliance Française, Accra, organise successful hip hop festivals; and we have also consistently, for four years, had thrilling, magnificent yoyo tinz appearances at the very popular annual Chale Wote Street Art Festival in Accra; with our crowd-pulling ability increasing by the year - into thousands.

Our challenges

Our main challenge is that the culture is still misunderstood. Majority of hip hop artists do not benefit from support, for that reason some elements of the hip hop culture suffer and are under represented moreover, some artists themselves do not dare to fully embrace the culture. We want to feature in the festival internationally renown artists who can share their experiences and be an inspiration, especially women. We wish to create discussions, collaborations, share knowledge, create links between artistes in Africa & the Diaspora.

Similarly, for such a project, yoyo tinz does not get any financial support. For years we have been doing our activities based on favours, family and friends' support and personal funds. This time around we want everyone involved in the festival to get payed: volunteers, artists, technicians, cleaners, photographers...

We have estimated the expenses to approximately 50,000 euros, the crowfunding campaign represents 50% of our budget as follows:

Other Ways You Can Help

- share the news widely about the festival
- we are open to batter agreements and any other collaborations
- feel free to lend or donate equipment if 
- do not hesitate to contact us if you have any other suggestion/ideas or if your aunty/uncle owns a company interested in supporting the yoyo tinz festival ! :) 

Let's make it happen, for the culture!!!

story:
Want to see other creative masterpieces about our cat?

Music Videos A Children's Book

 

 

FAQ

How do I claim my Petsy canvas?

After backing us (thank you!!), we'll message you details for claiming your canvas. You can start your order on the same day.

How long does it take?

After placing an order, your design will be ready for review in less than 72 hours. Once you confirm the artwork, your Petsy will ship directly to your doorstep via UPS.

What do I get?

A gorgeous one-of-a-kind canvas, ready to hang (no mounting hardware or assembly required) that you and your pet will love.

Will I see my design before it's printed?

Yes! And you’ll be able to request a revision if you like.

How is my Petsy designed?

Using your guidance, our artists digitally paint each order to create a stunning, personal work of art. Just like your pet, your Petsy is unique! We never use templates or filters. Our team has years of experience in graphic design and computer vision, allowing our art to evolve and innovate. Whether you want a timeless classic, something trendy, or a modern conversation piece, we will bring your vision to life.

Is it a painting?

It’s a digital painting (welcome to the #future!), hand-designed by one of our artists.

What if I don't know what style I want?

No sweat! Our team of designers will create something epic, whether you have a set vision in mind or just want a great piece of art.

What if I don’t like my design?

Don’t worry, we will work with you until you LOVE your design!

What kind of photo should I submit?

A quick pic from your phone or social media will do the trick! Don’t stress about finding the perfect photo; our designers will contact you if we need additional pictures. You can also peep our photo guidelines here.

What sizes do the canvases come in?

Our canvases come in 4 different sizes: 8x8", 8×12″, 16×24″, 24×36″. Whether you want a landscape, portrait, or square-shaped canvas, we got your back!

Are the canvases mounted?

Yes! Your canvas will arrive stretched and mounted on a wooden frame, ready to be hung in all its glory.

How many pets can be in one Petsy?

Up to 8 pets per Petsy! You can add additional faces in the order form. Please submit a photo with all of the pets together.

How do I receive perks other than the canvases?

We’ll email you within 48 hours with detailed instructions on claiming your rewards!



 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we'd be so honored to have your help in the following ways:

The more eyes on our campaign, the more people we can serve! If you have any pet lovers in your life, let them know that their glorious canvas is only a few clicks away.

Please help us get the word out even further by clicking the share button on the top of the screen.

 

Technical details

 

  1. Proudly made in the USA
  2. The following sizes are available: 8x8", 8x12", 18x24", 24x36"
  3. Canvases are printed with HP Latex Inks that are fade resistant. Inks are water based and solvent free so rest assured there are no harsh chemicals in your home
  4. All canvas prints are wrapped and shipped in fitted packaging with 0.75” thick wood frame
  5. After claiming a Petsy as one of your perks, you'll receive order instructions and your complimentary code the same day
  6. After submitting your order, your design will be ready to approve in less than 48 hours
  7. The production time is 2-3 days between approval and shipping
  8. Domestic shipping is via UPS and takes approx 3-5 days; International can take up to 12 days
  9. Shipping in the USA is on us!

Our canvases come in 4 different sizes: 8x8", 8×12″, 16×24″, 24×36″. Whether you want a landscape, portrait, or square-shaped canvas, we got your back!
Are the canvases mounted?
Yes! Your canvas will arrive stretched and mounted on a wooden frame, ready to be hung in all its glory.
How many pets can be in one Petsy?
Up to 8 pets per Petsy! You can add additional faces in the order form. Please submit a photo with all of the pets together.
How do I receive perks other than the canvases?
We’ll email you within 48 hours with detailed instructions on claiming your rewards!
 Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, we'd be so honored to have your help in the following ways:
The more eyes on our campaign, the more people we can serve! If you have any pet lovers in your life, let them know that their glorious canvas is only a few clicks away.
Please help us get the word out even further by clicking the share button on the top of the screen.
 
Technical details
 

Proudly made in the USA
The following sizes are available: 8x8", 8x12", 18x24", 24x36"
Canvases are printed with HP Latex Inks that are fade resistant. Inks are water based and solvent free so rest assured there are no harsh chemicals in your home
All canvas prints are wrapped and shipped in fitted packaging with 0.75” thick wood frame
After claiming a Petsy as one of your perks, you'll receive order instructions and your complimentary code the same day
After submitting your order, your design will be ready to approve in less than 48 hours
The production time is 2-3 days between approval and shipping
Domestic shipping is via UPS and takes approx 3-5 days; International can take up to 12 days
Shipping in the USA is on us!

story:
Hi, we are studio Muho

Hi, we are studio Muho and we are from Kraków, Poland. Muho is a male name of Croatian origin — apparently not a very common one. People with this name are thought to be creative and strong. We don't know if this is true, but we do like this explanation. We are designers, thinkers, artists and copywriters. And we do love nice, minimalist design.

 

Posters

We present to you our collections of original posters. Three graphically different minimal collections – because we are all different. Ola’s favorite thing is having fun in the workshop experimenting with different designs and materials. Maria’s obsession is typographic details — the little things most people don’t even notice. Mateusz loves using photomanipulation to give images a second meaning. These posters are our way of expressing ourselves. We believe that quality matters, and that is why we want to print our designs ourselves with carefully selected printing methods and high quality paper.

Each poster is 70 x 100 cm and will be printed here in Kraków on nice uncoated Munken Lynx Rough 120 g paper. The Typo collection will be custom created with screenprinting — a process which allows us to use inks and textures which cannot be achieved through offset or digital printing alone. The Animals series will be digital printed, which allow for great clarity and minute detail,  and the Circle collection will be a mix of both methods.

We offer three distinct collections of posters. Each one represents a different designer and a different mood and our individual passion for design. Each of the nine posters tells its own story.

 

Circle collection

The Circle collection includes three posters with different circle graphics in black and white. Two of these have metallic gold accents which bring them alive. In keeping with our minimalist aesthetic, Ola’s posters are based on circular elements and other geometric shapes combined with carefully manipulated photographic imagery in the background.  

 

Typo collection

The Typo collection contains three posters with different diacritical marks. Type is such an integral part of our daily life — we spend our days staring at screens and reading text on paper but how often do we stop to admire the character of individual letterforms? Maria’s posters elevate typography to bold minimal fashion objects which will bring beauty to your space.   

 

Animal collection

This collection shows the connection between animals and their surroundings. Although nature photography might seem too detailed to be minimal, we have reduced these images to their most basic essence. Smooth transitions between the shapes of foreground characters and beautiful landscapes filled with trees symbolise unity with nature.

 

The budget we set will allow us to cover the cost of printing a minimum cost-effective amount of 70 of each of the posters. We believe that our posters fit perfectly into the home and office interior – either as one individual poster or together in a set of three as they were designed.

 

Are we scared?

This is our first project on such a platform and we admit – as designers we are a bit shy. The success of this campaign will prove to us that our projects can bring enjoyment to someone else - not just us. But this isn’t our first time printing stuff. We've done this before and we know this is not rocket science. We hope you’ll be willing to support us in this exciting endeavor.

story:
Gertrude Barnstone, her story,   "Ay Que Vida"


( Gertrude Barnstone gates, Houston ,Texas. 1999--2014 )


Since 2010 I have been working on a book about my friend, Gertrude Barnstone, a legendary Houston artist and activist. It is important that I complete publication of the book, Ay, Que Vida in this, her 90th year. I am asking for your to help complete printing and binding this book (approx 100 pages with color photographs). 


When her mother instructed Houston artist and activist Gertrude Levy Barnstone (now 90) never to marry or have children, the blue-eyed six-year-old promised herself that, dammit, she’d do it all. “You’re going to be an artist,” Mrs. Levy told her daughter. “Put down that broom." And, for the last 89-odd years Barnstone has been busy making good on her promise. The arts were booming in Post-Depression Houston.  New museums, theaters and orchestras were sprouting as fast as oil companies. Gertrude attended Houston public schools, took classes at the art school of the Museum of Fine Arts, and graduated from Rice University in three years.


(Gertrude Barnstone in Rashomon, Alley Theater, Houston, Texas, ca. 1959)

A stunning dancer, actress and painter, Gertrude continued to draw, paint, sculpt and act in local theater after marrying Howard Barnstone, a rising Houston architect fresh out of Yale. The Barnstones befriended contemporary artists, attended museum and gallery openings and contributed to the founding of the Contemporary Arts Museum. Among their friends were sophisticated  art patrons and collectors, including John and Dominique de Menil, Charles Barnes and Marguerite Johnston, Clare and Sam Sprunt. 

Barnstone was always an activist. She volunteered at Poe School when her three children attended. Occasionally  she shifted her focus from art to politics. In 1963, angered by the conservative Houston School Board’s attack on its lone African-American member, she ran at large for a place on the Houston School Board  which had been blocking integration for a full 10 years after the U.S. Supreme Court outlawed Separate but Equal in the 1950s. Howard Barnstone supported Gertrude’s School Board campaign, as he had supported her art. “He never wanted a stay-at-home wife,” she says now. She ran at large, wore out eight pairs of shoes and won by 30,000 votes.  While on the School Board, Gertrude cajoled, argued and pushed the stubborn conservative bloc toward full integration. 

Her marriage to Howard Barnstone ended in divorce in 1969. Through the sturm und drang  Gertrude preserved her smile and kept her footing. She enrolled in welding classes and went to work for a company making skylights. Since 1965 Gertrude has been supporting herself by making vivid and lyrical sculpture, much of it architectural. Her garden gates, chairs, railings and screens have enlivened Houston’s landscape. But it’s her spirit, passionate, forceful, and above all indomitable that she’s given us. Once I asked her why she went into politics in the first place. 

“I looked at myself in the mirror and decided I couldn’t live with myself if I didn’t run,” she said. 



Olive Hershey, author, publisher of "Gertrude Barnstone: Ay Que Vida"

story:
El proyecto

En marzo de 2015 hice un viaje por Italia, Turquía y París que compartí con el mundo a través de Facebook, Twitter e Instagram, tuve más de 700,000 impactos en redes sociales y muchísimas conversaciones, durante el viaje estuve interactuando con la gente y compartiendo mis vivencias, la verdad se hizo un convivio digital increíble, tanto que fueron los que me seguían quienes me pidieron que escribiera más y así fue como surgió mi libro "Acompáñame a Viajar" que ya tiene más de 1000 descargas.

Es un libro que me emociona mucho, me encanta que muchos se dieron cuenta que viajar no es caro y que con mis letras puedo compartir la cultura de otros países, no es un libro con muchas pretensiones, sólo busca hacer que quien lo lee pase un buen rato, si quieres leerlo puedes encontrarlo AQUÍ 

Después de este proyecto increíble ahora busco lanzar el segundo volumen recorriendo España y Marruecos, pero con un giro adicional. Desde muy chiquita hago arte con plastilina, así que esta es la oportunidad perfecta para dar a conocer mis obras.

El recorrido se hará del 15 de septiembre al 4 de octubre del 2015. Además de cubrir el viaje en redes sociales casi en vivo, escribir el libro de la aventura en formato diario y tomar fotos para subirlas al sitio de acompáñame a viajar, crearé cuadros en relieve hechos con plastilina inspiradas en el viaje las cuales presentaré en una exposición en donde estarán invitados todos los fondeaderos.

¿Qué obtienes al fondearme?

Al fondearme podrás tener una mención especial en el libro, además de poder asistir al evento de lanzamiento donde la pasaremos súper bien, echaremos unos drinks, presentaré el libro y se hará una exposición con las obras así como la entrega de las mismas a los fondeadores, además también puedes obtener fotos del viaje en alta definición, que la verdad me quedan bien padres, puedes verlas AQUÍ

¿Para qué se usará el dinero?

1.-Gastos del viaje

2.-Pago para la editora del libro

3.-Materiales para las obras (plastilina, madera, enmarcado etc)

4.-Evento de lanzamiento del libro y presentación de las obras

En caso de no llegar al objetivo, el dinero se destinará a cubrir la mayor parte de los gastos del viaje y el costo del material para las obras.

¿De qué otra forma puedes ayudar?

1.-No todo es dinero, si no puedes ayudarme con fondos, me sirve mucho que compartas esta campaña para que más personas se enteren

2.-Siguiendo a @ViajeraVictoria en Twitter

3.-Descargando y leyendo mi libro y ya si no es mucho pedir, mandándome tu opinión en un tweet.

¿Qué tipo de obras hago?

Este es un ejemplo de mi trabajo con plastilina:
