story:
We relocated to a new spot which is far more accessible and harmonious with the neighbors.  We leased a cool place, but the rent is more than double.   Help our burgeoning artists community in San Ignacio, Belize sustain this engaging space where our community can creatively THRIVE.  

                              OUR JOURNEY

OmniRootZ Productions is a grassrootz artz mothaship organization; we currently operate WILDFIREgallery -- a hub for experimental + functional arts in Belize. 

As always, we  hold the torch for marginalized people, artists seeking new ways to experience their lives. We commit to providing a safe, creative space away from the traditional sexists, racist, homophobic and xenophobic roles hefted upon the people; we hold open the doorways to making art for folks seeking self exploration, different ways to imagine their lives and open expression... and generate EXPOSURE & INCOME...weaving visual and performance art in every project.  

 Creative collaborative efforts with artists in Belize and throughout the Americas will produce powerful, meaningful and inspirational ART that not only responds within an indigenous & diasporic post-colonial context but also nurtures and expands the cultural development of Belize.  

We aim to create a space that encourages creative dialogue in our community. 


WHAT HAVE WE DONE SO FAR???

  •  Our first few projects have been multi-dimensional.  We hosted a muralist- Emanuel Martinez from Denver, who designed and painted alongside villagers, a mural for Esperanza community center. Recently we produced a play and workshops with a theatre professional--Riti Satchdeva from NYC whose visit we sponsored (with the help of the US Embassy). And now, we've invited 2X National (U.S.) Champion Slam Poet Hakim Bellamy to present performance poetry workshops in our new little spot!

  • Earlier this year, we established an art gallery, WILDFIREgallery and Trading Post which so far has featured paintings, digital art, collage work from local artists and functional/wearable art created by local and international artisans.  WILDFIRE's vision is to expand exhibits to feature artists from all over Belize, Central America, and the U.S.  At our openings, we feature performance art --music, poetry--and very delicious local organic chocolate and wines.  

HERE'S WHERE YOU COME IN...

     

LET THE ART DO IT'S MAGIC!

$5,000 WILL SUSTAIN WILDFIRE ARTZ SPACE FOR A YEAR! Relocating represents a doable step toward generating  more art happenings in San Ignacio.  We want to encourage membership and collective ownership, as well as focus on our retail income by selling wearable and functional art.

We must allow time for folks to break out of old boxes and participate in exploring and expanding creative crossroads for Local Artists, as well as for International Artists who want to exchange energy here in Belize.    Securing the right space will give us time to build an audience and consumer base, and collaborate on events with other art organizations.  

...LET THE ART DO IT'S MAGIC.


WHAT'S IT GONNA TAKE?        ONE YEAR.... 

$5000........to pay rent + utilities for an improved location for 1 year 

$2000........to support Imagine this... visiting artists project
 $ 600........to offset expenses for supplies (to round things off.pay Indiegogo)

$2400........to pay a student intern artist a stipend

The priority is to get the RENT PAID; this SUBGOAL ALLOWS US TO GET ART ON THE WALL NOW!  With YOUR support, we can have breathing room to truly shape an international grassrootz arts space grounded in Belize while we foster strong allegiances with fellow..co-conspirators, art groups or projects in San Ignacio. 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?...

By supporting this project, you will gain the satisfaction of strengthening linkages for art, artists and creative discourse around the world..this is the true perk; however, there's more:  check out our perks!

The Impact: TRANSFORMATION STATION

If you believe in the magical wondrous, transformational powers of ART...then we need say no more!   Projects promoting creative art and community building have solid foundations & numerous models around the world; however, the appropriate alchemy for grassrootz cutting edge art projects in Belize is still brewing.  
OmniRootZ AT THE CROSSROADS

The Challenge: WE MUST build an audience --to spur on a communal journey.  This project is happening in a place steeped in the cogs of building a nation and establishing a national identity.  34 years ago Belize became an Independent Nation -- population 350,000. Our motivation toward participating in a developing cultural identity comes straight from the heart...and is informed by our personal experiences with social justice movements in the U.S.  We understand that artists scream for opportunities that nurture creative expression, ways to find our voices, finding pathways to accept our histories,identities and journeys in the world, and determining our paths to freedom.  In other words... we know well, the incessant decolonization process. 

 

Our foremost hurdle is pushing thru the poverty.  Poverty and post-colonial malaise leads to "brain drain" and promotes a survival modality where art is seen as a luxury, for tourists or a waste of time.  For now we know that by releasing the pressure of  trying to generate funds within this community to maintain an art space by selling art at fair prices, will nurture the greater cause - MAKING ART HAPPEN.  

Lack of money and resources should not hinder peoples ability to create experimental (non touristy) art or pursue their educational dreams or interact with other artists.  

To quote Sweet Honey & the Rock (for whom we volunteered to provide tech support during their recent tour of Belize)         

"WE WHO BELIEVE IN FREEDOM CAN NOT REST..."  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pass this project's Indiegogo Campaign on... If the spirit of this effort moves you.  We appreciate the fact that many folks -- especially artists, who like us, are not always in a position to donate cash.  We are willing to bet that you have access to someone who can spare few bucks.....pass it on.  Remember every cent, every moment of energy spent thinking, talkin' bout our project is part of its success.
Use those amazing Indiegogo share tools!

Our foremost hurdle is pushing thru the poverty.  Poverty and post-colonial malaise leads to "brain drain" and promotes a survival modality where art is seen as a luxury, for tourists or a waste of time.  For now we know that by releasing the pressure of  trying to generate funds within this community to maintain an art space by selling art at fair prices, will nurture the greater cause - MAKING ART HAPPEN.  
Lack of money and resources should not hinder peoples ability to create experimental (non touristy) art or pursue their educational dreams or interact with other artists.  
To quote Sweet Honey & the Rock (for whom we volunteered to provide tech support during their recent tour of Belize)         
"WE WHO BELIEVE IN FREEDOM CAN NOT REST..."  
  Other Ways You Can Help Please pass this project's Indiegogo Campaign on... If the spirit of this effort moves you.  We appreciate the fact that many folks -- especially artists, who like us, are not always in a position to donate cash.  We are willing to bet that you have access to someone who can spare few bucks.....pass it on.  Remember every cent, every moment of energy spent thinking, talkin' bout our project is part of its success.Use those amazing Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Geração Alpha is an online art platform whose main objective is universalizing a niche market, the visual arts, through the use of technology.

Since it´s launch in August 2014 G.Alpha has:

  • Attained a sustainable revenue line, through the sales of multiples (inventory free, highly scalable)  
  • 40% of online traffic comes from recurring users, bolstering 48% bounce rate and average time of 4 minutes.
  • A community of around 1000 artists o Funded 25 scholarships
  • Launched the first Brazilian post grad program in art business together with Fundação Getúlio Vargas.
  • Present in important events of the arts universe, in order to achieve anchorage comparable to major market players.  

Now, we´re working on launching Alpha'a


In Alpha'a:

Artists, can upload works, sign up for popular votes where winners get limited edition prints produced, and set up times for studio visits. Integrating into a personalized art map.

Collectors, can find new artists, sign up for events, and purchase tickets and art editions.

Institutions, such as galleries and museum can upload schedules and inventory free of charge and access our ticketing platform which requires zero integration through our QR code generator and reader.

story:
Hi everyone,
First of all, I would like to thank you for taking your time to read this. My name is Marija Lopac, friends call me Mare. I am an independent visual artist and curator from Croatia. I like to travel and I am trying to travel as much as I can. In one of my travels to Vietnam I got the idea of connecting Vietnamese connecting Vietnamese visual arts with Croatian. The name of the project is the Other side. We started in 2015 with the first part, which was the exhibition of one Vietnamese art collective in the museum in Zagreb, Croatia. The exhibition was very well received by the public and the cooperation will further continue with another exhibition in Croatia in the autumn 2016.
The problem is that I need to make second part of the Other side project which is the exhibition of Croatian contemporary artists in Vietnam. Name of the exhibition is Memories. I am starting this campaign because I need to buy travel ticket, print catalogue and provide other necessary expenses for the exhibition. This will be the first time that Croatian group of artists exhibits their artworks in Vietnam.
I truly believe in this project. I think it is important to build a bridge which connects the two countries, otherwise geographically very far away. With this project I want to show the works of the most important young contemporary Croatian artists. I already asked for funding at the Croatian cultural foundation, but they said that they do not want to finance exhibition in Vietnam. They think it is not important for Croatian culture, because Croatia does not have any economic, or diplomatic relations with Vietnam. I am frustrated about this, because I believe art is international language, and we, artists, can be above political and economic view. The plan is that the exhibition will be held in May 2016 in Vietnam. Hope I will get enough money for expenses and that this project can go on.
Thank you, Kisses,
Marija

story:
Heaven's Height

I have been writing poetry since I was in my late teens.  I have always found it easier to express myself through written words. If I was having a bad day, I would write a poem about it.  I would write of adversities and joys. I would write about my faith in my Heavenly Father and that He ultimately had a plan for me and my life. As I've grown older, and hopefully matured, I can see how much we depend on our Father and His Son Jesus Christ for everything we have and are, and everything that we will have and will be in the future.  This book is a collection of poems that span over 30 years of experiences, fears, joys and especially faith.
I have wanted to publish these poems for many years, and have made several small booklets to give away to family and friends.  However, I could never get the finished book to look and feel like I wanted it to.  Then I met Lauren Pace and saw her beautiful watercolor art and I knew that this was how my poems were meant to look. The finished product is absolutely stunning and I am so excited to be able to share my poems at long last in the way that I envisioned!

"At last, poetry I can understand!"

I have heard that quote so many times when I have shared my poems with others. I have received messages of thanks from many people for helping them gain hope or understanding about a certain spiritual aspect. 

Why I Am Self Publishing

I have chosen to self-publish my book because the process of going through traditional publishers is time-consuming and laborious, and so many publishers believe that poetry isn't relevant to audiences anymore. I disagree!  I believe that you will appreciate these poems and the insight they provide.  As Walt Whitman stated, "For there to be great poets there must be great audiences."

The best price on self-publishing I found was from an online publisher that requires a minimum of 25 books ordered, ordering in 25 book increments. I would like to place my first order for 50 books.

Order Your Copy!

The book is uploaded to the online publisher I found and ready to go.  Regularly the book will sell for $29.99, but for this campaign copies are only $25 for a full-color hard back high quality book with 80# pages and a ribbon bookmark. Shipping is only $3. I plan on ordering the 2nd week of June. Printing will take a couple of weeks, so you should have your book by the first of July.

If you can't order a copy at this time, please spread the word to others you feel might enjoy it.

story:
I have - for as long as I can remember - always wanted to leave home and go on an adventure. When I was young, I used to pack a little bundle to the end of a stick, sling it across my shoulder and tell my mother that if one day I disappeared not to worry because I had packed provisions. When I was eighteen, I went to walk the Compostela – a pilgrimage route starting in France in the Camino des Arles and concluding in northern Spain. My passion for this project was born in my youth, nurtured throughout that walk and emboldened by ambitions.

This summer I will be trekking across Canada - travelling coast to coast. This will be a solo walk that will take place for a minimum of three months. The project will commence in Nova Scotia as I head towards the west coast and ultimately British Columbia. The goal of this project is not necessarily to walk across Canada but rather to take the time to enjoy and appreciate each part of the journey. I will be camping, fishing, documenting the land and walking while trying to stay away from major towns and cities. All that I am to encounter will be recorded visually and will be virtually uploaded at the end of the trip. The project is called “Remapping and Deconstructing Canada”. I plan to turn this journey into an art performance and create a touring art show for the following summer.

In order for my ambitions for this project to be brought to fruition, I am relying on the generosity of others to fund my trip across Canada. My love of camping has allowed me to possess the equipment and supplies necessary for camping in short expanses of time - but for a trip of this length I will need to update most of my equipment. Camping and hiking gear is very expensive - especially for a university student. I would need a new backpack that is larger in size that would not only carry my equipment but also my camera and its gear. I would need a new sleeping bag that can withstand colder temperatures than the one I own now since I will be starting in the spring and most nights have the potential to drop to zero Celsius or lower. For safety, I will need to purchase a GPS Tracker that will permit family members to view my every move online to make sure the walk is going according to plan. To be able to recharge my camera, the GPS Tracker and other equipment, I will need a portable solar panel that can be attached to my backpack. Making sure my equipment is durable and harbours the ability to last the whole trip is very important. It is crucial that my equipment is able to last for the duration of the walk while keeping me safe at the same time.

Your help would be extremely significant towards my project, both in its quality and being able to make it achievable. Any amount would be appreciated greatly, spent wisely and contribute to the ultimate trek of walking Canada coast to coast.

To read more about my project and follow along visit my Instagram (@melinaquerel) and my Facebook page (Melina Querel Artist) to view updates and new information.

story:
Short Summary

Here's a little bit about me and my campaign:

  • I'm Kate, I'm a software developer in the metro Detroit area
  • A year ago I lost my mom to a two year battle with Esophageal Cancer - I was dreading what kinds of sympathy cards I would receive - I envisioned sappy, impersonal, generic cards that didn't really make me feel better but instead made me annoyed.  What I really needed was a laugh, big or small, to help give me some relief, comfort and happiness during a dark time.  I realized that people like me were being left out in terms of encouragement and sympathy cards, there was nothing out there that would provide comfort in a bad situation, and I realized I needed to make it!
  • This campaign is one that I have wanted to do for a few years now, I realized recently that there's no time like the present, so here I am!
  • I plan to sell my cards on Etsy and maybe local stores or artist markets in the metro Detroit area

What I Need & What You Get

Here are the basic things that I need to get Best Medicine Cards started:

  • Paper
  • Envelopes
  • Art supplies such as watercolors, brushes, watercolor paper, etc
  • Plastic sleeves to package cards and envelopes
  • Mailing supplies to ship cards to customers 
  • Online class to digitize handwriting 
  • Printing costs
  • Domain name for website

I plan on offering rewards for various donation amounts, these rewards can be found on the Perks section of my campaign page.  I will follow up with contributors to determine which designs and / or custom messages they want. 

 

Please note that the minimum amount to start a campaign is $500 which is why I selected that as my goal; however I am hoping to raise just $200 - $250 to get Best Medicine Cards started! 

The Impact

There is really just one thing I hope Best Medicine Cards will achieve:

  • Providing a laugh, a brief moment of happiness and relief to someone going through a hard time. 

Risks & Challenges

Luckily there aren't a lot of risks and challenges that I can foresee, however there are a few...

  • It's possible that not a lot of people will buy these cards, but I think that's a risk with anything that someone is trying to make and share! 
  • Given the handmade nature of these cards there's a strong possibility for variations between each card - although I think that adds to the special-ness of a product there's a chance that some people will not like it

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute to my project, you might still be able to help me!  Here's how:

  • Any advice or guidance related to Best Medicine Cards is greatly appreciated
  • Feedback!!! I love feedback!
  • Jokes, ideas, thoughts, concerns
  • Spread the word! 

Thanks for your support!

story:
UPDATE:

Meet our new addition... The LOVESEAT!!!  She'll Do!!!  We have great plans for her.  She's getting gussied up with silver seat covers, a new paint job, led lighting, possibly new tires, and some minor repairs.  Our Candy HeArt will pull her along the playa as we go and spread the joy of love to other camps/villages!  We still have one Romantic ride left!!!! 

And here's our Candy HeArt so far...

We couldn't have gotten this far without these soso sexy peeps and all of the contributions that have come in.  We still have so much do and hope if you haven't contributed, that you will!

Look at these lovely bandanas that our very own Tin Cup designed and hand screen printed.  Each is unique and you'll be the envy of everyone on the playa.  

 Please share this campaign with others and please like So So Cupid on Facebook and any of our campaign posts.  It really helps get the word out! 

SO SO CUPID LOVES YOU!!!!!!

 

Featured Perks!

Our 2017 Special Edition Sticker!!!!

Holy Moly this one is amazing!  And only $10!!!! Support EBB & Glow's and So So Cupid's art car build with this trinket of love!

 

Our So So Cupid shirt!!!

Made of LOVE and 100% cotton!

So What Is So So Cupid?

In 2012, Maki Maki armed with a polaroid camera, a sketchbook and a list of questions, created So So Cupid, Burning Man’s #1 on-playa offline dating service. Her project was met with such enthusiasm that she realized there was a real need to bring love to all the lonely burners out there… or at least the dream of finding love on the playa. 

So So Cupid has been part of the EBB & Glow Village for the past few years and has been "Keeping the bar low" when it comes to our dating service.  That's sort of our thing... Easy and Fun! This year EBB & Glow Village will be on 2:30 and Esplanade and the pressure is on to raise the bar (just slightly) this year!!  

(Chicken Dinner photographing a new member with our high tech polaroid camera)

       

 

What Is A Candy HeART Car?

In 2017, our BIGGEST HEART's DESIRE is to build a mutant vehicle,  a sparkly candy heart with a disco soul floating on a cloud over the dusty playa, as a vehicle of love to deliver messages of hope and fun to dusty burners all over Black Rock City.  Last year was our biggest and most so so successful year with the introduction of So So Cupid Messenger Service, love letters written by our members and delivered by us.  This year our Candy HeArt Car will help our deliver more love letters and reach more camps and burners.  

Example of our 2016 love letters for the So So Cupid Messenger service:

Here are some happy burners who took advantage of our Messenger Service last year:

 

Where your contributions will go...

We are starting from scratch!   We have to admit we are new to this art car building thing, but what we lack in building expertise we make up for in enthusiasm, an amazing EBB & Glow community and a whole lotta LOVE!!

With the help of our camp mates and other builders, we have budgeted that it will cost $6000 for the gas powered golf cart, internal structure,special stretch fabric to give our heart it’s shape and color, decorative padded seating, sound, and LED lights to light us up at night.

Transportation to and from BRC and gas while on playa will cost $2500. Supplies needed to run and promote So So Cupid on playa such as film/membership books and party supplies for our Tuesday night  Let’s Get Physical party will be another $1000.  We are determined to keep costs low but know we can’t skimp on a solid structure, a good vehicle and materials that will not become moop caught in the trash fence.  

All proceeds for this fundraiser will go towards helping us BUILD and BRING the So So Cupid Candy HeART Car to Black Rock City for our on playa data service! Check out the amazing perks we have to offer for those that can contribute financially to our Candy HeART art car.   This is the first year we are offering our super sexy"You'll Do" underwear to the public and we are hand crafting our So So Cupid Pendants to hold close to your heart.  We have stickers and patches for you to show everyone your love for So So Cupid.  And some exclusive and extra special on playa perks like our VIP HeART car ride and Ice Cream Social.

Other ways you can help...

If you have to save your pennies because you need to get your butt to the playa and can't help us financially, there are other ways you can help: 

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE our campaign!  
  • Like us on Facebook so you can get build updates and our playa schedule
  • Host us on the playa!!! Contact us through Facebook or email us at SoSoCupid4Luv@gmail.com
  • We are in need of volunteers for the build and for our on playa dating service.  We are planning several build days in San Leandro, August 5, 6 & 13.  Contact us at SoSoCupid4luv@gmail.com if you are interested in volunteering for the build or on playa. 

 

 

 

 

Like us on Facebook to hear more about the build and other So So Cupid happenings!! 

Hearts and Dust ~ Heidi and Tin Cup (Amy)

Host us on the playa!!! Contact us through Facebook or email us at SoSoCupid4Luv@gmail.com
We are in need of volunteers for the build and for our on playa dating service.  We are planning several build days in San Leandro, August 5, 6 & 13.  Contact us at SoSoCupid4luv@gmail.com if you are interested in volunteering for the build or on playa. 
    Like us on Facebook to hear more about the build and other So So Cupid happenings!! Hearts and Dust ~ Heidi and Tin Cup (Amy)

story:
A stand-alone art piece, the structure will be a 2500sqft space made up of five 16ft high Obelisks, covered in literally hundreds of thousands of super bright LED’s, with custom-programmed patterns shooting up and down the surface.

Hidden inside the Obelisks, will be a massive Function one sound system flown over from the UK, so that for two nights during the eclipse, we will throw kick ass parties, showcasing the best of the sounds which we represent at Noisily and Ooligan Alley, pulling from the cream of the crop at the eclipse.

At Burning Man we’ll be adding more speakers, flame throwers and moving lights to create the brightest, loudest thing on the Playa.

The main part of our installation has been funded by internal donors from Ooligan Alley, and part funded by the Eclipse festival. The gap was supposed to be covered by an allocation of tickets from the Eclipse festival organisers, which we have been endeavouring to sell. Unfortunately Eclipse has now released a final tier of tickets, to what was previously a sold out event, so we are suddenly unable to sell them. 

The crew has a wide range of talents and experience in design, engineering and production. Many of us have worked together for years to put on extraordinary festival experiences all over the world.  We are working for free, because we love to build massive bright loud things for festivals, but we’re trying to cover as many of the crew costs as possible.

 

Costs

Your contributions will go towards covering these essential costs:

Material costs; $21,000

Transport costs: $3000

Travel, food and accommodation for 20 crew (including a small donation to some flights): $9800

It’s a massively ambitious project, and we find ourselves $6000 short, which is why we’re coming to you to ask for help to make this happen!

 

The Team 

The original designs for the stage came out of group planning sessions back in the dark, wet, London winter when the prospect of the burning desert sun was but a distant glimmer of hope. Ruth Herbert, Tom Bull and Jamie Fraser worked together to develop a concept of the optical art effect on the pillars around the dance floor, bringing in Jamie’s monumental control tower from Burning Man 2015. 

For the past few months Tom Shea and Tom Bull, our computer wizards and all round tech gods, have been designing both the software and hardware for the dazzling LED displays that will cover every inch of the stage. Unsatisfied with the commercially available LED control boards, off they went to China to design and manufacture a unique PCB especially for the project. The Toms are already on the ground in Reno coding away. They will be joined by more of the LED team this week who will assist in assembling the HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS of LED strips and panels that will make up the one of the most epic lighting display the Burn has ever known. 

Building on Jamie’s original designs for the Ooligan Control Tower, Josh Brown is our lead carpenter overseeing the construction of the pillars and the control tower. Josh has extensive experience in woodwork installations and runs a carpentry and welding business in Texas. He’ll be overseeing a lovely bunch of amateur chippies who will get this structure up in no time. 

Oz Jeffries, engineer extraordinaire, leads the charge to make this the best sonic experience possible, using his and Fede’s exquisite Function one sound systems.

Overseeing the project are Lachie Gordon, Fede Pirzio-Biroli and Lu Irvine. 

Lachie is one of the directors of Noisily Festival – a beautiful intimate woodland festival in Leicestershire, UK , where an incredible amount of time and energy is invested in artwork, performance, wellbeing and the best sound in the UK (by Oz, of course). Lu will be building our insanely powerful new flame thrower setup at the Burn. Dany's dragons ain't got nothin' on these bad boys.

story:
The Project

We're frequently told that life and success are about relationships. What always strikes me is the astoundingly ephemeral and fragile interconnectedness that makes such relationships possible. It is from these contemplations that the project, Giving Voice, was formed. It is a collection of mixed media gilded paintings, to be hand-bound with a metal cover inset, made from Eastern repoussé and dimensionally patterned mokume gane.

This one-of-a-kind book will also take the form of a multimedia eBook, with voice overs, a soundtrack, and animations of the cover, words, and images. Your involvement will help put this story and artwork out into the world.

 

How You Can Help

In order to launch Giving Voice, I have built a team to manage the technology I don't have time to learn. It takes experts to turn this work of paper and metal into an immersive multimedia experience. 

All of the funds raised will offset the production costs of the animations, and the cost of formatting and printing the book for distribution. The total budget for this project is actually $18,000 to pay my team and print the giclee prints, print the book, and produce the ebook. (Alas, that doesn’t include paying me.)

Please help spread the word! I want this book to be wildly successful so that it will inspire others to cherish our ephemeral connections and tell the world about them. 

 

What You Get

For helping me put this story and project out into the world, you will receive giclee prints, a signed print book, or a signed limited edition version of the print book, depending on your level of contribution. That is in addition to my absolute, undying gratitude that you believe in my artwork enough to help midwife its debut. 

 

The Story

My passion for metalsmithing is derived from my obsession with ancient Egyptian art. This fascination was triggered by a fantastically unusual board game, Voice of the Mummy, given to me the Christmas I was five years old. The game consisted of a styrofoam step pyramid with squares depicting ancient hieroglyphics, jewels, and images of Tutankhamun's gold mask. An only child, I played the game endlessly by myself, meticulously moving each cardboard Egyptologist around the board. I was mesmerized by the artwork; it was unlike anything I had ever seen. No one could have guessed that a child’s board game would become a cornerstone of my artistic existence, but this event was a pivotal moment in my life.

This is the story many have heard, and what can be found when investigating my history as a maker. What I've less often told is the back story of the two wonderful families behind the gift. More than this incredibly significant gift, these families brought music and laughter that would shape my outlook on the world.

What I remember most about the mothers of the families was that these two very different but strong, elegant, warm, and self-assured lifelong friends were always so incredibly kind to me. Their passing inspired these reflections of connectedness, and influence. Without these people and seemingly ordinary events, without a profound inquisitiveness sparked by a game, there is no question that the path of my life would have been profoundly different. Life is a chain of events and connections in which if one link breaks, wonders we might never know can be lost.

 

 

The Project’s Timeline

The book’s pages were completed in 2015. The pages were photographed in 2017, and my studio assistant, Uduak Ita, has completed the editing process for half of the artwork. My animator, Steve Walker, has completed 3 of the 11 animations and has 1 more animation in the final stages. The front cover, which will become the 12th animation in the book, will take another 2 months to complete. The original manuscript will not be bound until all the digital work is complete, but this will not effect the ebook and print book’s timeline.

I have waited until this point in the project’s journey to ask for funding to ensure that we have enough expertise and momentum to see it through. Based on how long the digital work has taken so far, we estimate that the book will release mid summer of 2018. We're keeping our fingers crossed that it might be sooner! 

 

The Final Frontier (and the big disclaimer)

Unless technology radically changes in the next 6 months, the multimedia ebook version will be for sale only in Apple’s iBook Store and will work only on iPads and Macs. This isn’t out of some misplaced brand loyalty. It’s because at this time, other formats for PC and other types of tablets do not yet support multimedia books of this intricacy and file size. What we’ve envisioned is still very cutting edge in the book world. I’ve thought about writing it as an app or video game, but that would have required raising a lot more money (as in adding a few zeros).

The good news is that the print book will have codes and URLs for enjoying the animations, soundtrack, and voice overs! So even if you’re not a Mac person, you can still interact with the book.

 

Nice to See You Here

I am an artist/alchemist, obsessed with converting time into beautifully intricate objects of mystery and contemplation. Ideas synthesize through my brain at such a dizzying rate, it is impossible that only one kind of art should come out of me. I specialize in both ancient metalsmithing and illumination techniques that are laborious and intensive, demanding deep knowledge and acute skill, which counter today's impulse for immediacy. My award winning artwork ranges in scale from wearable art jewelry and hand illuminated artist books to bespoke architectural metal installations for one of the world's largest super yachts. My work has also appeared in numerous juried exhibitions, books, and magazines, including the Lark 500 series, Metalsmith, Jewelry Artist, and on Home & Garden Television. I created the metals program and served as head of the Metalsmithing Department at Spruill Center for the Arts, Atlanta and was an adjunct professor at the University of Tennessee. My instructional DVD and book series, Metal Techniques of Bronze Age Masters, featuring the titles Russian Filigree, Rings, All Chained Up, Eastern Repoussé and Chasing, and my iPhone™ app, iMakeJewelry have sold throughout the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute directly to my project or give it a big shout out to those who can, you’ll be making a difference.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

story:
Short Summary (scroll down for French)

We are Gerard Chenet and Philip Kojo Metz

Gerard Chenet is an artist, architect, poet and, most important, the founder of a little paradise in the south of Dakar, Senegal called Sobo Bade. He is now 92 years old and started the project 20 years ago. Sobo Bade is a Holiday resort, right at the seaside and what is very special about this resort is that the center piece is a amphitheatre, where international dance/ music performances take place. It connects the local artists to international artists and attracts tourists as well as inhabitants. Gerard Chenet founded, planned and built this place. When i saw this beautiful place at first i was fascinated by the concept and how everything fits so nicely together. I like the idea that the arts in this case are influencing the life and day by day of many people, the inhabitants- the people passing by or staying there for a few days, that get a deep impression by having the chance to get into direct and often times personal contact with the artists. Also international artists bringing a sense and taste of the world to the village.  

Here´s a video about the project in Sobo Bade: 

The architectural appearance seemed to me like an experimental collaboration of Gaudi, Hundertwasser and Disneyland. But there´s nothing artificial about it. Gerard Chenet consructed this place as an architect and built a lot of it by bricks made out of the soil that he found there.  The natural Beauty of the place is quite impressing. And a lot of various activities like Yoga retreats, art exhibitions, theatre pieces and concerts are taking place. 

The wish emerged in me, to show this project, this person, my fascination of the place and of the person who created it. It would be my wish that people learn more about this person and the place he created, so that it can continue, grow and inspire and empower others to have the guts and start something they want and believe in. I think we need more and can learn from trailblazers like that- they can inspire and empower people to follow. 

We already started the Book project that will contain Gerards architecture and poems in October this year with the budget coming from our own pockets.

Most of the photo works that we need is already done. The poems are already there

We met Gerards publishing company (L´Harmattan, Senegal) and they  are exited about the project since we showed them the first pictures. 

They agreed to take care of the design, translation, PR and distribution process.

But we will be responsible for the printing costs-

The book is supposed to be be a high- quality product and I will personally follow the printing process in Berlin. In March i will travel to Senegal again and then Gerard and i will put our heads together and finish the book. It will be published latest in June/ July 2018. And then you will get your copy delivered. 

The Impact

After all this years a lot of people learned about Gerards project -but to make the space survive, it is necessary, to have even more people to come there and learn about it. 

Also as a person Gerard is really inspiring and especially for people who want to grow old and be active but also for younger generations he can be a role model to go after what you really want and then to reach it. Also it´s just a nice place to hear about, to go there and relax- the more people know about it, the better...

Risks & Challenges

Of course to reach the 5.800 € we are heading for we have to sell A LOT of books online-  and this without even being able to show it to you in person. But both of us already published various books and realised various projects. So we will really go for it and with your trust and participation we can reach this goal together. And of course there are also various perks available, besides the book. 

Milestones:

We reach 1000 €- that´s the first milestone: i will go to Senegal and finish the book, also the perks except for the book will be produced and delivered. Then we will start the second stage: we continue the campaigner another two months. Maybe the title has to be changed due to indiegogo´s terms and conditions. 

At the same time i will look for other sources to back up - for example companies, that could have an interest in having their logo in the book. If you have any idea, let me know...

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember: there´s always a way to help the project even if it just 1 € it helps a lot if there are many. Also if you want to share it on Facebook or through your mail with friends or just distribute our cards this will help us a lot. Maybe you know some friends of yours that could really benefit from it or be interested.  It´s also just a magnificent place to spend your holidays!

THANK YOU for taking the time to go through this and for all your support and making some noise. We will keep you all updated about the progress of the campaign. Stay tuned!

 

 

Court résumé

 Nous sommes Gérard Chenet et Philip Kojo Metz

  Gérard Chenet est un artiste, un architecte, un poète et, surtout, le fondateur d'un petit paradis au sud de Dakar, au Sénégal, appelé Sobo Badé.

 Il a maintenant 90 ans et a commencé le projet il y a 25 ans. Sobo Bade est un hôtel avec un restaurant, juste au bord de la mer et ce qui est très spécial à propos de cet endroit, la pièce maîtresse! C'est l'amphithéâtre, où se déroulent des spectacles internationaux de danse / musique/ théâtre. C'est un véritable centre culturel qui relie les artistes locaux aux artistes internationaux et attire les touristes ainsi que les habitants. Gérard Chenet a fondé, planifié et construit ce lieu. Quand j'ai vu ce bel endroit au début, j'ai été fasciné par le concept et comment tout va si bien ensemble. J'aime l'idée que les arts dans ce cas influencent la vie au jour le jour, de beaucoup de gens, des habitants du village de Toubab Dialaw - des gens qui passent ou y restent pendant quelques jours, en ayant la chance d'assister directement à une résidence artistique, tout en nouant souvent des contacts personnels avec les artistes locaux. De même, des artistes internationaux apportent un sens et un goût du monde au village.  Voici une vidéo sur le projet à Sobo Bade:

L'aspect architectural m'a paru comme une collaboration expérimentale entre Gaudi, Hundertwasser et Disneyland.

 Mais il n'y a rien d'artificiel ici. Gérard Chenet a construit ce lieu en architecte autodidacte, utilisant le principe de la récupération et d'une utilisation esthétique des briques en terre cuite. La beauté naturelle de l'endroit est assez impressionnante. Et beaucoup d'activités diverses comme des retraites de yoga, des expositions d'art, des pièces de théâtre et des concerts ont lieu. Le souhait est apparu en moi, de montrer ce projet, cette personne étonnante, ma fascination pour le lieu et la personne qui l'a créé.

 Ce serait mon souhait que les gens en apprennent davantage sur lui et cet endroit qu'il a créé, afin que l'idée puisse continuer, grandir, inspirer et amener les autres à avoir le courage de commencer à faire eux aussi, ce qu'ils veulent profondément et ainsi réaliser les choses auxquelles ils croient très fort. Je pense que nous avons besoin de connaître des hommes exemplaires afin d'apprendre de ces Pionniers.

  Nous avons déjà commencé le projet du livre qui contiendra des photos d'architecture prises par moi, Philip et les poèmes de Gérard. Ce livre sortira en octobre de cette année 2018 avec le budget venant de nos propres poches.

La plupart des travaux de photos dont nous avons besoin sont déjà terminés. Les poèmes sont déjà là.

 

 Nous avons rencontré la maison d'édition de Gérard (L'Harmattan, Sénégal) et ils sont entrés dans le projet dès que nous leur avons montré les premières images et les mots du poète.  Ils ont accepté de prendre en charge la conception, la traduction, les relations publiques et le processus de distribution.  Mais nous serons responsables des coûts d'impression ...   le livre devra être un produit de haute qualité et je suivrai personnellement le processus d'impression à Berlin. En mars, je me rendrai de nouveau au Sénégal, puis Gérard et moi terminerons le livre. Il sera publié au plus tard en juin / juillet 2018. Et vous recevrez votre exemplaire.

 

L'impact

 Après toutes ces années, beaucoup de gens ont appris à connaître le lieu de Gérard - mais pour l'aider à faire en sorte que Sobo Badé s'épanouisse et continue à jouer son rôle de pépinière artistique, il est nécessaire d'avoir encore plus de gens prêts à y venir. J'insiste, en tant que personne, Gérard est vraiment inspirant, surtout pour les personnes qui veulent vieillir et demeurer actives, et pour les jeunes générations, il peut être un modèle.

 Sobo Badé est un endroit agréable pour se retrouver, se ressourcer et se détendre - plus les gens le savent, mieux c'est ... C'est juste un endroit magnifique pour passer vos vacances! 

 

 Risques et défis

 Bien sûr, pour atteindre les 5.800 €, nous devons vendre BEAUCOUP de livres en ligne, sans même pouvoir vous le montrer en personne. Mais nous avons déjà publié plusieurs livres et réalisé différents projets. Nous avons confiance et avec votre confiance et votre participation, nous pouvons atteindre cet objectif ensemble. Et bien sûr, il y a aussi divers avantages disponibles, en plus du livre. Rappelez-vous: il y a toujours un moyen d'aider le projet ne serait-ce qu'en versant 1 €, ça peut aider, s'il y en a beaucoup! Si vous voulez le partager sur Facebook ou via votre courrier avec des amis ou simplement distribuer nos cartes, cela nous aidera beaucoup. Peut-être connaissez-vous des amis qui pourraient vraiment en tirer profit ou être intéressés?

 MERCI d'avoir pris le temps de passer par là, merci pour tout votre soutien, merci de faire du bruit.

 Nous vous tiendrons au courant de l'avancement de la campagne.

Restez à l'écoute!

But there´s nothing artificial about it. Gerard Chenet consructed this place as an architect and built a lot of it by bricks made out of the soil that he found there.  The natural Beauty of the place is quite impressing. And a lot of various activities like Yoga retreats, art exhibitions, theatre pieces and concerts are taking place. The wish emerged in me, to show this project, this person, my fascination of the place and of the person who created it. It would be my wish that people learn more about this person and the place he created, so that it can continue, grow and inspire and empower others to have the guts and start something they want and believe in. I think we need more and can learn from trailblazers like that- they can inspire and empower people to follow. We already started the Book project that will contain Gerards architecture and poems in October this year with the budget coming from our own pockets.Most of the photo works that we need is already done. The poems are already thereWe met Gerards publishing company (L´Harmattan, Senegal) and they  are exited about the project since we showed them the first pictures. They agreed to take care of the design, translation, PR and distribution process.But we will be responsible for the printing costs-The book is supposed to be be a high- quality product and I will personally follow the printing process in Berlin. In March i will travel to Senegal again and then Gerard and i will put our heads together and finish the book. It will be published latest in June/ July 2018. And then you will get your copy delivered. The ImpactAfter all this years a lot of people learned about Gerards project -but to make the space survive, it is necessary, to have even more people to come there and learn about it. Also as a person Gerard is really inspiring and especially for people who want to grow old and be active but also for younger generations he can be a role model to go after what you really want and then to reach it. Also it´s just a nice place to hear about, to go there and relax- the more people know about it, the better...Risks & ChallengesOf course to reach the 5.800 € we are heading for we have to sell A LOT of books online-  and this without even being able to show it to you in person. But both of us already published various books and realised various projects. So we will really go for it and with your trust and participation we can reach this goal together. And of course there are also various perks available, besides the book. Milestones:We reach 1000 €- that´s the first milestone: i will go to Senegal and finish the book, also the perks except for the book will be produced and delivered. Then we will start the second stage: we continue the campaigner another two months. Maybe the title has to be changed due to indiegogo´s terms and conditions. At the same time i will look for other sources to back up - for example companies, that could have an interest in having their logo in the book. If you have any idea, let me know...Other Ways You Can HelpPlease remember: there´s always a way to help the project even if it just 1 € it helps a lot if there are many. Also if you want to share it on Facebook or through your mail with friends or just distribute our cards this will help us a lot. Maybe you know some friends of yours that could really benefit from it or be interested.  It´s also just a magnificent place to spend your holidays!THANK YOU for taking the time to go through this and for all your support and making some noise. We will keep you all updated about the progress of the campaign. Stay tuned!  Court résumé Nous sommes Gérard Chenet et Philip Kojo Metz  Gérard Chenet est un artiste, un architecte, un poète et, surtout, le fondateur d'un petit paradis au sud de Dakar, au Sénégal, appelé Sobo Badé. Il a maintenant 90 ans et a commencé le projet il y a 25 ans. Sobo Bade est un hôtel avec un restaurant, juste au bord de la mer et ce qui est très spécial à propos de cet endroit, la pièce maîtresse! C'est l'amphithéâtre, où se déroulent des spectacles internationaux de danse / musique/ théâtre. C'est un véritable centre culturel qui relie les artistes locaux aux artistes internationaux et attire les touristes ainsi que les habitants. Gérard Chenet a fondé, planifié et construit ce lieu. Quand j'ai vu ce bel endroit au début, j'ai été fasciné par le concept et comment tout va si bien ensemble. J'aime l'idée que les arts dans ce cas influencent la vie au jour le jour, de beaucoup de gens, des habitants du village de Toubab Dialaw - des gens qui passent ou y restent pendant quelques jours, en ayant la chance d'assister directement à une résidence artistique, tout en nouant souvent des contacts personnels avec les artistes locaux. De même, des artistes internationaux apportent un sens et un goût du monde au village.  Voici une vidéo sur le projet à Sobo Bade:L'aspect architectural m'a paru comme une collaboration expérimentale entre Gaudi, Hundertwasser et Disneyland. Mais il n'y a rien d'artificiel ici. Gérard Chenet a construit ce lieu en architecte autodidacte, utilisant le principe de la récupération et d'une utilisation esthétique des briques en terre cuite. La beauté naturelle de l'endroit est assez impressionnante. Et beaucoup d'activités diverses comme des retraites de yoga, des expositions d'art, des pièces de théâtre et des concerts ont lieu. Le souhait est apparu en moi, de montrer ce projet, cette personne étonnante, ma fascination pour le lieu et la personne qui l'a créé. Ce serait mon souhait que les gens en apprennent davantage sur lui et cet endroit qu'il a créé, afin que l'idée puisse continuer, grandir, inspirer et amener les autres à avoir le courage de commencer à faire eux aussi, ce qu'ils veulent profondément et ainsi réaliser les choses auxquelles ils croient très fort. Je pense que nous avons besoin de connaître des hommes exemplaires afin d'apprendre de ces Pionniers.  Nous avons déjà commencé le projet du livre qui contiendra des photos d'architecture prises par moi, Philip et les poèmes de Gérard. Ce livre sortira en octobre de cette année 2018 avec le budget venant de nos propres poches.La plupart des travaux de photos dont nous avons besoin sont déjà terminés. Les poèmes sont déjà là.  Nous avons rencontré la maison d'édition de Gérard (L'Harmattan, Sénégal) et ils sont entrés dans le projet dès que nous leur avons montré les premières images et les mots du poète.  Ils ont accepté de prendre en charge la conception, la traduction, les relations publiques et le processus de distribution.  Mais nous serons responsables des coûts d'impression ...   le livre devra être un produit de haute qualité et je suivrai personnellement le processus d'impression à Berlin. En mars, je me rendrai de nouveau au Sénégal, puis Gérard et moi terminerons le livre. Il sera publié au plus tard en juin / juillet 2018. Et vous recevrez votre exemplaire. L'impact Après toutes ces années, beaucoup de gens ont appris à connaître le lieu de Gérard - mais pour l'aider à faire en sorte que Sobo Badé s'épanouisse et continue à jouer son rôle de pépinière artistique, il est nécessaire d'avoir encore plus de gens prêts à y venir. J'insiste, en tant que personne, Gérard est vraiment inspirant, surtout pour les personnes qui veulent vieillir et demeurer actives, et pour les jeunes générations, il peut être un modèle. Sobo Badé est un endroit agréable pour se retrouver, se ressourcer et se détendre - plus les gens le savent, mieux c'est ... C'est juste un endroit magnifique pour passer vos vacances!   Risques et défis Bien sûr, pour atteindre les 5.800 €, nous devons vendre BEAUCOUP de livres en ligne, sans même pouvoir vous le montrer en personne. Mais nous avons déjà publié plusieurs livres et réalisé différents projets. Nous avons confiance et avec votre confiance et votre participation, nous pouvons atteindre cet objectif ensemble. Et bien sûr, il y a aussi divers avantages disponibles, en plus du livre. Rappelez-vous: il y a toujours un moyen d'aider le projet ne serait-ce qu'en versant 1 €, ça peut aider, s'il y en a beaucoup! Si vous voulez le partager sur Facebook ou via votre courrier avec des amis ou simplement distribuer nos cartes, cela nous aidera beaucoup. Peut-être connaissez-vous des amis qui pourraient vraiment en tirer profit ou être intéressés? MERCI d'avoir pris le temps de passer par là, merci pour tout votre soutien, merci de faire du bruit. Nous vous tiendrons au courant de l'avancement de la campagne.Restez à l'écoute!

story:
Overview

The goal is to create enamel pins representing some of my favorite military aircraft.

The first in this series is dedicated to the C-17 Globemaster III, more affectionately known as the “Moose” by those who fly and care for this majestic aircraft. My initial designs represent the C-17 based in Charleston, SC. As a native South Carolinian, this aircraft has held my attention for many years.
 

The Designs

There are two initial pin designs.  The first is a caricature-like side profile of the aircraft. There are limitations to the level of detail allowed (no text on the tail, for instance).  Because of that, I decided to create a tail flash that complements the first pin design.  Both designs were digitally drawn in Adobe Illustrator by me with references made with my own photographs. This fund raising campaign is to kick-off these two designs which will then help fund future pins.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what you'll get for backing this project:

  • High quality enamel pin(s) with rubber back.
  • Free shipping to the US for up to two pins! Ordering more will incur a small shipping surcharge.
  • International customers, I’ve tried to keep the shipping costs low for you.
  • Appreciation of supporting an independent artist and photographer!
     

What your money goes towards:

  • Cost of manufacturing 100 limited edition of each pin design
  • Printed Card stock for mounting pins
  • Fulfillment labor
  • Packaging materials
  • Postage
  • Indiegogo & credit card processing fees
     

The Impact

Anyone who knows me will certainly agree that this is a passion project. It began as a desire to decorate my camera bag with something unique and fitting of military aviation. The craze over #pingame on Instagram inspired me to take it to a bigger scale. With your support, I intend to re-invest in creating more pins if my goal is surpassed.   
 

Risks & Challenges

I'll be 100% upfront – this is my first attempt at anything of this scale. If I reach my initial goal, I'll have enough money to manufacture and fulfill 200 pins. I've carefully considered my stretch goals to reflect the additional cost of manufacturing and fulfillment of new designs.
 

Timeline

  • Mid-October: Campaign starts!
  • Mid-November: Campaign ends!
  • December: Pins get manufactured and packages get assembled!
  • January: Pins get shipped to you! Woohoo!
     

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a pin right now, that's okay! But maybe you'd be willing to help share word about these pins throughout the aviation community by sharing the campaign on social media? That would be greatly appreciated!

story:
What is The Blanket?

The Blanket is a very light and strong BoPET polyester film canvas 100 by 100 meters, made of 3.350 NASA Space blankets (2,1x1,6 m. each), held together with 40 km of reinforced tape.

The silver side of the Blanket is coated with metallic agent that reflects up to 97% of the radiated heat. During the hot daytime room under the Blanket will be used as a comfy and refreshing rest area, where anyone can relax, chill, have a nap or dance. At night hundreds of people in el-wire suits will get together under the blanket creating an effect of oceanic bioluminescent plankton or moving waves of equalizer.

Ever since we were children and throughout our life we share the space under the blanket with lovers, friends and family. Under the Blanket there are no strangers.

 

 

Preparation 

Testing the 1:20 scale model

 

3D simulation

 

Creating and testing the pilot canvas (30 by 40 meters)

 

What are we raising funds for?

-Materials 

-Build space rental

-Transportation from Russia to  Black Rock City

-Excavator and equipment rental

Thank you for your support!

Really. Thank you very much.

And here is a link to my facebook account https://www.facebook.com/alex.shtanuk?ref=bookm... if you have any questions feel free to contact me!

story:
RegalAfrica is a producer and promoter of cultural events that amplify Africa and create opportunities for all African descendants.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will need funding to support the logistical and marketing aspects of this event and our community together for this Celebration of Africa.  There will be different tiers of support levels and rewards.

 

The Impact

We aim to eradicate stereotypes and misperceptions about Africa through cultural events and community engagement.

 

Risks & Challenges

The scope of this cultural event will largely be dependent on how much money we're able to raise. We hope to bring in African talent and vendors from around the world. Further, we may have to make changes to our event to comply with any local guidelines or requirements. If we need to make any necessary changes, we will do our best to update you as soon as possible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share on social and invite friends to join and attend.
  • Join us on that day for a fun-filled unforgettable event celebrating African heritage and culture.

 

Thank you for your support.

story:
Read our goal and help us support young creatives!

We are a group of 2nd year students studying at the University of Westminster planning an exhibition as part of our degree. We saw this as an opportunity to give a platform to young and emerging artists to voice their creativity focusing around the topic of British society and the people within it. This is a particularly important topic to us as we want to give exposure to a generation that often goes unheard. Current national events have raised a lot of discussion as to what the future will hold, and therefore we think the perspective we are offering in our exhibition is an extremely important one. Due to this being a student curated exhibition we are in need of funding to help us achieve our aims. With your help we believe this could be a really exciting opportunity for a group of young artists and a chance to start building a community with a voice. 

What the funds will go towards

  • Venue - hiring out a suitable gallery space
  • Private View - invites and catering for our opening event
  • Advertisement - posters, flyers, merch. spreading the word of our exhibition
  • Exhibition hanging materials - mounting materials, tools, lighting, frames
  • Transport - transporting the works to our venue

We would love it if you could make a donation, however much or little. However if you are not able to there are other ways to help!

Share this page with friends and on social media

Follow and share our instagram - https://www.instagram.com/fasttimes_exh/?hl=en

Are you a UK based artist aged 16-25? Submit your work to us by e-mailing us at fasttimes.exhibition@gmail.com

Thanks for your support!

story:
Who we are

We are a collective of 4 tattooers from Vienna. We opened HYPERHUMAN Tattoo last November. Our aim is to bring you awesome contemporary tattoos in a safe environment where eveybody feels welcome. No homophobia, sexism, bodyshaming will be tolerated at our studio.

What we do

We bring you up to 15 different guest artists from around the world each month to Vienna. You will find different styles and the chance to get tattooed by artists wich usually you would have to travel far to get tattooed by. Cutting edge contemporary designs and a safe environment by our regular and guest artists.

What we need

As a result of the corona crisis there is a shutdown in Vienna for the next weeks and we closed our studio to contribute to everyone staying safe. As we just opened 4 months ago we still need a few months time to get in all the costs of renovation, furniture etc. This shutdown effects us really hard and we need funds to stay afloat and be able to operate again after the crisis.

What you get

With your contribution we will be able to stay afloat during the crisis, pay the bills for the studio and keep working on sick designs. As soon as the crisis is over we will open again and bring you the best and most interesting guests in Vienna again. As thanks for your contributions we will send out goodies for randomly selected donors – sticker packs, t-shirts, tattoo vouchers, original art.

Impact

With your contribution we will be able to operate through the crisis and continue changing the tattoo community in Austria and worldwide. An international network of conscious artists where everyone feels welcome and safe, no matter the sexual orientation, skin color or looks.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's also possible to support us via PayPal, for info please write us an email. If you can't contribute you can still help by sharing this campaign on your social media channels.

story:
What is Art Madness

Art Madness is an independent publication that features diverse categories of art such as (Illustrations,Photography, Painting, Collages, authors, and content creators ) In a brief story we are inviting all in.

Everyone has something either to say or to express would find our publication the perfect to fit in, and we are extremely happy to showcase whatever in peoples mind.

Art Madness showcase Interviews with artists about their practice & life in general as well hold creative authors who publish their stories and whatever in mind, as we mentioned before we are inviting (ALL IN)

 

Our 3rd volum called TIME CAPSULE , and guess what? it really means it.

The Volume will feature 

( Paolo Barretta,August Ostberg,Cody Klintworth,DAVID STENBECK,Gab Bios,Emir Shiro,Venus Libido, Yosigo, Changdongwon) And many other contiributers in (design,Photography and Authoring)

 

What We Need The Funds For & What you get

  • We need funds to mainly print the magazine as the least amount for production is 1500 copies.
  • Also, we want to distribute it in a number of stores and shops all over USA and EUROPE
  • The printing will be in the country of print (Berlin, Germany) and that what we actually need the funding for.
  • If we didn't reach the campaign goal, You would still recieve your copies as we have a backplan to print on demand for those who orderd our copies,and actually that's an expensive substitute,but we still want to stay honest with those who supported the project,Or there is other option to refund if the campaign didn't reach at least 200 Perks 
  •  

The Impact

  • Art Madness isn't just an ordinary publication that you could find on any bookshelf, Art madness is actually an idea that will create a huge field for creatives to showcase their works, point views, and how they see the world. The best part about creativity that it's the best implementor to the human mind, as we believe that new ideas and creative stuff can bring the human to a new world & exploration.
  • All the creatives & talents are invited to this magazine, however, the background, culture and race. Art Madness have 0 bais to any trend or background, but it's an open ground to anybody who has the voice to speak or to create
  • Art Madness showcase Artists from all over the world (Korea,USA,China,Egypt,Germany,Italy,Canada...etc) from every corner in this world,As we believe it can make a huge impact on the societies when we have a creative publication with that divers, As we believe creations have neither religion nor nationality.. it simply ART.. and it can impact this universe in long-term as far it can get. It will guarantee the reader that we all living in the same cup, but we just share different perspectives.. 
  • Art Madness will be a tool that shares acceptance, love, diverse, and whatever this universe hold and we believe as far we can reach, as much we can leave an impact on the societies and our world
  •  

Risks & Challenges

Based on an independent assessment of our project, it's been identified that shipping the magazine around the globe would be our greatest challenge. We have found a specialist who can fulfil our needs not only in distribution but also in printing and stacking the magazine. 

 

           

 

Specifications

  • 8.5/11 Inches
  • Matte Papers
  • Perfectly bound magazine 
  • 128 Pages                      

  Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by sharing our campaign to those who may be interested or passionate about art and creativity. 

Or you could share it through social media platforms 

Finally, we would like to thank all those who contributed in making this  magazine and those who spend endless hours trying to bring it to the light

And that's all there is to it.

It will guarantee the reader that we all living in the same cup, but we just share different perspectives.. 
Art Madness will be a tool that shares acceptance, love, diverse, and whatever this universe hold and we believe as far we can reach, as much we can leave an impact on the societies and our world
 



Risks & Challenges
Based on an independent assessment of our project, it's been identified that shipping the magazine around the globe would be our greatest challenge. We have found a specialist who can fulfil our needs not only in distribution but also in printing and stacking the magazine. 
 
           
 
Specifications

8.5/11 Inches
Matte Papers
Perfectly bound magazine 
128 Pages                      

  Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by sharing our campaign to those who may be interested or passionate about art and creativity. 
Or you could share it through social media platforms 
Finally, we would like to thank all those who contributed in making this  magazine and those who spend endless hours trying to bring it to the light
And that's all there is to it.

story:
METRONOME CITY

Hi! My name is Jeff Bostic and I'm an artist, freelance curator, and long-time nonprofit worker in the Bay Area -- inspired to raise money to support other artists who are taking financial hits as a result of Covid-19.

In response, I've curated a show of over 35 artists, poets, DJs, comedians, makers and 50+ pieces in “Metronome City” @ The Midway galleries.  And our intention is to collectively raise funds to provide artists with increased financial stability, aiming to pay everyone $100+. No one is getting rich off this project; it is about survival and pushing forward through hard times. 

Yet your contributions will fuel the next filmmaker or painter to keep on keepin on by creating art that will inspire. It will send a message that art is essential to the human spirit in San Francisco. This is precisely why I've deemed the show title “Metronome City” -- inspired from one of my artistic influences, Yoko Ono. It was her famous quote that rings so true today “Artists are going to be the metronome of this society.” 

ENJOY THE SHOW

You're invited to contribute $10. (Or up to $100, if you're feelin' sassy in the apocalypse). For your perk, you'll have free access the virtual variety show on Twitch TV at https://www.twitch.tv/themidwaysf  @ the beginning of August. More details to come!

 

Catch the opening now on Youtube! By clicking here - https://bit.ly/metronomecityartshowSF

The opening is an hour and a half show of SF artists: art, poetry, music, short films, comedians, and more!?!

If you want to purchase a piece please contact andrea@themidwaysf.com. Thank you to folks that have contributed so far. We are half way there!

 

 

EARLY CLOSING GALLERY ACCESS

For a $10 contribution, you'll have early access to the closing gallery in August. The closing gallery will be a curated show of short films, music videos, and more of Bay Artist that have the pulse of the Bay Area plus live DJ event. The gallery video will be available for two weeks after on the Midway SF channel and then showcased on Youtube! If you have a projector or large flat screen you can use these collection of visuals at your next party!

BUY A PIECE OF ARTWORK

And buy a piece of work! Feel free to contact andrea@themidwaysf.com to do just that.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can not donate or buy a painting at this time please, please, forward this Indiegogo to as many people as you can, watch and follow The Midway on Twitch TV https://www.twitch.tv/themidwaysf

We will really appreciate all the love you can spread for the cause.

With gratitude,

Jeff

story:
Transport in Pader

Transport is terrible in Pader, I mean really terrible. If you don't have a car (and hardly anyone does) You can go to the neighbouring towns by motorcycle taxi which is dangerous and expensive, on the back of a truck with whatever livestock or goods might crush you. You can go in a car with 8 or 10 of you in a five seater which is dangerous, sweaty and uncomfortable.

Pader is in the north of Uganda, it is a very poor community, the average wage is less than $1.50 per day. There is currently no transport service during the day for a town of 15,000 people.  We believe this is restricting communities ability to generate trade and wealth and to sustainably support their families.

So we want to help Pader grow commercially – which we believe will have a developmental ripple effect across the town and which will allow people in Pader reach better services such as hospitals and clinics in the towns and cities.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to buy a 4x4 Toyota minibus. These hold 14 people and will carry luggage in the roof rack. We will need good mud tyres and a winch for when we get stuck. We need to equip the van with enough seats and extra tough suspension and pay the legal fees for starting a community transport service. These minibuses are the lifeblood of transportation in East Africa and are easily repaired in Uganda. They are also rugged and reliable.

In return for the support we will plaster your name on the van. The more you give the bigger your name will be and you will achieve fame and notoriety in rural Africa. People may name their children after you and your name will be forever associated with helping a rural community in rural Africa develop.

What Reliable Transport Means

Imagine not being able to get good medical care or drugs when you or your child is sick. Imagining waiting weeks or months for a vital part or tool to arrive so you can continue your business. Reliable transport means you are connected to the world and you are able to take advantage of opportunities afforded by access to larger towns and cities. It means you can see friends and family more often and travel onwards to places such as Kampala or Juba. You can choose to start businesses using materials or tools which were previously unavailable to you. Extra educational possibilities open up for your children and its easier to find qualified employees and employers if they can reach you easily.


The Impact

Oasis have been working in Pader in Northern Uganda for the past seven years. In the past the community was decimated by attacks from the Lords Resistance Army which was very active in the region committing attrocities in villages and small towns such as Pader. 

Oasis started working in Pader as a response to this, since then our work has expanded to include football teams, savings and loans groups, HIV and STD prevention and catch-up classes which help those kids who need extra help in school. We believe in equipping and strengthening the community, to do this we want to help Pader grow commercially.

Just one bus could transfer 168 passengers per week, and we believe this would not only improve the lives of those passengers, but also the families & communities that will share in the sustainable benefits of increased trade in Pader.  We also believe it could have a multiplier effect, increasing Pader’s presence as a centre for trade in the region.

Once the service is established, our research reassures us that it will become sustainable & self-funding very quickly. We just need to buy the first bus - this is where we think you can help. If we achieve more for our fundraising then we can buy additional buses which would multiply the effect.

Any profits will all go directly to Oasis' work in Uganda building communities where everyone is included, making a contribution and reaching their God given potential. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The roads are really bad in this region, especially when it rains. Trucks carve huge channels in the road which then fill with water and make them barely passable.  The government has promised to start paving some of the major roads in the region but this has yet to start. 

We will have a properly maintained four wheel drive vehicle with a winch and good mud tyres to help us traverse the roads. 

We will also need good public liability insurance and an experienced driver because you never know what might happen on the road. 

Oasis has to make sure we are corruption free, this will mean that everyone involved receives a fair wage and it also means making sure that audits and accounts are done well, ticketing and bookings mean that cash is carefully accounted for and the supply chain is managed well. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No Money? No Problem!

Please help us by sharing this campaign with your friends. After all they could be famous.

Follow us on Twitter @oasisuganda or Facebook "Oasis in Uganda" 

Catch up with our website www.oasisug.org

How about doing a fundraiser for us? We love weird and wacky ideas to raise funds.

story:
Short Summary

 Whether you have a wedding to announce, a new baby in the family or a photogenic pet, custom postage is always a fun and easy way to add a personal touch to everything you send in the mail! USA POSTAGE can help you grow your business by showcasing your business logo, announcing new products, or advertising upcoming events. You can also give them as unforgettably unique gifts, or keep them and frame them so you and your family can treasure your postage for years to come!

Now that upper right hand corner of your mail is open for business. create your own picture on Real U.S Postage and have fun !!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise funds for this project at least $50,000 so that this project can go live.
  • Backers will receive special design sheets with their picture on Real Postage along with some complimentary items based on the category they are in.

The Impact

your contribution makes this project go live. we have website ready to use. please visit www.usa-postage.com to have a look at our website. Suggestions are always welcome.

  • That upper right hand corner of your mail is now open for business. we are all, always will be excited to see our picture or our business logo on Real U.S. Postage. Now you have that opportunity from USA POSTAGE.
  • Memories like Birthdays, New baby arrival into family, a wedding celebration or an 25th year anniversary can be bench marked or more personalized by creating Postage featuring the person image or a corporate/business logo on Real U.S. Postage. 

  • You can promote your business or products or a message on Real U.S. Postage, here on our website the possibilities are endless. your imagination is now can come into reality.

    Risks & Challenges

    Recently we became the Authorized re -seller to offer Custom Postage for individuals. our website is ready now to use the only challenge we see is reaching out to people so that they can place orders on our website.

    • very soon after this campaign we would like to run a marketing campaign to promote our business.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • we request the folks who can not contribute at this point, Please spread the word about USA POSTAGE and help us to be a successful venture.

    And that's all there is to it.
