story:
The minimum ask is $500, I only wanted to ask for $20, but I'll take $500... if I have to, I guess..

Hi. I'm Brandon and I really enjoy eating cheeseburgers. Do you like cheeseburgers? Then you totally get it. Why would you decline me a cheeseburger? Why would you be so heartless? You wouldn't. In fact I'm certain you have a human heart, unless you've had some sort of experimental procedure giving you a pig heart or something. And if that's the case get your pig-hearted self out of here. This campaign is not for you! Are all the pig hearts gone? Good, let's continue. If you love cheeseburgers please consider giving to my campaign to get myself a cheeseburger. If you check out the rewards you might be able to get yourself a cheeseburger in the process.

Risks and challenges

The biggest risk is that I won't get to eat a free cheeseburger. And seriously that's devastating.

Stretch Goals:

$600 - I'll make it a double cheeseburger
$800 - I'll add bacon
$900 - I'll make/eat/film a McWhopper also.
$1,000 - I'll add fresh black Italian truffle shavings
$1,500 - I'll make/eat/film a Wagyu ground chuck burger
$2,000 - I'll grind/make/eat/film a burger from Kobe steaks
$2,500 - double Kobe steak burger
$4,000 - I'll ruin the Kobe with cheese whiz from a can
$50,000 - I'll pick a $1 donor at random, fly them to south bend, put them up in a hotel, to enjoy a Kobe steak burger with me.
$500,000 - Cheeseburger in Paradise - I'll throw a Kobe burger party in Hawaii, will fly a random donor +a guest to join. More details if we get anywhere near this incredibly ridiculous goal.

story:
Omertà is a solo created in 2014. From 25 to 28 October it will be in NY, so I 'm looking for money to go in NY.

It won 'Concorso Città di Bolzano 2014' and I had chance to dance it  at 'Biennale della Prossimità', Genova, 2015.

I'm a professional contemporary dancer and I worked with P. Giradeau, Ballet de Lorraine,F. M. Pizzuto and stage directors as Zeffirelli, Pizzi, Cobelli, Carsen etc.

My new production, the fourth, will be about the joy of life.

story:
TRAMA TRAWA es una obra de la escultora Norma Ramírez Bustos, ganadora del premio Altazor en la categoría Artes Visuales en el año 2014, que nace con el propósito de honrar la memoria de Alonso Fernando Gahona Chávez, detenido desaparecido desde el año 1975.Esta obra que será exhibida en el Museo de la Memoria y los Derechos Humanos, en el mes de septiembre del 2015, tiene como elemento principal una camisa que perteneció a Alonso Fernando Gahona, a partir de la cual se harán dos reproducciones exactas, que utilizarán sus hijos cotidianamente hasta el inicio de montaje de la obra.

A la par será realizado un documental dirigido por Francisco Brzovic, que registrará el proceso de creación de la obra de Norma Ramírez, desde sus bosquejos hasta su inauguración, en el que se incluye el seguimiento de fabricación de las réplicas de la camisa, y posterior uso por los seres cercanos a Alonso (hijos, nietos, amigos), hasta el momento en que estas son recuperadas para el montaje de la obra. Junto con esto se detallará la historia de Alonso Gahona al momento de su detención y desaparición por la CNI en el año 1975.

La obra escultórica

La pieza principal de la obra consiste en un entramado de formas en hilo del mismo color de la camisa original y cuerda encerada tensadas al suelo, al techo, a los muros y a las camisas, sobre las cuales caerán constantemente gotas de agua a dos compases diferentes. Dichas gotas caerán sobre dos contenedores de agua hechos de resina poliéster transparente, desde los cuales el agua será bombeada de vuelta al sistema hidráulico que las hará nuevamente caer y empapar. La obra estará conformada además por sistemas de sonido e iluminación.


De esta manera, a través de “Trama Trawa”, Norma vuelve a mostrar y a envolver los lugares silenciosos e invisibles que ha venido sugiriendo a través de sus sucesivas creaciones. Y da cumplimento a la labor que le encomendara Yuri Gahona, hijo de Alonso y alumno suyo en uno de los primeros talleres de artesanía que impartió durante principios de la década del ’80, de hacer de la camisa de su padre una obra de arte y un símbolo de todos aquellos hombres y mujeres desaparecidos en dictadura cuyos cuerpos aún no son encontrados por sus familiares. Trawa en mapudungún puede significar “cuerpo” o “piel”

La obra audiovisual

En paralelo a la exposición de Norma Ramírez, será exhibido de manera permanente en la sala Microcine del museo, el documental que relata el proceso de creación de la obra.

Compromiso

Esta obra, que no obtuvo apoyo del Fondo para la Cultura y las Artes, requiere de una inversión importante en materiales y tecnología. La decisión de llevarla a cabo, obedece al compromiso moral que como persona y como artista Norma Ramírez a tenido a lo largo de su trayectoria artística.

La opción de hacer un documental en paralelo, obedece a la necesidad de dejar un testimonio y material de consultación, que conecta con la misión que se dió el MMDH de aportar con reflexión y educación al tema de los derechos humanos, utilizando como soporte diferentes medios y expresiones artísticas.

Con el dinero recaudado vamos a financiar la compra de los materiales, el arriendo de los equipos de grabación y edición del video, la copia y estuche de los DVD.

Por esta razón, tu aporte es valioso para conseguir su realización y exhibición.

Te recordamos que no solo las personas pueden aportar, también las instituciones y empresas.

Si no puedes aportar en dinero, te pedimos que nos ayudes a difundir esta campaña enviando el link de esta página a tu red de amigos.

En este link encontrarás la página web de la artista

http://www.normaramirez.cl/


Lo que alcanzará con lo recaudado

con el 10%  se paga el telón de acceso exposición con intervención de la artista

con el 25% además del telón, alcanza para los hilos, perfiles de Aluminio para la fabricación del entramado, cuerda encerada, sistema hidráulico, luces y sonido

con el 50% además de lo anterior, alcanza para 2 recipientes contenedores de líquido en resina poliéster cristal, 2 reproducciones camisa original, telón de presentación rostro, postales y presentación obra interactiva, por la sala de acceso metro

con el 75% además de lo anterior, podremos financiar 10 días de arriendo material de filmación, y 20 dias de arriendo material edición.

con el 100% , además de pagar todo lo mencionado, podremos hacer la duplicación de 100 dvd, la creación gráfica y compra de los estuches, hacer la mezcla de sonido, la colorimetría y la copia master del documental en DCP, para su difusión.
story_txt:
TRAMA
TRAWA es una obra de la
escultora Norma Ramírez Bustos, ganadora del premio Altazor en la categoría
Artes Visuales en el año 2014, que nace con el propósito de honrar la memoria
de Alonso Fernando Gahona Chávez, detenido desaparecido desde el año 1975.Esta obra que será
exhibida en el Museo de la Memoria y los Derechos Humanos, en el mes de
septiembre del 2015, tiene como elemento principal una camisa que perteneció a
Alonso Fernando Gahona, a partir de la cual se harán dos reproducciones
exactas, que utilizarán sus hijos cotidianamente hasta el inicio de montaje de
la obra.
A la
par será realizado un documental dirigido por Francisco Brzovic, que registrará
el proceso de creación de la obra de Norma Ramírez, desde sus bosquejos hasta su
inauguración, en el que se incluye el seguimiento de fabricación de las
réplicas de la camisa, y posterior uso por los seres cercanos a Alonso (hijos,
nietos, amigos), hasta el momento en que estas son recuperadas para el montaje
de la obra. Junto con esto se detallará la historia de Alonso Gahona al momento
de su detención y desaparición por la CNI en el año 1975. 


La obra escultórica
La
pieza principal de la obra consiste en un entramado de formas en hilo del mismo
color de la camisa original y cuerda encerada tensadas al suelo, al techo, a
los muros y a las camisas, sobre las cuales caerán constantemente gotas de agua
a dos compases diferentes. Dichas gotas caerán sobre dos contenedores de agua
hechos de resina poliéster transparente, desde los cuales el agua será bombeada
de vuelta al sistema hidráulico que las hará nuevamente caer y empapar. La obra
estará conformada además por sistemas de sonido e iluminación.
De esta manera, a
través de “Trama Trawa”, Norma vuelve a mostrar y a envolver los lugares
silenciosos e invisibles que ha venido sugiriendo a través de sus sucesivas
creaciones. Y da cumplimento a la labor que le encomendara Yuri Gahona, hijo de
Alonso y alumno suyo en uno de los primeros talleres de artesanía que impartió

dictadura cuyos cuerpos aún no son encontrados por sus familiares. Trawa en
mapudungún puede significar “cuerpo” o “piel”

a la exposición de Norma Ramírez, será exhibido de manera permanente en la sala

obra.

un documental en paralelo, obedece a la necesidad de dejar un testimonio y
material de consultación, que conecta con la misión que se dió el MMDH de
aportar con reflexión y educación al tema de los derechos humanos, utilizando

Por esta razón, tu

story:
Short Summary

I am pursuing an MFA in Photography, Video and Related Media at the School of Visual Arts.  I am expected to Graduate May 14th!   As a part of thesis graduation the school hosts a group show in June.  My thesis project "For Example, Family Tyranny" is an installation, of imagery and performance-video, based on the exchanges of loss and trauma within family that become ritualistic.  Above is a still of what my final installation will look like.  The background are images are from Chatham, NJ where my grandparents grew up.  I made these photographs in the fall when I went to research the traces of my family's life in this town.  The three rectangles represent the performance-video's I shot.  They will be mounted on the negative like images and playing in a loop.  I am raising funds to purchase materials for my project because I can not afford to purchase what I need with the income I earn from my day job.  I have put myself through school for the last three years, continue to support myself as an idenpendent, and really need funding to install my project in the group show.  Please help me obtain the proper materials so that I may represent myself and my work to best of my ability!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $2,261 to be used for the purchase of the very large background prints to be printed on self-adhesive backing, (3) usb flash drives fast enough for video, and (100) post-cards with postage as perks for contributors.  Also, any money raised will go towards transportation of the very large and heavy background images and (3) 32" flat screen monitors that the video's will play on.  Last year the school paid for transportation of equipment/installation materials to and from the gallery for thesis students, but this year due to renovations within the department students are being asked to pick up the bill.  This will require at least three separate trips to satisfy the schedule put forth by the school: to the gallery, from the gallery to home, and from home to school to return any borrowed equipment.  Taxis are very expensive in New York when you are trying to make rent and will begin paying back student loans!  The bulk of my expenses are the large prints with self-adhesive backing that need to be printed by a vendor due to general printer and paper limitations, space issues and access at our department leading up to the show.
  • Each person who contributes $25 or more will receive an installation post-card in the mail from me!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the amount raised will be applied to the purchase of as much of the materials I can afford to buy for the installation at the time I will need to purchase in order to be prepared for installation.  

The Impact

In addition to attending graduate school full-time, I work as a bookkeeper for artists.  I have borrowed the full amount allowed in student loans to supplement the cost of living in New York City (rent, food, healthcare, household expenses, etc.), pay tuition, department fees, equipment fees/insurance required, and to purchase materials or supplies necessary to purse an MFA.  Unfortunately, working and loans are not enough for me to realize my final thesis exhibition and I can not borrow anymore money.  Your contribution will help me realize my final thesis project as I have envisioned and allow me to install a lovely installation in the thesis group show.  

  • My project is valuable because it represents an experience many people can relate to but that is rarely exhibited in a Gallery.  I feel my project is worthy of being experienced as I have envisioned.  I will contribute a very different perspective of what art is in a rather formal institution.
  • This is my very first show in a gallery.  I want my installation to be exactly as I have imagined it.  I have worked really hard with Aura Rosenberg, an established New York artist and my mentor, to organize, conceptualize and create a work that speaks to the experience of unstable family life.
  • I have survived many New York obstacles while putting myself through graduate school the last three years! The saying if you can make it in New York City you can you can make it anywhere is so true.  Trust me, I have been challenged on all fronts at every turn!  I need your support and can not do it with out you!  Your help will greatly impact my ability to pull off an amazing thesis show and greatly improve your own karma for when you have to ask for help!

Risks & Challenges

I have 30 days to raise the full amount needed. Please help me reach my goal!  Graduate school has been a test of many strengths beyond making art.  While I feel like I missed out a lot on the graduate experience, making the art/installation I want to make in the thesis show would feel very satisfying!

  • What qualifies me to overcome this hurdle is that I am passionate about my work.  Despite many challenges to my well being and safety during my graduate studies I continued to fight for my education and for my art within institutions that offered no safety net or support.  I never gave up and I reached my goal of graduating!
  • I took a huge risk attending graduate school in my 30's without any financial support.  Incurring an astronomical amount of debt to realize my dream was necessary because I can not imagine my life without art and I want to pursue a career in the art feild!
  • The study of Photography, Video and Related Media is crucial in today's culture because there is so much we do not yet understand about what this means in a world defined by digital technology and the internet.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to contribute, I totally understand! Send me positive thoughts and please share with your friends and family.  Also, do not forget to like this post on Facebook to help get the word out.
  • Keep making art and being creative!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome! 

I'd like to introduce you to some of the delightful native plants that I've met in the rainforests of Northern NSW where I have worked as a professional bush regenerator for the last twenty years. 

Not many people are lucky enough to experience the subtle beauty of the Australian native rainforest - its shapes, colours and forms - as I do almost daily. That's why I'd like to share them with you. This is how it happens: I find a sample of a flower or fruit, put it in a bag and bring it home. Then I draw it as soon as possible while it is still fresh and alive. The only exceptions are threatened species, which I draw in the bush. I use a nib pen dipped in ink, and draw on clear acetate cell. This is a technique I learned while working in cartoon animation studios in Sydney in the 1980s, when these things were still done by hand. 


I love the work I do by day, and I can't wait to get all my other necessities out of the way at night, so that I can get back to these drawings.

And what's been under the bed? Some of the drawings I'm completing now were started as early as 1994 and have been stored under my bed ever since, so it's high time they "came out". I call them "botanical cartoons" because, while they are quite interpretative and freely drawn, in most ways they are botanically "correct",  and the authentic link with the tradition of cartooning is clear in the techniques I use. 

The notion of "botanical cartoons" is an idea I came up with because the plants are presented as if at two or three moments in their life cycle, especially flowering and fruiting. They could almost be individual cells taken from a cartoon movie of the life of that plant.

There's one other thing, and it's about the quirky layout, where I give each design its own number and frame. When I was at primary school, we used to collect and trade Scanlen's Gum cards. So now I'm creating my own set, inspired not by TV shows or sporting heroes, but by the flowers, leaves and fruits of Australian plants.  

I spent much of my childhood exploring the bush in the Hunter Valley, walking along creeks and being fascinated by the native plants and animals, so bringing these drawings to the public is much like a coming home for me. 

The NSW North Coast of Australia has been my home now for over twenty years and includes the "Big Scrub". This was originally a vast area of subtropical rainforest which was once 75,000 hectares but has been reduced to only 1% of its original size. The remaining 750 hectares contains a number of rare and endangered species and is also the land of the Bundjalung Aboriginal nation.

I am happy to report that my daytime work over the last twenty years has contributed to the preservation of many valuable areas of native vegetation in this area. My night time (and rainy day) drawings are an extension of that experience, and I hope that they may intrigue and excite you into exploring and loving the Australian bush.


What We Need & What You Get

I would like to encourage you to contribute to the production of a series of 16 greeting cards and the first of a three-part series of fun and educational colouring books, which in turn will help me to present my collection of works at a gallery in Byron Bay in November 2015. 

Your assistance would allow me to realise a long-held ambition to complete a body of work which has spent too long under the bed. By the end of June 2015, I will have 48 works ready for exhibition and printing. 


Completion of this first collection will enable me to continue the project into the future, and also to produce a high-quality art book for launch at my exhibition this year. 

I am seeking AU$25,950 to assist me with....

1.  Production of 100 fun, educational colouring books $2,200
2.  Production of 100 high quality art books $2,500
3.  Production of 320 greeting cards (20 of 16 designs) $    900
4.  Production of my first exhibition November 2015 $7,000
5.  Photography & Graphic Design for Series #1 Collection (48 works) $ 1,500
6.  Media advertising of exhibition event locally & nationally $3,000
7.  Materials  $8,850
                                                                                                                      Total  AU $25,950

Your Impact

Conservation has been a lifetime preoccupation of mine - country halls, grammar and punctuation marks, gum cards and most importantly, the Australian bush, which is under siege on numerous fronts.  

The difference your contribution will make is that you will be participating quite directly in my determination to popularise and promote the values of the Australian rainforest by celebrating their forms and colours. I think celebrating the intimate and rarely seen moments in the life cycle (flowers, fruits and falling parts) of rainforest species, is ultimately more worthwhile than lamenting their demise.

I have a long track record of completing art projects, from professional TV and film set design, to graphic arts and illustration of journals, commissioned works and public art. I am committed to this project, one way or another.


Risks & Challenges

The challenge has always been to finish a functional collection of work in my spare time, while working full time in the bush during the day. Time is the issue. Sheer determination and many late nights will get me there in the end, but the support of my team and your contribution will go a long way towards supporting me to achieve my project on time and to the quality I desire.

                                             


Other Ways You Can Help 

Your financial contribution would be appreciated, but if you can't do that, you can still be part of the campaign by telling your friends about my work, by clicking the Share buttons on the top left hand corner of this page, or by coming to the Byron Bay exhibition in November. Please let me know if you would like to be on the exhibition invitation list by emailing me at macarang6@gmail.com 


Other Works by Tim Roberts

Along the way I have been commissioned to draw business cards, logos, perspective drawings, design for film and TV, wedding invitations, panoramas of rooms, council signs, walking trail instructional signs, restaurant menus and other commercial works, graphic designs and artwork. Here's a sneak peak of some other of my other non-botanical work....

Other Works by Tim RobertsAlong the way I have been commissioned to draw business cards, logos, perspective drawings, design for film and TV, wedding invitations, panoramas of rooms, council signs, walking trail instructional signs, restaurant menus and other commercial works, graphic designs and artwork. Here's a sneak peak of some other of my other non-botanical work....

story:
The Hip-Hop Cosmic Circle Palestine is composed by Nadim Al Ayaseh, stage name is MC Naz, a Palestinian refugee rapper, activist and writer ; Mohammed Ghanayem, also known as Hajj MC, a Palestinian refugee rapper originally from Haifa; Moises Lopez, a Hip-Hop Educator and activist in New York City, and Alice Le Diouron, a French researcher trainee and activist, and Elijah Gomez, filmmaker, photographer and activist from the Bronx, New York

The Hip-Hop Cosmic Circle- Palestine foresees creating and supporting a three day Hip-Hop conference in Bethlehem & Ramallah to make innovations glow in a country often presented through the Israeli-Palestinian conflict prism by bringing, together, people who have already been independently contributing to innovations.

One of the major goals of this conference is to help create the first Hip-Hop School of Palestine, a project that will embrace the arising creative-talented artists and will give them the support to continue their artistic march in what serves the humanitarian work.

Through film screenings, panel discussions, and collaborative music performances, The three day conference is intended to provide a space where participants will be able to interrogate the dynamics of power, hegemony, and popular culture in the Middle East. From this engagement will emerge a proactive framework for thinking through potential nonviolent alternatives to trauma, mourning, and loss.

Hip Hop is suggested to be a loudspeaker of the counter hegemonic discourse of Palestinians & YOU can also be the loudspeaker of the counter hegemonic discourse of Palestinians by participating in this beautiful project. We really need your help to make this historic event happen!!

story: My name is Jason Wisener and I am trying to raise money for an Art Show !  As you know Art supplies are not cheap, I work two jobs but still need help in putting together the funds for a great show !  I have been an artist my entire life and have studied it at Rocky Mountain College of Art & Design & The University of New Mexico.  I would appreciate any contribution and those of $100 or more will receive a free 8 x 10 original piece of artwork of their choosing by me !  I have had successful shows in the past that featured other Artists, but this show I want to feature exclusively me.  I have overcome many obstacles in my life, and am very serious about putting together the best Art Show anyone has ever seen.  Contributions are very much appreciated and please tell your friends !

story:
Entropy 2031

Our globe hangs by a thread inside the Entropy 2031 - a model blender over 9ft tall.  The faux blades of the blender are powered by two bicycles the public can ride, one named Greed and the other Ignorance.  These two inputs are assisted by an oil drum connected by a mock extension cord.

This project symbolizes the driving forces of climate change and the impact of human endeavors on the world.  Each person who interacts with the piece is given the opportunity to reflect on humanity’s part in the ecosphere, and to discover how teamwork and technology can have unexpected consequences for our planet. 

After discovering the the installation,  you are confronted with a choice. Are you part of the problem, and if so does Greed or Ignorance better represent their character?  But one force is not enough to destroy the world.  Only the combination of both can spin the blades that will eventually shred our mock earth.

The People

Ryan Gregory is a multimedia artist native to Flint, Michigan. His work focuses on creating intricate found object constructions blended with alternative engineering.  Ryan’s piece “Thumb Piano Guitar” was featured on booooooom.com’s Made of Imagination, a unique instrument contest. Ryan also won the People’s Choice award at Free City Art Festival 2014 for his piece “Found Object, Sound Object” a display of interactive homemade musical instruments.

A dedicated Maker and installation artist, Lex Talionis has participated in projects for Burning Man, Makers Fair and the Oakland Fire Art’s Festivals.  With a skillset focused on logistics, engineering and production, Lex loves to help artists make art happen!

Where’s My Money Going?

Generously funded by a Lakes of Fire Art Grant this project is already being built.  This grant only covers materials used, not any crew or transportation expences. As a collaberation between a broke student and a starving artist, we are looking to you to help us support our passtion, and to bring this thing to life.

 Lakes of Fire Crew Expenses

  •  3x Reserved Artist Tickets @$90/ea $270
  •  Lunch and Dinner for 3 Crew    $55
  •  Camping Fuel  $15

Transportation

  • 20 Gallons of Gas @$3/gal  $60

Lighting Supplies

  • Light Fixtures 7@$7/ea  $50
  • Gels/Lenses and Bulbs  $50   

Even if we don't reach our goal, all funds will go towards the transportation and ticket fees

And What Do I Get?

Besides our eternal gratitude and a chance to enjoy the sculpture at Lakes of Fire?  Awesome perks!  From stickers to a personal found object sculpture of a miniature Entropy 2031.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk we face is being unable to buy the 3 tickets that have been reserved for us.    Once these tickets have been secured, feeding and transporting the hardworking crew to the event takes priority.

Other Ways You Can Help

Have materials you want to donate?  Want to take the crew out for burgers and beer?  Contact us on our Facebook Page!  Of course you can always share this campaign with Indiegogo's tools, like our Facebook or just spread the word.

story:
Many people have asked me "what is an Art Car?" This is a chicken art car that made by Smitty Regula in Houston. I want to do a chicken themed art car for Takoma Park! Yes, it will be a chicken theme. No, it will NOT look just like this one. UPDATE: I have technical assistance from Clarke Bedford of the famed Hyattsville art car! Join in! Be part of the team that will transform this blank canvas into a moving tribute to all the things that make Takoma Park, MD the weird and wonderful place it is!

The goal of this project is to take our Subaru Forester and turn it into a beautiful and visionary art car to be shown at parades and events. It started as an idea over coffee with Laura Barclay, and led to three month long search for a car. Enter Penny and Julie from the Big Bad Woof, who donated their pet food delivery car! We now have a car ready to be turned into an Art Car! It is "canvas" white, symbolic of the beginning of this journey.

The team is led by professional artist Marcelle Fozard. She has been doing small and large scale art for many years and is a highly visible member of the Takoma Park art community. The team will be further supplemented by as many fun and like minded artsy minions as she is able to corral. The idea is for this to be something the community build together and can enjoy.

Marcelle has almost no experience in decorating cars but she has something better. She has plenty of experience charging into the unknown without fear or hesitation. She has successfully taught herself many different art skills including yarn bombing, sewing all sorts of different materials, community murals and now arc welding.

Marcelle specializes in art projects that are also community builders, that bring mirth and cheer. Support the Art Car project and know that you are contributing to a piece of weirdness for Takoma Park.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support for some mundane things like insurance (cheap!) and Maryland registration. However, anything past the bare minimum that we can spend on this - everything goes to keeping it WEIRD! Materials, tool rentals - all of our time is volunteer - so every dime goes to keeping the car going and getting it funky!

We have a variety of perks! We want you to join our team! This is going to be fun!

Please read the page with the perks and pick your level of support and fun!

Challenges

We are confident that we will meet our goal! However, if we don't, we will regroup and try again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let people know this is happening! If you can't contribute, send out an email, Facebook, tweet, whatevah, and we can get there together.

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
And that's when the laser blew up....

well, it didn't explode; rather it shattered internally.

Hi there, we are Secret Weapon Designs from Houston TX. A small group of creative custom Fabricators and Artists, we are passionate about experimental fine art, unique furniture, custom products and accessories of any kind; and anything we can paint, build or make.  

  • This past Thursday April 23, 2015, while running a project for the Houston Rescue Pet Movement our laser malfunctioned and the laser tube internally shattered, rendering our large laser cutter/engraver useless. 
  • For the past year we have been providing Houston businesses a valuable Laser cutting service to grow and expand their businesses. Our creative team delivers unique solutions in the form of carpentry, murals, signs, fineart, apparel, and jewlery.

John Guiney - owner/operator/designer/painter 

http://cargocollective.com/GuineyArt
State Flag

Skyline Vinyl Clock



Wu-tang Vinyl Record (Collection of 9 Records)


Bryan Cope - operator/designer/artist/painter 


https://instagram.com/bryancope 

Eric Ling - fabrication/carpentry/site management/project logistics

What We Need & What You Get

Time to break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need a replacement tube, plus crowd-funding fees. Through our art we are able to pursue our passions and express ourselves, however, the catch 22 is that without this key piece of equipment none of our endeavors can come to fruition.
  • Here is the actual part http://www.lightobject.com/High-Quality-Reci-13...
  • Even if we don't reach our goal the machine must be repaired. Every dollar toward our goal helps ease the financial strain and gets you an amazing thank you gift for a once in a lifetime price.


The Impact 

        Without your support getting back up and running will be a struggle.

    As one of the largest and most powerful lasers in Houston, Our creative team, along with this machine, allow many businesses that would otherwise not be able to afford custom work get high quality products, Made in Houston, at a reasonable cost.


Challenges

The company that we purchased the laser from, almost immediately disappeared off of the map upon accepting our payment. We are the only 2013-2014 order which the company fulfilled. . 

The company we purchased this machine from has Declared Bankruptcy, and thus all warranties are voided 

We have successfully repaired several smaller  problems on the laser, disassembled and reassembled the machine 3 times. We are our own warranty service providers now.

Once we get this replacement tube, we will be up and running to fulfill your artistic cravings. ( your thank you gifts for donating to the cause) .


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help!

  • Tweet, Share, Instagram, Call your mamma, or anyone who likes art. Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share images of the unique pieces that we are selling to any collectors, or budding art collectors that may want some amazing Art for incredible prices.
  • Just help us spread the message.

Thank you for your time and help.

story:
Short Summary

Billboards an exploration of the similarities and differences found between art, culture, and geographic location. I have partnered with JIWAR gallery in Barcelona to complete the third and final Billboards project,once again collaborating with local artists and using the designs and people I discover in the city to inform the maps. 

In order to make the project possible I've decided reach out to friends, fans and the online universe to make it a reality. It will be the most ambitious of the three Billboards exhibits and I will also be using the funds raised to bring the collaborations from all three shows back to Montreal for an exhibit and mural in the Fall of 2015.

Everyone who contributes and/or shares will receive thank you gifts. I've created a printable Billboards PDF activity kit to color and draw on as well as prints and  personalized commissions for those who decide to contribute more. Everyone who shares or contributes will also receive a reference in the final Billboards map I'll be creating in Montreal this August.

Most of all thank you for taking the time to read this, contribute, share and so on..this project means the world to me and I couldn't attain it without each of you!

story:
I am Andreas. I work as a communications analyst and adviser. The idea of this project is more or less the result of decades of my work and all those great learnings I made. Most important for me: I want to showcase in an extraordinary art exhibition how Print becomes Art and vice versa. Beyond Graphic Arts. All those amazing artists and their art pieces I selected are highly innovative.


To make this happen, I need your support and help. 

And I promise: Our supporters will be our heroes. It is all about the beauty and innovation power of The Art of Print. 

Background

Based in Mainz/Germany, the City of Johannes Gutenberg as the Man of the Millennium we have learned, that the real innovation in our life and culture is driven by those artists who are able to adopt new technologies to create and visualize the best content. We will have a mix out of the work of amazing German artists and a group of Chinese artists.


The funding is necessary to realize the exhibition concept, to present the exhibition pieces in a smart way, to frame them, to ship them to our unique exhibition locations in China, the home land of paper and print. And to publish about it via Social Media, videos and ebook applications.

Exclusively we will benefit from the famous art collection and world class knowledge of Prof. Wilhelm Weber, the author of art books like "Saxa Loquuntur" and "Aloys Senefelder".



+++++++++++++++++++++++++++

You find more detailed background information in my Blog.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++


Selection of the artists we will present:

HAP Grieshaber, Christian Kruck, Hermann Rapp, Dietmar Gross, Guido Ludes, Rudolf Scharpf, Eberhard Schlotter. And a group of famous Chinese artist selected by Dr. Ying Lin-Sill, Mainz/Beijing.

Special thanks to Dr. Ying Lin-Sill for being our project partner and co-organizer.

NOTE:

There is zero risk. The partnerships in China are already fixed and highly motivated. The exhibition art work is already available. The basic concept was shared with some genius experts in science, museums, art galleries, media. And for sure leading artists got involved as well. All of them loved it.

story:
We are Web Of Dreams!

Web of Dreams has taken many hands doing many tasks to become what it is today. We are a Seattle based team of fiber artists, infrastructure planners, tech-dabblers, and idea makers. Many of us have been crocheting or knitting for years, and some have just learned. Some of our people don't work with fiber at all! There is a place for everyone in the Web!

Web of Dreams was born as Suspension of Disbelief, and the debut was at an event called "Seacompression" in November of 2013. It was just a small set up, but it was a hit! Since then, we have set it up at a number of events, including the Seattle Mini Maker Faire, Georgetown Carnival, SOAK (a Portland area event) and have also taken it to Burning Man in 2014. 

We need your help!

We want to keep growing this dream. Currently, all of our rope panels are made from 1/4 inch nylon, and we attach it to scaffolding. We want to get away from renting scaffolding every time we set Web of Dreams up, and we want to use materials that are renewable.The ultimate goal is to avoid an adverse environmental impact when burning it. So we put our heads together and came up with the idea for some pretty amazing, super durable, easily transportable (collapsible!!) trees! Who doesn't love hanging in a hammock in the trees?

We have also found some pretty incredible nylon rope alternatives in hemp and cotton. The thing is, we need A LOT of it! About 60k feet! Cotton is going to be cheaper and softer, but hemp is stronger. Transporting and storing Web of Dreams also brings it's own problems, and we would love to have a box truck dedicated to that. The easier we can make the storing and (especially) transporting, the more events we can go to!

So here is how what we are asking for breaks down:

Trees - Our central tree will be around $600-700. The outer 6 trees will be $1000-1100 (if we use OSB plywood). Cost for smaller trees is based upon 6 trees 12' tall no wider than 8' at base, with a central 4x4 post all the panels attach to.               Total - $7300

Rope - $127.78/spool of cotton rope (1200 ft/spool) - $6,389

                                  -or-

              $123.72/spool of hemp rope (600 ft/spool) -  $12,372

Stretch Goals:

Box Truck - No more than $3,000 we hope! We don't need anything fancy or brand new, just in good enough shape that it's a worthy investment. We know mechanics that can make sure it runs well, and we have a place for the box truck to live already.

What's in it for you?

We have some mega sweet perks for you! Seriously, we have so much awesome stuff to offer, and a lot of it can be custom just for you!


       (All items are handmade and unique, and may differ from these photos)

Come climb with us, and share our dreams!

Many of us have been crocheting or knitting for years, and some have just learned. Some of our people don't work with fiber at all! There is a place for everyone in the Web!

Web of Dreams was born as Suspension of Disbelief, and the debut was at an event called "Seacompression" in November of 2013. It was just a small set up, but it was a hit! Since then, we have set it up at a number of events, including the Seattle Mini Maker Faire, Georgetown Carnival, SOAK (a Portland area event) and have also taken it to Burning Man in 2014.    We need your help! We want to keep growing this dream. Currently, all of our rope panels are made from 1/4 inch nylon, and we attach it to scaffolding. We want to get away from renting scaffolding every time we set Web of Dreams up, and we want to use materials that are renewable.The ultimate goal is to avoid an adverse environmental impact when burning it. So we put our heads together and came up with the idea for some pretty amazing, super durable, easily transportable (collapsible!!) trees! Who doesn't love hanging in a hammock in the trees?
We have also found some pretty incredible nylon rope alternatives in hemp and cotton. The thing is, we need A LOT of it! About 60k feet! Cotton is going to be cheaper and softer, but hemp is stronger. Transporting and storing Web of Dreams also brings it's own problems, and we would love to have a box truck dedicated to that. The easier we can make the storing and (especially) transporting, the more events we can go to!
So here is how what we are asking for breaks down:
Trees - Our central tree will be around $600-700. The outer 6 trees will be $1000-1100 (if we use OSB plywood). Cost for smaller trees is based upon 6 trees 12' tall no wider than 8' at base, with a central 4x4 post all the panels attach to.               Total - $7300

Rope - $127.78/spool of cotton rope (1200 ft/spool) - $6,389
                                  -or-
              $123.72/spool of hemp rope (600 ft/spool) -  $12,372
Stretch Goals:
Box Truck - No more than $3,000 we hope! We don't need anything fancy or brand new, just in good enough shape that it's a worthy investment. We know mechanics that can make sure it runs well, and we have a place for the box truck to live already.
What's in it for you?

 
We have some mega sweet perks for you! Seriously, we have so much awesome stuff to offer, and a lot of it can be custom just for you!
